<li class="expanded menu-fields-menu-link dropdown menu-link-collaborate-"><a href="/collaborate" class="dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown" data-target="#">Collaborate <span class="fa fa-caret-down"></span></a><ul class="dropdown-menu">  <li class="openberkeley-megamenu-wrapper">
    <div class="entity entity-menu-fields menu-fields-main-menu openberkeley-megamenu clearfix">
      <div class="container-fluid">
        <div class="row">
          <div class="col-md-7 hidden-xs hidden-sm openberkeley-megamenu-content-column">
            <div class="field field-name-field-featured-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img class="openberkeley-megamenu" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/openberkeley_megamenu/public/aces-loop-12-ol_v3_0.png?itok=9QecHK71&amp;timestamp=1470417270" width="308" height="205" alt="ACES logo" /></div></div></div>            <div class="field field-name-field-openberkeley-megamenu-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>We provide opportunities for students, faculty and community organizations to collaborate on research-based social justice projects through courses in our American Cultures Engaged Scholarship (ACES) Program.</p></div></div></div>          </div>
          <div class="col-md-5 openberkeley-megamenu-links-column">
            <ul class="menu nav"><li class="expanded menu-link-overview"><a href="/collaborate" aria-label="Overview of Collaborate">Overview</a></li>
<li class="first leaf menu-link-faculty-grants"><a href="/faculty/course-development/ac-faculty-grants" title="">Faculty Grants</a></li>
<li class="collapsed active menu-link-student-projects"><a href="/collaborate/aces-student-projects" title="" class="active">Student Projects</a></li>
<li class="collapsed menu-link-community-partners"><a href="/collaborate/aces-community-partners">Community Partners</a></li>
<li class="collapsed menu-link-american-cultures-engaged-scholarship"><a href="/collaborate/american-cultures-engaged-scholarship">American Cultures Engaged Scholarship</a></li>
<li class="last collapsed menu-link-events"><a href="http://events.berkeley.edu/index.php/calendar/sn/ac.html" title="" rel="noreferrer">Events</a></li>
</ul>          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </li>
</ul></li>
<li class="expanded menu-fields-menu-link dropdown menu-link-archives-"><a href="/events" title="" class="dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown" data-target="#">Archives <span class="fa fa-caret-down"></span></a><ul class="dropdown-menu">  <li class="openberkeley-megamenu-wrapper">
    <div class="entity entity-menu-fields menu-fields-main-menu openberkeley-megamenu clearfix">
      <div class="container-fluid">
        <div class="row">
          <div class="col-md-7 hidden-xs hidden-sm openberkeley-megamenu-content-column">
            <div class="field field-name-field-featured-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img class="openberkeley-megamenu" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/openberkeley_megamenu/public/explore_0.png?itok=FkO49Eti&amp;timestamp=1469764514" width="308" height="205" alt="" /></div></div></div>            <div class="field field-name-field-openberkeley-megamenu-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>On our Archives page you will discover a repository of historical information for our center including reports, publications, past events, press releases, videos and AC milestones. </p></div></div></div>          </div>
          <div class="col-md-5 openberkeley-megamenu-links-column">
            <ul class="menu nav"><li class="expanded menu-link-overview"><a href="/events" title="" aria-label="Overview of Archives">Overview</a></li>
<li class="first leaf menu-link-history-of-ac"><a href="/archives/history-american-cultures">History of AC</a></li>
<li class="leaf menu-link-newsletters"><a href="/archives/newsletters">Newsletters</a></li>
<li class="collapsed menu-link-events"><a href="/archives/events">Events</a></li>
<li class="leaf menu-link-press-releases"><a href="/archives/press-releases">Press Releases</a></li>
<li class="leaf menu-link-publications"><a href="/archives/publications">Publications</a></li>
<li class="last leaf menu-link-reports"><a href="/archives/reports">Reports</a></li>
</ul>          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </li>
</ul></li>
<li class="last leaf menu-link-contact-us"><a href="/contact">Contact Us</a></li>
            </ul>
                  </div>
        <div id="secondary-nav">
          <div class="container">

<div id="main-wrapper" class="main-wrapper">
    <div id="pre-content" class="container">
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-md-12">
                        <div id="page-header">

    <div id="main-content" class="clearfix">
        <div id="content" class="">
      <div id="main" class="main" role="main" tabIndex="-1">
        <div id="main-inner">
            <div class="region region-content">
    
<div class="panel-display pond clearfix radix-pond-hero mvpcreator-theme-full-width" >

    <div class="mvpcreator-theme-container-full-width">
      <div class="row">
      <div class="col-sm-12 radix-layouts-hero panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vid-1044 pane-bundle-openberkeley-widgets-band pane-fpid-253 clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="openberkeley-widgets-band fieldable-panels-pane openberkeley-widgets-color-scheme-golden-gate">
    <div class="openberkeley-widgets-label">
    <div class="openberkeley-widgets-label-inner container">
      <h2>#BerkeleyACES: Student Projects</h2>
    </div>
  </div>
</div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>

    </div>
  <div class="container">
      <div class="row">
      <div class="col-sm-12 radix-layouts-header panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vid-929 pane-bundle-text pane-fpid-264 clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-basic-text-text field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p style="text-align:center"><strong><em><span>"I come from the community we were studying in this class, but rather than a problem to be viewed through a microscope, I was finally able to hear the wisdom of my community, listen to their ideas, think with my peers about how our academic work can approach my community's needs."</span></em></strong></p></div></div></div></div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
<div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vuuid-4d9be4f3-43ee-4670-a25b-25e5b98673b4 pane-bundle-text clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-basic-text-text field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/aces_courses_udpated8.7.2017_0.pdf">American Cultures Engaged Scholarship (ACES) courses</a> offer students and faculty the opportunity to work with community organizations to develop cutting edge research projects associated with some of the nation's most pressing social issues. The following are a selection of the powerful projects growing from the collaborative understanding and effort developed in UC Berkeley's ACES courses:</p></div></div></div></div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-sm-4 radix-layouts-column1 panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vid-2245 pane-bundle-text pane-fpid-664 clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-basic-text-text field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/collaborate/student-projects/anthropology"><img alt="" title="" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/panopoly_image_original/public/anthropologyaces.jpg?itok=H8NxtYWj&amp;timestamp=1476139346"></a></p></div></div></div></div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
<div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vid-2248 pane-bundle-image pane-fpid-376 clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-basic-image-caption field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/collaborate/student-projects/asian-american-studies"><img alt="" title="" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/panopoly_image_original/public/asianamericanstudiesaces-lowquality.jpg?itok=uMwwYkIC&amp;timestamp=1476141022"></a></p></div></div></div></div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
<div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vuuid-9dde3765-0ac3-4911-94b0-57035fa66e25 pane-bundle-basic-file clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-basic-file-text field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/collaborate/student-projects/chicanao-latinao-studies"><img alt="" title="" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/panopoly_image_original/public/chicanxlatinxstudiesaces-lowquality.jpg?itok=7HFJMeKw&amp;timestamp=1476142106"></a></p></div></div></div></div>
  </div>

  
  </div>

  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-basic-image-caption field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/collaborate/student-projects/college-writing"><img alt="" title="" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/panopoly_image_original/public/collegewritingaces-lowquality.png?itok=sRxxvJ1c&amp;timestamp=1476143321"></a></p></div></div></div></div>

  </div>

<li class="last collapsed menu-link-events"><a href="http://events.berkeley.edu/index.php/calendar/sn/ac.html" title="" rel="noreferrer">Events</a></li>
</ul>          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </li>
</ul></li>
<li class="expanded menu-fields-menu-link dropdown menu-link-archives-"><a href="/events" title="" class="dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown" data-target="#">Archives <span class="fa fa-caret-down"></span></a><ul class="dropdown-menu">  <li class="openberkeley-megamenu-wrapper">
    <div class="entity entity-menu-fields menu-fields-main-menu openberkeley-megamenu clearfix">
      <div class="container-fluid">
        <div class="row">
          <div class="col-md-7 hidden-xs hidden-sm openberkeley-megamenu-content-column">
            <div class="field field-name-field-featured-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img class="openberkeley-megamenu" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/openberkeley_megamenu/public/explore_0.png?itok=FkO49Eti&amp;timestamp=1469764514" width="308" height="205" alt="" /></div></div></div>            <div class="field field-name-field-openberkeley-megamenu-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>On our Archives page you will discover a repository of historical information for our center including reports, publications, past events, press releases, videos and AC milestones. </p></div></div></div>          </div>
          <div class="col-md-5 openberkeley-megamenu-links-column">
            <ul class="menu nav"><li class="expanded menu-link-overview"><a href="/events" title="" aria-label="Overview of Archives">Overview</a></li>

<div id="main-wrapper" class="main-wrapper">
    <div id="pre-content" class="container">
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-md-12">
                  <div id="breadcrumb" class="visible-desktop">
            <h2 class="element-invisible">You are here</h2><div class="item-list"><ul class="breadcrumb"><li class="first"><a href="/home">Home</a></li>

                          <div class="page-title">
            <div class="container">
              <h1 class="title">Assistance in Advising Students</h1>
            </div>
          </div>
                <div id="page-header">
                                      </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div> <!-- /#pre-content -->
    <div id="main-content" class="container">
        <div id="content" class="col-md-9 col-md-push-3">
      <div id="main" class="main" role="main" tabIndex="-1">
        <div id="main-inner">
            <div class="region region-content">
    
<div class="panel-display boxton clearfix radix-boxton" id="page-page">

  <div class="container-fluid">
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-md-12 radix-layouts-content panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-node-content"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <article class="node node-openberkeley-content-page clearfix">

  
      
  
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><h2><span style="color:#333333">Informing Students on the AC Requirement</span></h2>
<p><span style="color:#333333">The American Cultures (AC) Center is extremely grateful for your support of the AC curriculum. The advice you provide to students about AC helps prepare them for the exciting opportunities within this unique UC Berkeley curriculum. And in recognizing that critical role, we would like to share some information about, and opportunities in, the AC curriculum.</span></p>
<p><span><span><span>In its almost three decades of existence, AC has become the campus's signature curriculum, and is now offered <span>across over 40 departments and programs on campus, from the arts and humanities to the physical sciences. </span>The AC curriculum is uniquely designed to offer students the opportunitiy to learn about topics as varied and including environmental justice, human rights and digital technologies, mass incarceration, language and literacy, educational inequality, andevolutionary biology.</span></span></span></p>
<p><span><span><span><span>The curriculum is constantly developing, with new course additions addded each semester aimed at fostering critical conversations on the role that our diverse communities play in shaping the past, present and future of the nation. To help tell this story, the historical roots and contemporary shoots of the AC curriculum have now been captured in a short introductory video which is available on our </span><a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/archives/history-american-cultures">History of AC page</a><span>.</span></span></span></span></p>
<p></p>
<h2>Fulfilling the Requirement</h2>
<p>To fulfill the AC requirement, students must complete an AC course of at least 3 semester units,and receive a grade of at least a C- or "Pass". </p>
<p>Students may complete an AC course at a community college or partner institution, although we highly recommend that students take the course on the Berkeley campus, for it is part of the unique Berkeley experience. To find a list of approved courses, please visit our <a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/students-and-advisors/courses" rel="noreferrer">Courses</a> page.</p>
<p>In addition, students may petition for a non-AC course to be approved by the Academic Senate for credit. Although a a course may "feel" like an AC course, does not mean that it will satisfy the requirement. The Academic Senate carefully reviews every petition to ensure that the course aligns with the guidelines that make up an AC course. For more information about this process, students can visit our <a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/students-and-advisors/petition-process" rel="noreferrer">Petition Process</a> page. </p>
<h2>Services for Advisors</h2>
<p>If the information to support your advising of students is not found on this website, the AC Center staff are available to provide one-on-one consultations and also deliver presentations to college and department staff.  Please let us know if we can provide any support to you in this vital work (for example through hosting a brown bag discussion, providing a list of new AC courses and their details, or sending over some of our new ACES swag).  To do so, please email <a href="mailto:victoriarobbi@berkeley.edu" rel="noreferrer">americancultures@berkeley.edu<span><span class="element-invisible">(link sends e-mail)</span></span></a>.</p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
</article>
  </div>

  
  </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>

</div><!-- /.boxton -->
  </div>
        </div>
      </div> <!-- /#main -->
    </div> <!-- /#content -->

                  <div id="breadcrumb" class="visible-desktop">

                          <div class="page-title">
            <div class="container">
              <h1 class="title">Opportunities for Students</h1>
            </div>
          </div>
                <div id="page-header">
                                      </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div> <!-- /#pre-content -->
    <div id="main-content" class="container">
        <div id="content" class="col-md-9 col-md-push-3">
      <div id="main" class="main" role="main" tabIndex="-1">
        <div id="main-inner">
            <div class="region region-content">
    
<div class="panel-display boxton clearfix radix-boxton" id="page-page">

  <div class="container-fluid">
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-md-12 radix-layouts-content panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-node-content"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <article class="node node-openberkeley-content-page clearfix">

  
      
  
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><h2>American Cultures Engaged Scholarship (ACES) Courses</h2>
<p>The sooner<em> </em>a student takes an AC course (or perhaps their first of many) the better.  Many students find that an AC course helps them discover their intellectual passion while at UC Berkeley.  And some AC courses, known as ACES courses, explicitly connect students to community partner organizations addressing issues crucial to our communities. ACES courses offer direct service placements and related research projects, defined by community partners and faculty in the development of an ACES course. In this way, students are able to study and learn directly from community partners and engage in activities which create sustainable change. For example, students have developed and participated in the following projects as part of their ACES courses: working with the Wikipedia Foundation and community partners to develop Wikipedia pages; mentoring underserved youth; Deferred Action for Early Child Arrivals (DACA) workshops; anthropology excavations in New Mexico; a Hip Hop Mixtape with Richmond Youth video projects, amongst others. For examples of these projects, please visit the <a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/collaborate/aces-student-projects">Students Projects page.<br></a></p>
<p>For a list of previous and current community partners, please visit the <a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/community-engagement/aces-community-partners" rel="noreferrer">community organizations page</a>.</p>
<h2>Other Student Opportunities</h2>
<p>As you will read throughout our website, there are many opportunities available to students not limited to completing their AC requirement.  Some include the <a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/students-and-advisors/student-prize" rel="noreferrer">Student Prize</a>, an award students may receive for their work in AC course, participating as a member of our <a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/students/student-advisory-board" rel="noreferrer">Student Advisory Board</a>, and work study opportunities we post on this website.</p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
</article>
  </div>

  
  </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>

</div><!-- /.boxton -->
  </div>
        </div>

        <div class="row">
          <div class="col-md-7 hidden-xs hidden-sm openberkeley-megamenu-content-column">
            <div class="field field-name-field-featured-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img class="openberkeley-megamenu" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/openberkeley_megamenu/public/dsc_0009_.jpg?itok=89jjT_SB&amp;timestamp=1470417155" width="308" height="205" alt="" /></div></div></div>            <div class="field field-name-field-openberkeley-megamenu-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Students may take advantage of our programming by taking courses offered across campus, being a member of our Student Advisory Board or applying for the Student Prize for projects they develop in their AC courses. </p></div></div></div>          </div>
          <div class="col-md-5 openberkeley-megamenu-links-column">

<li class="expanded menu-fields-menu-link dropdown menu-link-advisors-"><a href="/info-advisors" title="" class="dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown" data-target="#">Advisors <span class="fa fa-caret-down"></span></a><ul class="dropdown-menu">  <li class="openberkeley-megamenu-wrapper">
    <div class="entity entity-menu-fields menu-fields-main-menu openberkeley-megamenu clearfix">
      <div class="container-fluid">
        <div class="row">
          <div class="col-md-7 hidden-xs hidden-sm openberkeley-megamenu-content-column">
            <div class="field field-name-field-featured-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img class="openberkeley-megamenu" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/openberkeley_megamenu/public/lsadvising2_finkle_nancy.jpg?itok=IrLURM54&amp;timestamp=1471552543" width="308" height="205" alt="College advisor counseling student " /></div></div></div>            <div class="field field-name-field-openberkeley-megamenu-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Our staff recognizes the critical role you play in advising students for exciting opportunities in this unique curriculum.  On this section, you will find information to advise students on the AC Requirement.  </p></div></div></div>          </div>
          <div class="col-md-5 openberkeley-megamenu-links-column">
            <ul class="menu nav"><li class="expanded menu-link-overview"><a href="/info-advisors" title="" aria-label="Overview of Advisors">Overview</a></li>
<li class="first leaf menu-link-assistance-in-advising-students"><a href="/advisors/assistance-advising-students">Assistance in Advising Students</a></li>
<li class="last leaf menu-link-opportunities-for-students"><a href="/advisors/opportunities-students">Opportunities for Students</a></li>
</ul>          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </li>
</ul></li>
<li class="expanded menu-fields-menu-link dropdown menu-link-faculty-"><a href="/faculty" title="" class="dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown" data-target="#">Faculty <span class="fa fa-caret-down"></span></a><ul class="dropdown-menu">  <li class="openberkeley-megamenu-wrapper">
    <div class="entity entity-menu-fields menu-fields-main-menu openberkeley-megamenu clearfix">
      <div class="container-fluid">
        <div class="row">
          <div class="col-md-7 hidden-xs hidden-sm openberkeley-megamenu-content-column">
            <div class="field field-name-field-featured-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img class="openberkeley-megamenu" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/openberkeley_megamenu/public/shiftcourse_hero_836px_c.jpg?itok=A1pRkJrF&amp;timestamp=1469833877" width="308" height="205" alt="" /></div></div></div>            <div class="field field-name-field-openberkeley-megamenu-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>The American Cultures Center is proud to offer faculty exciting opportunities such as the possibility to receive a grant to continue, or create an American Cultures course, be awarded for excellence in teaching, and even become a Chancellor's Public Scholar! </p></div></div></div>          </div>
          <div class="col-md-5 openberkeley-megamenu-links-column">
            <ul class="menu nav"><li class="expanded menu-link-overview"><a href="/faculty" title="" aria-label="Overview of Faculty">Overview</a></li>
<li class="first collapsed menu-link-course-development-"><a href="/faculty/overview-faculty" title="">Course Development </a></li>
<li class="collapsed menu-link-faculty-grants"><a href="/faculty/faculty-grants">Faculty Grants</a></li>
<li class="collapsed menu-link-teaching-resources"><a href="/faculty/teaching-resources">Teaching Resources</a></li>
<li class="collapsed menu-link-innovation-in-teaching-award"><a href="/faculty/innovation-teaching-award">Innovation in Teaching Award</a></li>
<li class="last leaf menu-link-post-election-teaching-resources"><a href="/faculty/post-election-teaching-resources">Post-Election Teaching Resources</a></li>
</ul>          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </li>
</ul></li>
<li class="expanded menu-fields-menu-link dropdown menu-link-collaborate-"><a href="/collaborate" class="dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown" data-target="#">Collaborate <span class="fa fa-caret-down"></span></a><ul class="dropdown-menu">  <li class="openberkeley-megamenu-wrapper">
    <div class="entity entity-menu-fields menu-fields-main-menu openberkeley-megamenu clearfix">
      <div class="container-fluid">
        <div class="row">
          <div class="col-md-7 hidden-xs hidden-sm openberkeley-megamenu-content-column">
            <div class="field field-name-field-featured-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img class="openberkeley-megamenu" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/openberkeley_megamenu/public/aces-loop-12-ol_v3_0.png?itok=9QecHK71&amp;timestamp=1470417270" width="308" height="205" alt="ACES logo" /></div></div></div>            <div class="field field-name-field-openberkeley-megamenu-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>We provide opportunities for students, faculty and community organizations to collaborate on research-based social justice projects through courses in our American Cultures Engaged Scholarship (ACES) Program.</p></div></div></div>          </div>
          <div class="col-md-5 openberkeley-megamenu-links-column">
            <ul class="menu nav"><li class="expanded menu-link-overview"><a href="/collaborate" aria-label="Overview of Collaborate">Overview</a></li>
<li class="first leaf menu-link-faculty-grants"><a href="/faculty/course-development/ac-faculty-grants" title="">Faculty Grants</a></li>
<li class="collapsed active menu-link-student-projects"><a href="/collaborate/aces-student-projects" title="" class="active">Student Projects</a></li>
<li class="collapsed menu-link-community-partners"><a href="/collaborate/aces-community-partners">Community Partners</a></li>
<li class="collapsed menu-link-american-cultures-engaged-scholarship"><a href="/collaborate/american-cultures-engaged-scholarship">American Cultures Engaged Scholarship</a></li>
<li class="last collapsed menu-link-events"><a href="http://events.berkeley.edu/index.php/calendar/sn/ac.html" title="" rel="noreferrer">Events</a></li>
</ul>          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </li>
</ul></li>
<li class="expanded menu-fields-menu-link dropdown menu-link-archives-"><a href="/events" title="" class="dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown" data-target="#">Archives <span class="fa fa-caret-down"></span></a><ul class="dropdown-menu">  <li class="openberkeley-megamenu-wrapper">
    <div class="entity entity-menu-fields menu-fields-main-menu openberkeley-megamenu clearfix">
      <div class="container-fluid">
        <div class="row">
          <div class="col-md-7 hidden-xs hidden-sm openberkeley-megamenu-content-column">
            <div class="field field-name-field-featured-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img class="openberkeley-megamenu" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/openberkeley_megamenu/public/explore_0.png?itok=FkO49Eti&amp;timestamp=1469764514" width="308" height="205" alt="" /></div></div></div>            <div class="field field-name-field-openberkeley-megamenu-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>On our Archives page you will discover a repository of historical information for our center including reports, publications, past events, press releases, videos and AC milestones. </p></div></div></div>          </div>
          <div class="col-md-5 openberkeley-megamenu-links-column">
            <ul class="menu nav"><li class="expanded menu-link-overview"><a href="/events" title="" aria-label="Overview of Archives">Overview</a></li>

    <div class="mvpcreator-theme-container-full-width">
      <div class="row">
      <div class="col-sm-12 radix-layouts-hero panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vid-1044 pane-bundle-openberkeley-widgets-band pane-fpid-253 clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="openberkeley-widgets-band fieldable-panels-pane openberkeley-widgets-color-scheme-golden-gate">
    <div class="openberkeley-widgets-label">
    <div class="openberkeley-widgets-label-inner container">
      <h2>#BerkeleyACES: Student Projects</h2>
    </div>
  </div>
</div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>

    </div>
  <div class="container">
      <div class="row">
      <div class="col-sm-12 radix-layouts-header panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vid-929 pane-bundle-text pane-fpid-264 clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-basic-text-text field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p style="text-align:center"><strong><em><span>"I come from the community we were studying in this class, but rather than a problem to be viewed through a microscope, I was finally able to hear the wisdom of my community, listen to their ideas, think with my peers about how our academic work can approach my community's needs."</span></em></strong></p></div></div></div></div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
<div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vuuid-4d9be4f3-43ee-4670-a25b-25e5b98673b4 pane-bundle-text clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-basic-text-text field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/aces_courses_udpated8.7.2017_0.pdf">American Cultures Engaged Scholarship (ACES) courses</a> offer students and faculty the opportunity to work with community organizations to develop cutting edge research projects associated with some of the nation's most pressing social issues. The following are a selection of the powerful projects growing from the collaborative understanding and effort developed in UC Berkeley's ACES courses:</p></div></div></div></div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>

          </div> <!-- /#main-content -->

    <div class="entity entity-menu-fields menu-fields-main-menu openberkeley-megamenu clearfix">
      <div class="container-fluid">
        <div class="row">
          <div class="col-md-7 hidden-xs hidden-sm openberkeley-megamenu-content-column">
            <div class="field field-name-field-featured-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img class="openberkeley-megamenu" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/openberkeley_megamenu/public/dsc_0009_.jpg?itok=89jjT_SB&amp;timestamp=1470417155" width="308" height="205" alt="" /></div></div></div>            <div class="field field-name-field-openberkeley-megamenu-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Students may take advantage of our programming by taking courses offered across campus, being a member of our Student Advisory Board or applying for the Student Prize for projects they develop in their AC courses. </p></div></div></div>          </div>
          <div class="col-md-5 openberkeley-megamenu-links-column">
            <ul class="menu nav"><li class="expanded menu-link-overview"><a href="/students" title="" aria-label="Overview of Students">Overview</a></li>

<li class="expanded menu-fields-menu-link dropdown menu-link-advisors-"><a href="/info-advisors" title="" class="dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown" data-target="#">Advisors <span class="fa fa-caret-down"></span></a><ul class="dropdown-menu">  <li class="openberkeley-megamenu-wrapper">
    <div class="entity entity-menu-fields menu-fields-main-menu openberkeley-megamenu clearfix">
      <div class="container-fluid">
        <div class="row">
          <div class="col-md-7 hidden-xs hidden-sm openberkeley-megamenu-content-column">
            <div class="field field-name-field-featured-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img class="openberkeley-megamenu" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/openberkeley_megamenu/public/lsadvising2_finkle_nancy.jpg?itok=IrLURM54&amp;timestamp=1471552543" width="308" height="205" alt="College advisor counseling student " /></div></div></div>            <div class="field field-name-field-openberkeley-megamenu-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Our staff recognizes the critical role you play in advising students for exciting opportunities in this unique curriculum.  On this section, you will find information to advise students on the AC Requirement.  </p></div></div></div>          </div>
          <div class="col-md-5 openberkeley-megamenu-links-column">
            <ul class="menu nav"><li class="expanded menu-link-overview"><a href="/info-advisors" title="" aria-label="Overview of Advisors">Overview</a></li>

</ul>          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </li>
</ul></li>
<li class="expanded menu-fields-menu-link dropdown menu-link-faculty-"><a href="/faculty" title="" class="dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown" data-target="#">Faculty <span class="fa fa-caret-down"></span></a><ul class="dropdown-menu">  <li class="openberkeley-megamenu-wrapper">

          <div class="col-md-7 hidden-xs hidden-sm openberkeley-megamenu-content-column">
            <div class="field field-name-field-featured-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img class="openberkeley-megamenu" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/openberkeley_megamenu/public/shiftcourse_hero_836px_c.jpg?itok=A1pRkJrF&amp;timestamp=1469833877" width="308" height="205" alt="" /></div></div></div>            <div class="field field-name-field-openberkeley-megamenu-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>The American Cultures Center is proud to offer faculty exciting opportunities such as the possibility to receive a grant to continue, or create an American Cultures course, be awarded for excellence in teaching, and even become a Chancellor's Public Scholar! </p></div></div></div>          </div>
          <div class="col-md-5 openberkeley-megamenu-links-column">

<div id="main-wrapper" class="main-wrapper">
    <div id="pre-content" class="container">
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-md-12">
                  <div id="breadcrumb" class="visible-desktop">
            <h2 class="element-invisible">You are here</h2><div class="item-list"><ul class="breadcrumb"><li class="first"><a href="/home">Home</a></li>
<li><a href="/collaborate">Collaborate</a></li>
<li><a href="/collaborate/aces-student-projects" title="">Student Projects</a></li>
<li class="last">Anthropology</li>
</ul></div>          </div>
                          <div class="page-title">
            <div class="container">
              <h1 class="title">Anthropology</h1>
            </div>
          </div>
                <div id="page-header">
                                      </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div> <!-- /#pre-content -->
    <div id="main-content" class="container">
        <div id="content" class="col-md-9 col-md-push-3">
      <div id="main" class="main" role="main" tabIndex="-1">
        <div id="main-inner">
            <div class="region region-content">
    
<div class="panel-display pond clearfix radix-pond" id="page-page">

  <div class="container-fluid">
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-sm-12 radix-layouts-header panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-node-content"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <article class="node node-openberkeley-content-page clearfix">

  
      
  
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Anthropology 2AC - '<span>Introduction to Archaeology'<br></span>Instructor: Jun Senseri<br>Semester: Fall 2014 - Spring 2016</p>
<p></p>
<p>In Professor Jun Sunseri's ACES Course, Anthropology 2AC, 'Introduction to Archaeology,' students learn about the methods, goals, and theoretical concepts of archaeology by closely examining the impact of archaeology on and the history of the construction of various communities: the Native Americans, Latin Americans, and Euro-Americans.  This<span> course also explores professional and ethical problems affecting the practice of archaeology and the conservation, protection, and control of our nation's cultural resources.</span></p>
<p><span>As part of the community engagement component of this course, Professor Sunseri partners with a community organization in New Mexico, the Pueblo de Abiquiu Library and Cultural Center, to teach s</span><span>tudents about the importance of </span><span>historic structures in Abiquiu by </span><span>closely examining narratives of excavations.  After learning about the historical context of these sites, students work with the center </span><span>on excavations at the Pueblo de Abiquiu Library and Cultural Center. Students learn how to use archaeological tools to dig up a well and other structures, which they locate with the help of Professor Sunseri and the guidance of elders at the center. </span><span>More information about the project can be found on the </span><span><a href="http://abiquiupl.org/" rel="noreferrer">Pueblo de Abiquiu Library &amp; Cultural Center website</a></span><span>. </span></p>
<p><span>In addition, the ACES Program provided funding for the center to develop video clips for the Berkeley-Abiquiu Collaborative Archaeology (BACA) Project</span><span>. The clips show the excavation of the well while Professor Sunseri describes and analyzes their findings to build the narratives and understand history of the historical structures. Please click on the videos below for examples of students' work at the Abiquiu community partner site. </span></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
</article>
  </div>

  
  </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>

    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-sm-4 radix-layouts-column1 panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">

        <div class="row">
          <div class="col-md-7 hidden-xs hidden-sm openberkeley-megamenu-content-column">
            <div class="field field-name-field-featured-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img class="openberkeley-megamenu" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/openberkeley_megamenu/public/shiftcourse_hero_836px_c.jpg?itok=A1pRkJrF&amp;timestamp=1469833877" width="308" height="205" alt="" /></div></div></div>            <div class="field field-name-field-openberkeley-megamenu-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>The American Cultures Center is proud to offer faculty exciting opportunities such as the possibility to receive a grant to continue, or create an American Cultures course, be awarded for excellence in teaching, and even become a Chancellor's Public Scholar! </p></div></div></div>          </div>
          <div class="col-md-5 openberkeley-megamenu-links-column">
            <ul class="menu nav"><li class="expanded menu-link-overview"><a href="/faculty" title="" aria-label="Overview of Faculty">Overview</a></li>
<li class="first collapsed menu-link-course-development-"><a href="/faculty/overview-faculty" title="">Course Development </a></li>
<li class="collapsed menu-link-faculty-grants"><a href="/faculty/faculty-grants">Faculty Grants</a></li>
<li class="collapsed menu-link-teaching-resources"><a href="/faculty/teaching-resources">Teaching Resources</a></li>
<li class="collapsed menu-link-innovation-in-teaching-award"><a href="/faculty/innovation-teaching-award">Innovation in Teaching Award</a></li>
<li class="last leaf menu-link-post-election-teaching-resources"><a href="/faculty/post-election-teaching-resources">Post-Election Teaching Resources</a></li>
</ul>          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </li>
</ul></li>
<li class="expanded menu-fields-menu-link dropdown menu-link-collaborate-"><a href="/collaborate" class="dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown" data-target="#">Collaborate <span class="fa fa-caret-down"></span></a><ul class="dropdown-menu">  <li class="openberkeley-megamenu-wrapper">
    <div class="entity entity-menu-fields menu-fields-main-menu openberkeley-megamenu clearfix">
      <div class="container-fluid">
        <div class="row">
          <div class="col-md-7 hidden-xs hidden-sm openberkeley-megamenu-content-column">
            <div class="field field-name-field-featured-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img class="openberkeley-megamenu" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/openberkeley_megamenu/public/aces-loop-12-ol_v3_0.png?itok=9QecHK71&amp;timestamp=1470417270" width="308" height="205" alt="ACES logo" /></div></div></div>            <div class="field field-name-field-openberkeley-megamenu-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>We provide opportunities for students, faculty and community organizations to collaborate on research-based social justice projects through courses in our American Cultures Engaged Scholarship (ACES) Program.</p></div></div></div>          </div>
          <div class="col-md-5 openberkeley-megamenu-links-column">
            <ul class="menu nav"><li class="expanded menu-link-overview"><a href="/collaborate" aria-label="Overview of Collaborate">Overview</a></li>

<li class="last collapsed menu-link-events"><a href="http://events.berkeley.edu/index.php/calendar/sn/ac.html" title="" rel="noreferrer">Events</a></li>
</ul>          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </li>
</ul></li>
<li class="expanded menu-fields-menu-link dropdown menu-link-archives-"><a href="/events" title="" class="dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown" data-target="#">Archives <span class="fa fa-caret-down"></span></a><ul class="dropdown-menu">  <li class="openberkeley-megamenu-wrapper">
    <div class="entity entity-menu-fields menu-fields-main-menu openberkeley-megamenu clearfix">

          <div class="col-md-7 hidden-xs hidden-sm openberkeley-megamenu-content-column">
            <div class="field field-name-field-featured-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img class="openberkeley-megamenu" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/openberkeley_megamenu/public/explore_0.png?itok=FkO49Eti&amp;timestamp=1469764514" width="308" height="205" alt="" /></div></div></div>            <div class="field field-name-field-openberkeley-megamenu-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>On our Archives page you will discover a repository of historical information for our center including reports, publications, past events, press releases, videos and AC milestones. </p></div></div></div>          </div>

<div id="main-wrapper" class="main-wrapper">
    <div id="pre-content" class="container">
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-md-12">
                  <div id="breadcrumb" class="visible-desktop">
            <h2 class="element-invisible">You are here</h2><div class="item-list"><ul class="breadcrumb"><li class="first"><a href="/home">Home</a></li>
<li><a href="/collaborate">Collaborate</a></li>

<li class="last">Asian American Studies</li>
</ul></div>          </div>
                          <div class="page-title">
            <div class="container">
              <h1 class="title">Asian American Studies</h1>
            </div>
          </div>
                <div id="page-header">
                                      </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div> <!-- /#pre-content -->
    <div id="main-content" class="container">
        <div id="content" class="col-md-9 col-md-push-3">
      <div id="main" class="main" role="main" tabIndex="-1">
        <div id="main-inner">
            <div class="region region-content">
    
<div class="panel-display sutro-double clearfix radix-sutro-double" id="page-page">

  <div class="container-fluid">
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-sm-12 radix-layouts-header panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-node-content"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <article class="node node-openberkeley-content-page clearfix">

  
      
  
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><span>Asian American Studies 132AC - '<span>Islamophobia and Constructing Otherness'<br></span></span><span>Instructor: Hatem Bazian<br></span><span>Semester: Spring 2015</span></p>
<p><span>Dr. Hatem Bazian's​ ​Asian American Studies 132AC​ ​ACES Course, 'Islamophobia and Constructing Otherness​,​'​ ​was​ ​designed three years ago​ ​to help students understand and combat institutionalized ​​racism, focusing on Islamophobia, its origins and progression, and the principle of "otherness": accepting and recognizing differences in others. ​</span></p>
<p><span>​As part of the engaged scholarship component, students ​in this ACES course ​create a series of websites to inform the ​online ​community beyond the classroom of Islamophobia and institutionalized racism. ​Students create  websites ​​cover​ing​ a range of topics, beginning with the origin of the term "Islamophobia" ​to its progression and ​and expansion in the media,​ Hollywood, airports, and ​the ​law.​  </span></p>
<p><span>​T​he goal of th​is​ course and ​of these websites is ​to bring greater online awareness about Islamophobia in the United States​, and combat Islamophobia and institutionalized racism. To learn more about Islamophobia and to join the fight against institutionalized racism, ​please ​click on the links below. </span></p>
<p></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
</article>
  </div>

  
  </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>

    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-sm-6 radix-layouts-column1 panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vid-828 pane-bundle-text pane-fpid-272 clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-basic-text-text field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p style="text-align:center"><strong><a href="http://aas132.weebly.com/" rel="noreferrer">Islamophobia in Hollywood</a></strong></p></div></div></div></div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
<div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vid-832 pane-bundle-image pane-fpid-266 clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-basic-image-caption field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><a href="http://aas132.weebly.com/" rel="noreferrer"><img alt="" title="" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/panopoly_image_original/public/screen_shot_2016-07-20_at_3.26.27_pm.png?itok=nNHQLmmU&amp;timestamp=1469054888"></a></p></div></div></div></div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
        </div>
      </div>
      <div class="col-sm-6 radix-layouts-column2 panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vid-829 pane-bundle-text pane-fpid-273 clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-basic-text-text field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p style="text-align:center"><strong><a href="http://islamophobiainairports.weebly.com/" rel="noreferrer">Islamophobia in Airports</a></strong></p></div></div></div></div>
  </div>

  
  </div>

  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-basic-text-text field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><a href="http://islamophobiainairports.weebly.com/" rel="noreferrer"><img alt="" title="" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/panopoly_image_original/public/screen_shot_2016-07-20_at_3.26.48_pm.png?itok=mwXYFW1a&amp;timestamp=1469054953"></a></p></div></div></div></div>

            <ul class="menu nav"><li class="expanded menu-link-overview"><a href="/collaborate" aria-label="Overview of Collaborate">Overview</a></li>

<li class="last collapsed menu-link-events"><a href="http://events.berkeley.edu/index.php/calendar/sn/ac.html" title="" rel="noreferrer">Events</a></li>
</ul>          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </li>
</ul></li>
<li class="expanded menu-fields-menu-link dropdown menu-link-archives-"><a href="/events" title="" class="dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown" data-target="#">Archives <span class="fa fa-caret-down"></span></a><ul class="dropdown-menu">  <li class="openberkeley-megamenu-wrapper">
    <div class="entity entity-menu-fields menu-fields-main-menu openberkeley-megamenu clearfix">
      <div class="container-fluid">
        <div class="row">
          <div class="col-md-7 hidden-xs hidden-sm openberkeley-megamenu-content-column">
            <div class="field field-name-field-featured-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img class="openberkeley-megamenu" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/openberkeley_megamenu/public/explore_0.png?itok=FkO49Eti&amp;timestamp=1469764514" width="308" height="205" alt="" /></div></div></div>            <div class="field field-name-field-openberkeley-megamenu-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>On our Archives page you will discover a repository of historical information for our center including reports, publications, past events, press releases, videos and AC milestones. </p></div></div></div>          </div>
          <div class="col-md-5 openberkeley-megamenu-links-column">
            <ul class="menu nav"><li class="expanded menu-link-overview"><a href="/events" title="" aria-label="Overview of Archives">Overview</a></li>

                          <div class="page-title">
            <div class="container">
              <h1 class="title">Chicana/o &amp; Latina/o Studies </h1>
            </div>
          </div>
                <div id="page-header">
                                      </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div> <!-- /#pre-content -->
    <div id="main-content" class="container">
        <div id="content" class="col-md-9 col-md-push-3">
      <div id="main" class="main" role="main" tabIndex="-1">
        <div id="main-inner">
            <div class="region region-content">
    
<div class="panel-display sutro clearfix radix-sutro" id="page-page">

  <div class="container-fluid">
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-sm-12 radix-layouts-header panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-node-content"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <article class="node node-openberkeley-content-page clearfix">

  
      
  
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p style="text-align:center"><strong>Chicana/o &amp; Latina/o Studies</strong> </p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
</article>
  </div>

  
  </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-sm-6 radix-layouts-column1 panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vuuid-e8915a17-d523-4838-b1d0-b067b6b58f0e pane-bundle-basic-file clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-basic-file-text field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><img style="display:block; margin-left:auto; margin-right:auto" alt="" title="" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/panopoly_image_original/public/chicanostudiescropped.png?itok=MJfCB1k9&amp;timestamp=1492555683"></p></div></div></div></div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
<div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vid-2439 pane-bundle-openberkeley-widgets-promo pane-fpid-706 clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="openberkeley-widgets-promo fieldable-panels-pane openberkeley-widgets-color-scheme-web-medalist">
      <a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/collaborate/student-projects/chicanao-latinao-studies/chicanao-studies-180ac" class="openberkeley-widgets-image-link">
    <div class="openberkeley-widgets-label">
    <div class="openberkeley-widgets-label-inner">
      <h3>Chicano Studies 180AC</h3>
              <p>Topics in Chicano Studies</p>
          </div>
  </div>
    </a>
  </div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
<div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vid-2447 pane-bundle-text pane-fpid-708 clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-basic-text-text field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>In honor of Yolo County's approval of the K-12 Ethnic Studies Program, ACES students from Celia Rodriguez's Chicano Studies 180AC participated in an art exhibit titled "<em>All People Celebrate Ethnic Studies Today &amp; Tomorrow" ..... </em><strong><a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/collaborate/student-projects/chicanao-latinao-studies/chicanao-studies-180ac">Read more</a> </strong></p></div></div></div></div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
        </div>
      </div>
      <div class="col-sm-6 radix-layouts-column2 panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vid-2450 pane-bundle-basic-file pane-fpid-711 clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-basic-file-text field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><img style="display:block; margin-left:auto; margin-right:auto" alt="" title="" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/panopoly_image_original/public/unnamed_0.jpg?itok=pBWmisnC&amp;timestamp=1492555720"></p></div></div></div></div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
<div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vid-2440 pane-bundle-openberkeley-widgets-promo pane-fpid-707 clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="openberkeley-widgets-promo fieldable-panels-pane openberkeley-widgets-color-scheme-web-medalist">
      <a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/collaborate/student-projects/chicanao-latinao-studies/chicanao-studiesethnic-studies-147ac" class="openberkeley-widgets-image-link">
    <div class="openberkeley-widgets-label">
    <div class="openberkeley-widgets-label-inner">
      <h3>Ethnic Studies 143AC</h3>
              <p>Women of color in the United States</p>
          </div>
  </div>
    </a>
  </div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
<div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vid-2446 pane-bundle-text pane-fpid-709 clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-basic-text-text field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>In summer 2015, students from Professor Laura Perez's ACES Course, Chicana/o Studies/Ethnic Studies 147AC, 'Women of Color in the U.S. Through the Arts,' developed the art anthology, Silhouette Stories. Inspired by the readings and dialogues shared in the class .... <a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/collaborate/student-projects/chicanao-latinao-studies/chicanao-studiesethnic-studies-147ac"><strong>Read more</strong></a></p></div></div></div></div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>

                          <div class="page-title">
            <div class="container">
              <h1 class="title">Chicana/o Studies 180AC</h1>
            </div>
          </div>

        <div id="content" class="col-md-9 col-md-push-3">
      <div id="main" class="main" role="main" tabIndex="-1">
        <div id="main-inner">
            <div class="region region-content">
    
<div class="panel-display sutro clearfix radix-sutro" id="page-page">

  <div class="container-fluid">
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-sm-12 radix-layouts-header panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-node-content"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <article class="node node-openberkeley-content-page clearfix">

  
      
  
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><img style="float:right" alt="" title="" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/panopoly_image_original/public/unnamed.jpg?itok=R4R5PDZW&amp;timestamp=1490225576"></p>
<p><span><span>Chicano Studies 180 - Topics in Chicano Studies<br></span></span>Instructor: Celia Rodriguez<br>Semester: Spring 2017</p>
<p><span><span>In honor of Yolo County's approval of the K-12 Ethnic Studies Program, ACES students from Celia Rodriguez's Chicano </span></span>Studies 180AC participated in an art exhibit titled "<em>All People Celebrate Ethnic Studies Today &amp; Tomorrow" </em>at Pioneer High School in Woodland, CA on March 4th, 2017.  </p>
<p></p>
<p>For this exhibit, ACES students developed and led a workshop entitled <em>ArtE</em><em> of Storytelling with Heart &amp; Vision</em>. Students also worked with Gilda Posada, an artist and graduate student at UC Davis in the MFA in Visual Art and MA in Visual Criticism Program in printing the silkscreened paintings.</p>
<p></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
</article>
  </div>

  
  </div>
<div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vuuid-dd8edf2b-f512-475b-9bde-6fb5b9dd9482 pane-bundle-image clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-basic-image-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img class="openberkeley-image-full" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/openberkeley_image_full/public/general/unnamed_1.jpg?itok=hWjvfXl5&amp;timestamp=1490225437" alt="" /></div></div></div></div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>

<div id="main-wrapper" class="main-wrapper">
    <div id="pre-content" class="container">
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-md-12">
                  <div id="breadcrumb" class="visible-desktop">
            <h2 class="element-invisible">You are here</h2><div class="item-list"><ul class="breadcrumb"><li class="first"><a href="/home">Home</a></li>
<li><a href="/collaborate">Collaborate</a></li>
<li><a href="/collaborate/aces-student-projects" title="">Student Projects</a></li>
<li><a href="/collaborate/student-projects/chicanao-latinao-studies">Chicana/o &amp; Latina/o Studies</a></li>
<li class="last">Chicana/o Studies/Ethnic Studies  147AC</li>
</ul></div>          </div>
                          <div class="page-title">
            <div class="container">
              <h1 class="title">Chicana/o Studies/Ethnic Studies  147AC</h1>
            </div>
          </div>
                <div id="page-header">
                                      </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div> <!-- /#pre-content -->
    <div id="main-content" class="container">
        <div id="content" class="col-md-9 col-md-push-3">
      <div id="main" class="main" role="main" tabIndex="-1">
        <div id="main-inner">
            <div class="region region-content">
    
<div class="panel-display sutro clearfix radix-sutro" id="page-page">

  <div class="container-fluid">
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-sm-12 radix-layouts-header panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-node-content"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <article class="node node-openberkeley-content-page clearfix">

  
      
  
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><span>Chicana/o Studies / Ethnic Studies 147AC - '<span>Women of Color in the United States'<br></span></span><span>Instructor: Laura Perez<br></span><span>Semester: Summer 2015</span></p>
<p><span>In summer 2015, students from Professor Laura Perez's ACES Course, Chicana/o Studies/Ethnic Studies 147AC, 'Women of Color in the U.S. Through the Arts,' developed the art anthology, Silhouette Stories. Inspired by the readings and dialogues shared in the class, students compile their personal accounts and visions to create Silhouette Stories. Their stories illustrate the volatility and complexity of identity as well as the suppressions and struggles they experience based on their personal identities. </span></p>
<p><span>Despite their hardships, students find strength and growth in their identity and empowerment in storytelling: “We write as (in) visibilized subjects attempting to be seen, heard, and understood. We welcome you to embark on this journey of (re) membering, (re) mapping, and (re) presenting.”</span></p>
<p>Below are sample images from the zine. To read it in its entirety and learn about the students' narratives and experiences., please <a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/silhouette_stories._final_draft.pdf">download a pdf</a>. </p>
<p></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
</article>
  </div>

  
  </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-sm-6 radix-layouts-column1 panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vuuid-b0ce51aa-1489-416b-818b-30a7b07e6a94 pane-bundle-image clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">

    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-md-12">
                  <div id="breadcrumb" class="visible-desktop">
            <h2 class="element-invisible">You are here</h2><div class="item-list"><ul class="breadcrumb"><li class="first"><a href="/home">Home</a></li>

                          <div class="page-title">
            <div class="container">
              <h1 class="title">College Writing</h1>
            </div>
          </div>
                <div id="page-header">
                                      </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div> <!-- /#pre-content -->
    <div id="main-content" class="container">
        <div id="content" class="col-md-9 col-md-push-3">
      <div id="main" class="main" role="main" tabIndex="-1">
        <div id="main-inner">
            <div class="region region-content">
    
<div class="panel-display boxton clearfix radix-boxton" id="page-page">

  <div class="container-fluid">
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-md-12 radix-layouts-content panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-node-content"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <article class="node node-openberkeley-content-page clearfix">

  
      
  
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><div>College Writing 50/150AC - 'Researching Water in the West'</div>
<div>Instructor: Pat Steenland</div>
<div>Semester: Spring 2015 - Present</div>
<div><br><br></div>
<div>In College Writing (CW) 50/150AC, students learn of a history that is absent from the popular narrative of the California 'water wars,' <span>— the Paiute Native Americans who for hundreds of years developed a sophisticated system of irrigation canals that made the valley bloom.  Their history was erased from the site's history by people who waged economic and land wars to control water rights. A primary goal in this class is to study these peoples through a shared experience: how their stories intersect through their connection to this contested resource. The course proposes an integrative narrative drawn from California history to look at particular issues of race, culture, and ethnicity.<br><br></span>In 2011, Jenna Cavelle enrolled in CW 50AC/150AC, "Researching Water in the West."  Through an ongoing community partnership in the ACES class, Researching Water in the West (CW 50/150AC), this fascinating history will be presented by a Paiute tribal member, Berkeley faculty, the Bancroft Curator and a former AC student, whose lives have been changed by unearthing and exploring this story. After four years of research in the Owens Valley with the Bishop Paiute, Cavelle developed the documentary "<a href="http://payathemovie.com/synopsis" rel="noreferrer">Paya, the Water Story of the Paiute</a>", winner of the Best Short Documentary at the 2015 <a href="http://www.rednationff.com/" rel="noreferrer">Red Nation Film Festival.</a> Below is the trailer of this film.
<p></p>
</div></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
</article>
  </div>

  
  </div>
<div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vuuid-ba06fa13-f299-48ea-8d4e-58809a3f2127 pane-bundle-video clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-video-file field-type-file field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><div id="file-81" class="file file-video file-video-vimeo">

        <h2 class="element-hidden"><a href="/file/81">PAYA trailer</a></h2>
    
  
  <div class="content">
    <div class="media-vimeo-video media-vimeo-1">
  <iframe class="media-vimeo-player" id="media-vimeo-125057043" width="640" height="360" title="PAYA trailer" src="//player.vimeo.com/video/125057043?api=1&player_id=media-vimeo-125057043&color=" allowfullscreen>Video of PAYA trailer</iframe>
</div>
  </div>

  
</div>
</div></div></div></div>
  </div>

<li class="expanded menu-fields-menu-link dropdown menu-link-faculty-"><a href="/faculty" title="" class="dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown" data-target="#">Faculty <span class="fa fa-caret-down"></span></a><ul class="dropdown-menu">  <li class="openberkeley-megamenu-wrapper">
    <div class="entity entity-menu-fields menu-fields-main-menu openberkeley-megamenu clearfix">
      <div class="container-fluid">
        <div class="row">
          <div class="col-md-7 hidden-xs hidden-sm openberkeley-megamenu-content-column">
            <div class="field field-name-field-featured-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img class="openberkeley-megamenu" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/openberkeley_megamenu/public/shiftcourse_hero_836px_c.jpg?itok=A1pRkJrF&amp;timestamp=1469833877" width="308" height="205" alt="" /></div></div></div>            <div class="field field-name-field-openberkeley-megamenu-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>The American Cultures Center is proud to offer faculty exciting opportunities such as the possibility to receive a grant to continue, or create an American Cultures course, be awarded for excellence in teaching, and even become a Chancellor's Public Scholar! </p></div></div></div>          </div>
          <div class="col-md-5 openberkeley-megamenu-links-column">
            <ul class="menu nav"><li class="expanded menu-link-overview"><a href="/faculty" title="" aria-label="Overview of Faculty">Overview</a></li>
<li class="first collapsed menu-link-course-development-"><a href="/faculty/overview-faculty" title="">Course Development </a></li>
<li class="collapsed menu-link-faculty-grants"><a href="/faculty/faculty-grants">Faculty Grants</a></li>

</ul>          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </li>
</ul></li>
<li class="expanded menu-fields-menu-link dropdown menu-link-collaborate-"><a href="/collaborate" class="dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown" data-target="#">Collaborate <span class="fa fa-caret-down"></span></a><ul class="dropdown-menu">  <li class="openberkeley-megamenu-wrapper">
    <div class="entity entity-menu-fields menu-fields-main-menu openberkeley-megamenu clearfix">
      <div class="container-fluid">
        <div class="row">
          <div class="col-md-7 hidden-xs hidden-sm openberkeley-megamenu-content-column">
            <div class="field field-name-field-featured-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img class="openberkeley-megamenu" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/openberkeley_megamenu/public/aces-loop-12-ol_v3_0.png?itok=9QecHK71&amp;timestamp=1470417270" width="308" height="205" alt="ACES logo" /></div></div></div>            <div class="field field-name-field-openberkeley-megamenu-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>We provide opportunities for students, faculty and community organizations to collaborate on research-based social justice projects through courses in our American Cultures Engaged Scholarship (ACES) Program.</p></div></div></div>          </div>
          <div class="col-md-5 openberkeley-megamenu-links-column">
            <ul class="menu nav"><li class="expanded menu-link-overview"><a href="/collaborate" aria-label="Overview of Collaborate">Overview</a></li>

<div id="main-wrapper" class="main-wrapper">
    <div id="pre-content" class="container">
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-md-12">
                  <div id="breadcrumb" class="visible-desktop">
            <h2 class="element-invisible">You are here</h2><div class="item-list"><ul class="breadcrumb"><li class="first"><a href="/home">Home</a></li>
<li><a href="/collaborate">Collaborate</a></li>
<li><a href="/collaborate/aces-student-projects" title="">Student Projects</a></li>
<li class="last">Engineering for Social Change</li>
</ul></div>          </div>
                          <div class="page-title">
            <div class="container">
              <h1 class="title">Engineering for Social Change</h1>
            </div>
          </div>
                <div id="page-header">
                                      </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div> <!-- /#pre-content -->
    <div id="main-content" class="container">
        <div id="content" class="col-md-9 col-md-push-3">
      <div id="main" class="main" role="main" tabIndex="-1">
        <div id="main-inner">
            <div class="region region-content">
    
<div class="panel-display geary clearfix radix-geary" id="page-page">

  <div class="container-fluid">
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-sm-12 radix-layouts-header panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-node-content"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <article class="node node-openberkeley-content-page clearfix">

  
      
  
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Engineering/International and Area Studies 157AC - Engineering, The Environment and Society. <br><span>Instructor: Khalid Kadir<br></span>Semester: Spring 2015 - Spring 2017 </p>
<p>Dr. Khalid Kadir, leads a group of qualified engineering students in his ACES course, Engineering 157AC / International and Area Studies 157AC: Engineering, The Environment, and Society at UC Berkeley. The course challenges students to look beyond the technical elements of their work and recognize the deeply social and political nature of engineering questions. With help from Berkeley Ph.D. student and Chancellor's Public Fellow Lara Cushing, Dr. Kadir has established partnerships with local and regional African-American, Asian-American, and Latino community groups, through which students have the opportunity to engage in multiple real-world projects affecting these diverse communities. Projects address a variety of environmental and social justice issues including contaminated drinking water, industrial pollution, and air pollution.  Click below for the products of the students' and community partners' work:</p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
</article>
  </div>

  
  </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-sm-4 radix-layouts-column1 panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vuuid-4c3f8483-0ad6-4d18-8e15-9b18ec8c4a10 pane-bundle-image clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-basic-image-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img class="openberkeley-image-full" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/openberkeley_image_full/public/general/crlaguide.png?itok=iEYLztm_&amp;timestamp=1468971572" alt="" /></div></div></div></div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
        </div>
      </div>
      <div class="col-sm-4 radix-layouts-column2 panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vuuid-36d5043c-7aea-4270-9ac6-f24901cb3617 pane-bundle-image clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-basic-image-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img class="openberkeley-image-full" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/openberkeley_image_full/public/general/protectrichmond.png?itok=wi0Bh1Dx&amp;timestamp=1468971592" alt="" /></div></div></div></div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
        </div>
      </div>
      <div class="col-sm-4 radix-layouts-column3 panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vuuid-4f3c0a3c-f0c2-446a-8003-0bb0b9fa4633 pane-bundle-image clearfix"  >
