          <div class="panel-pane pane-node-content"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <article class="node node-openberkeley-content-page clearfix">

  
      
  
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><span>Ethnic Studies 135AC - Contemporary U.S Immigration<br></span><span>Instructor: Victoria Robinson <br></span><span>Semester: Fall 2015 </span></p>
<p><span>Professor Victoria Robinson's 'Contemporary U.S. Immigration' course (Ethnic Studies 135) covers the topic of immigration in the United States, debunking common myths about immigration, revealing the truth about immigration, and following the history of immigration to present day. One notable subject in the discussion of present day immigration is the program that President Obama has recently created: Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals (DACA).</span></p>
<p>The DACA program "defers removal action against" certain undocumented immigrants; it gives temporary protection. However, many eligible immigrants are unaware of the program or the application process. Robinson's undergraduate students created infographics in both English and Spanish in order to simplify and explain the process and guide undocumented immigrants in the process of applying for DACA. </p>
<p>Click on the images to learn about the process!</p>
<p></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
</article>
  </div>

  
  </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    
    <div class="row">

  </div>

    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-md-12">
                  <div id="breadcrumb" class="visible-desktop">
            <h2 class="element-invisible">You are here</h2><div class="item-list"><ul class="breadcrumb"><li class="first"><a href="/home">Home</a></li>

<li class="last">Geography</li>

                          <div class="page-title">
            <div class="container">
              <h1 class="title">Geography</h1>
            </div>
          </div>
                <div id="page-header">
                                      </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div> <!-- /#pre-content -->
    <div id="main-content" class="container">
        <div id="content" class="col-md-9 col-md-push-3">
      <div id="main" class="main" role="main" tabIndex="-1">
        <div id="main-inner">
            <div class="region region-content">
    
<div class="panel-display sutro clearfix radix-sutro" id="page-page">

  <div class="container-fluid">
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-sm-12 radix-layouts-header panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-node-content"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <article class="node node-openberkeley-content-page clearfix">

  
      
  
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><span><span>Geography 50AC - '<span>California'</span><br><span>Instructor: </span><span>Seth Lunine<br></span></span></span><span><span>Semester: Fall 2016</span></span></p>
<p><span>During the Fall of 2016, students with the UC Berkeley ACES program worked with artist and anti-displacement organizer, <a href="http://www.lesliedreyer.com/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer">Leslie Dreyer</a>, in conjunction with the <a href="http://sfadc.org/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer">San Francisco Anti-Displacement Coalition</a> (SFADC) and the <a href="http://www.cohsf.org/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer">Coalition on Homelessness</a>. Throughout the residency, they learned the policies and politics driving Bay Area displacement, how to use art, social media and community organizing to resist displacem</span><span>ent and were</span><img style="float:right" alt="" title="" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/width_300/public/aces1.jpg?itok=RzaCG0d1&amp;timestamp=1485905566"><span> connected to homeless and housing advocacy groups on the frontlines of </span><span>the housing justice struggle.</span></p>
<p><span>For their final project, they helped build, stage and document a pre-election anti-displacement action designed by Dreyer with SFADC and COH and built <a href="http://studentsforhousingjustice.weebly.com/" rel="noreferrer">this website</a> to educate students about the negative impacts of gentrification and eviction. Though this site is more an information hub than a student group, there is hope that this collaboration may catalyze a longer, deeper relationship between UC Students and the broader Bay Area housing movement.</span></p>
<p><span> </span></p>
<p></p>
<p>Geography 70AC, “The Urban Experience: Race, Class, and the American City”</p>
<p>Instructor: Seth Lunine<br>Semester: Spring 2017</p>
<p><img style="float:right" alt="" title="" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/width_300/public/screen_shot_2017-08-29_at_4.56.45_pm.png?itok=5rjmoLJ4&amp;timestamp=1504051038"></p>
<p>The ACES project for Dr. Seth Lunine’s Geography 70AC, “The Urban Experience: Race, Class, and the American City” enabled five students to explore and encounter key course topics, including gentrification, racialized displacement, and community organizing. ACES students partnered with the Tenderloin Neighborhood Development Corporation (TNDC), a nonprofit agency providing affordable housing, social work, education, and community organizing. A series of meetings facilitated by TNDC community planner Ramon Quintero brought together ACES students and Tenderloin residents, activists, and representatives of nonprofit organizations. Ongoing conversations about both existing programs and unmet community needs guided students’ research of nonprofit organizations, city services, and accessible public spaces in the Tenderloin.</p>
<p></p>
<p style="text-align:right"></p>
<p style="text-align:right"></p>
<p style="text-align:right"></p>
<p style="text-align:right"></p>
<p style="text-align:right"><a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/tenderloin_guide.pdf"> </a></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
</article>
  </div>

  
  </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-sm-6 radix-layouts-column1 panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
                  </div>
      </div>
      <div class="col-sm-6 radix-layouts-column2 panel-panel">

  </div>
 
</div><!-- /.sutro -->
  </div>
        </div>
      </div> <!-- /#main -->
    </div> <!-- /#content -->

    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-md-12">
                  <div id="breadcrumb" class="visible-desktop">
            <h2 class="element-invisible">You are here</h2><div class="item-list"><ul class="breadcrumb"><li class="first"><a href="/home">Home</a></li>

<li class="last">Global Poverty & Practice</li>
</ul></div>          </div>
                          <div class="page-title">
            <div class="container">
              <h1 class="title">Global Poverty &amp; Practice</h1>
            </div>
          </div>
                <div id="page-header">
                                      </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div> <!-- /#pre-content -->
    <div id="main-content" class="container">
        <div id="content" class="col-md-9 col-md-push-3">
      <div id="main" class="main" role="main" tabIndex="-1">
        <div id="main-inner">
            <div class="region region-content">
    
<div class="panel-display boxton clearfix radix-boxton" id="page-page">

  <div class="container-fluid">
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-md-12 radix-layouts-content panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-node-content"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <article class="node node-openberkeley-content-page clearfix">

  
      
  
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Global Poverty and Practice 150AC - Reparation and Decolonization<br>Instructor: Cecilia Cissell Lucas, Mara Chavez-Diaz, Lisa Gray-Garcia <br>Semester: Fall 2015</p>
<p>Global Poverty and Practice: Reparation and Decolonization (GPP 150AC) is an ACES course collaboratively taught by Cecilia Cissell Lucas, Mara Chavez-Diaz, and Lisa Gray-Garcia. The course covers processes and impacts of settler colonialism and racialization in the United States, the resulting resistance and liberation movements, and various discourses about academia, scholarship, and knowledge production such as the impact of systems of domination on the definitions of scholarship.</p>
<p>GPP 150AC is offered in collaboration with community partner POOR Magazine, a grassroots non-profit, arts organization led by people of color, indigenous, and poor/houseless people. Similar to the course, POOR Magazine's mission is to provide revolutionary media access, art, education, and advocacy to silenced youth, adults, and elders in poverty across the globe and to bring more attention to race, poverty, landlessness, and degentrification. Through collaborations of this sort, students engage in cross-class, cross-racial, and intergenerational teaching, learning, activism, and art-making.To learn more about POOR Magazine, visit their website at: <a href="http://www.poormagazine.org/" rel="noreferrer">http://www.poormagazine.org/</a>.</p>
<p><a href="http://www.poormagazine.org/" rel="noreferrer"><img alt="" title="" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/panopoly_image_original/public/pobre_0_1.jpg?itok=UtJ2SPpZ&amp;timestamp=1469122094"></a></p>
<p><span>As part of the ACES curriculum, students wrote personal accounts of their family's hxstory, incorporating pedagogies employed in the course and making connections between individual, community level, and structural-level scales. Below is an example of a student's project, a moving and especially insightful essay written by Eduardo Chaidez. Chaidez shares his testimony on his family's struggles, from living on government assistance to the murder of his brother and its impact on his family. Click on the image to read Chaidez's testimony.</span></p>
<p><a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/chaidez.pdf"><img alt="" title="" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/panopoly_image_original/public/chaivez_1.png?itok=NIdk5YUt&amp;timestamp=1469122116"></a></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
</article>
  </div>

  
  </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>

</div><!-- /.boxton -->
  </div>
        </div>
      </div> <!-- /#main -->
    </div> <!-- /#content -->

</ul></li>
<li class="expanded menu-fields-menu-link dropdown menu-link-collaborate-"><a href="/collaborate" class="dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown" data-target="#">Collaborate <span class="fa fa-caret-down"></span></a><ul class="dropdown-menu">  <li class="openberkeley-megamenu-wrapper">
    <div class="entity entity-menu-fields menu-fields-main-menu openberkeley-megamenu clearfix">
      <div class="container-fluid">
        <div class="row">
          <div class="col-md-7 hidden-xs hidden-sm openberkeley-megamenu-content-column">
            <div class="field field-name-field-featured-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img class="openberkeley-megamenu" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/openberkeley_megamenu/public/aces-loop-12-ol_v3_0.png?itok=9QecHK71&amp;timestamp=1470417270" width="308" height="205" alt="ACES logo" /></div></div></div>            <div class="field field-name-field-openberkeley-megamenu-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>We provide opportunities for students, faculty and community organizations to collaborate on research-based social justice projects through courses in our American Cultures Engaged Scholarship (ACES) Program.</p></div></div></div>          </div>
          <div class="col-md-5 openberkeley-megamenu-links-column">
            <ul class="menu nav"><li class="expanded menu-link-overview"><a href="/collaborate" aria-label="Overview of Collaborate">Overview</a></li>
<li class="first leaf menu-link-faculty-grants"><a href="/faculty/course-development/ac-faculty-grants" title="">Faculty Grants</a></li>
<li class="collapsed menu-link-student-projects"><a href="/collaborate/aces-student-projects" title="">Student Projects</a></li>
<li class="collapsed menu-link-community-partners"><a href="/collaborate/aces-community-partners">Community Partners</a></li>
<li class="collapsed menu-link-american-cultures-engaged-scholarship"><a href="/collaborate/american-cultures-engaged-scholarship">American Cultures Engaged Scholarship</a></li>
<li class="last collapsed menu-link-events"><a href="http://events.berkeley.edu/index.php/calendar/sn/ac.html" title="" rel="noreferrer">Events</a></li>
</ul>          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </li>
</ul></li>
<li class="expanded menu-fields-menu-link dropdown menu-link-archives-"><a href="/events" title="" class="dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown" data-target="#">Archives <span class="fa fa-caret-down"></span></a><ul class="dropdown-menu">  <li class="openberkeley-megamenu-wrapper">
    <div class="entity entity-menu-fields menu-fields-main-menu openberkeley-megamenu clearfix">
      <div class="container-fluid">
        <div class="row">
          <div class="col-md-7 hidden-xs hidden-sm openberkeley-megamenu-content-column">
            <div class="field field-name-field-featured-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img class="openberkeley-megamenu" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/openberkeley_megamenu/public/explore_0.png?itok=FkO49Eti&amp;timestamp=1469764514" width="308" height="205" alt="" /></div></div></div>            <div class="field field-name-field-openberkeley-megamenu-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>On our Archives page you will discover a repository of historical information for our center including reports, publications, past events, press releases, videos and AC milestones. </p></div></div></div>          </div>
          <div class="col-md-5 openberkeley-megamenu-links-column">
            <ul class="menu nav"><li class="expanded menu-link-overview"><a href="/events" title="" aria-label="Overview of Archives">Overview</a></li>

<div id="main-wrapper" class="main-wrapper">
    <div id="pre-content" class="container">
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-md-12">
                  <div id="breadcrumb" class="visible-desktop">
            <h2 class="element-invisible">You are here</h2><div class="item-list"><ul class="breadcrumb"><li class="first"><a href="/home">Home</a></li>
<li><a href="/collaborate">Collaborate</a></li>
<li><a href="/collaborate/aces-student-projects" title="">Student Projects</a></li>
<li class="last">History</li>
</ul></div>          </div>
                          <div class="page-title">
            <div class="container">
              <h1 class="title">History</h1>
            </div>
          </div>
                <div id="page-header">
                                      </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div> <!-- /#pre-content -->
    <div id="main-content" class="container">
        <div id="content" class="col-md-9 col-md-push-3">
      <div id="main" class="main" role="main" tabIndex="-1">
        <div id="main-inner">
            <div class="region region-content">
    
<div class="panel-display pond clearfix radix-pond" id="page-page">

  <div class="container-fluid">
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-sm-12 radix-layouts-header panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-node-content"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <article class="node node-openberkeley-content-page clearfix">

  
      
  
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><span>History 124B - The United Stated from World War II to the Vietnam Era<br></span><span>Instructor: Gene Zubovich<br></span><span>Semester: Spring 2016</span></p>
<p><span></span></p>
<p><span>In spring 2016, Professor Gene Zubovich taught the ACES course, History 124B, 'The United States from World War II to the Vietnam Era,' which explores the political, cultural, and societal shift that the United States experienced after World War II. Apart from the history covered within this specific timeline, students also analyzed the discourse of discrimination and prejudice that persisted after the abolishment of slavery.</span></p>
<p>Students in Professor Zubovich's class conducted research and created a website containing videos and information to educate others about one of the manifestations of social inequalities: discriminatory housing practices in the 20th century. They analyzed these housing practices in terms of redlining, restrictive covenants, and racial steering and evaluated the continual impact of these housing practices on today's society and communities.</p>
<p>To learn more about the housing discrimination in the twentieth century student projects from spring 2016, click on the images below. </p>
<p></p>
<p></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
</article>
  </div>

  
  </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>

    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-sm-4 radix-layouts-column1 panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vid-904 pane-bundle-text pane-fpid-318 clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-basic-text-text field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p style="text-align:center"><a href="http://aces2016housing.weebly.com/redlining.html" rel="noreferrer"><strong>Redlining</strong></a></p></div></div></div></div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
<div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vid-903 pane-bundle-text pane-fpid-317 clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-basic-text-text field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><a href="http://aces2016housing.weebly.com/redlining.html" rel="noreferrer"><img alt="" title="" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/width_400/public/home_owners_loan_corporation_philadelphia_redlining_map.jpg?itok=FOvY_3E1&amp;timestamp=1469059364"></a></p></div></div></div></div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
        </div>
      </div>
      <div class="col-sm-4 radix-layouts-column2 panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vid-905 pane-bundle-text pane-fpid-319 clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-basic-text-text field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p style="text-align:center"><a href="http://aces2016housing.weebly.com/restrictive-covenants.html" rel="noreferrer"><strong>Restrictive Covenants</strong></a></p></div></div></div></div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
<div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vid-906 pane-bundle-text pane-fpid-314 clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-basic-text-text field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><a href="http://aces2016housing.weebly.com/restrictive-covenants.html" rel="noreferrer"><img alt="" title="" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/width_400/public/we_want_white_tenants.jpg?itok=r1R0KTAq&amp;timestamp=1469059287"></a></p></div></div></div></div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
        </div>
      </div>
      <div class="col-sm-4 radix-layouts-column3 panel-panel">

    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-md-12">
                  <div id="breadcrumb" class="visible-desktop">
            <h2 class="element-invisible">You are here</h2><div class="item-list"><ul class="breadcrumb"><li class="first"><a href="/home">Home</a></li>

                          <div class="page-title">
            <div class="container">
              <h1 class="title">Integrative Biology</h1>
            </div>
          </div>
                <div id="page-header">
                                      </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div> <!-- /#pre-content -->
    <div id="main-content" class="container">
        <div id="content" class="col-md-9 col-md-push-3">
      <div id="main" class="main" role="main" tabIndex="-1">
        <div id="main-inner">
            <div class="region region-content">
    
<div class="panel-display pond clearfix radix-pond" id="page-page">

  <div class="container-fluid">
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-sm-12 radix-layouts-header panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-node-content"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <article class="node node-openberkeley-content-page clearfix">

  
      
  
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Integrative Biology 35AC - Human Biological Variation<br>Instructro: Leslea Hlusko <br>Semester: Spring 2015 - Fall 2016</p>
<p>One of the world’s top ten most widely read websites, with approximately 550 million unique visitors per month, Wikipedia articles are often the number one hit when using a search browser.  In spring 2016, Leslea Hlusko and eleven undergraduates in Integrative Biology (IB) 190 developed month-long projects that students in IB 35AC will participate in through their discussion sections starting in the fall of 2016. Each discussion section edited a Wikipedia article about a topic related to the class. Every student was trained to be a Wikipedian, and developed the skills (and hopefully the motivation) to share their Berkeley-gained knowledge with the world through the improvement of Wikipedia.</p>
<p>For examples of the IB 190 students project pages, please click on the images below, or visit one of the following links:</p>
<p><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Post-canine_megadontia" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Post-canine_megadontia</a></p>
<p><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Control_of_fire_by_early_humans" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Control_of_fire_by_early_humans</a></p>
<p><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Skid_Row_Cancer_Study" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Skid_Row_Cancer_Study</a></p>
<p><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hypoxic_ventilatory_response" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hypoxic_ventilatory_response</a></p>
<p><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chronic_stress" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chronic_stress</a></p>
<p><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pleiotropy" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pleiotropy</a></p>
<p><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kuru_(disease)" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kuru_(disease)</a> </p>
<p><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fore_people" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fore_people</a></p>
<p><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hyperandrogenism" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hyperandrogenism</a></p>
<p><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Evolutionary_mismatch" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Evolutionary_mismatch</a></p>
<p><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Height_and_intelligence" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Height_and_intelligence</a></p>
<p><span style="text-decoration:underline"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Diet-induced_obese" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Diet-induced_obese</a></span></p>
<p><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_variability" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_variability</a></p>
<p><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Food_desert" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Food_desert</a></p>
<p><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chester_M._Southam" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chester_M._Southam</a></p>
<p><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Office_for_Human_Research_Protections" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Office_for_Human_Research_Protections</a></p>
<p><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Natural_fertility" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Natural_fertility</a></p>
<p><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transgender_people_in_sports" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transgender_people_in_sports</a></p>
<p><span style="text-decoration:underline"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Race_and_health" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Race_and_health</a></span></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
</article>
  </div>

  
  </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>

  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">

  </div>

  
  </div>

  </div>

  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-basic-text-text field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p dir="ltr">Below you will find a video of the Natural Fertility group giving a guest lecture to the Fall 2016 IntegBio35AC course to introduce the project and show the students what the beginning and end of the Wikipedia Project looks like. </p>
<p><span> </span></p></div></div></div></div>

                          <div class="page-title">
            <div class="container">
              <h1 class="title">International &amp; Area Studies</h1>
            </div>
          </div>

        <div id="content" class="col-md-9 col-md-push-3">
      <div id="main" class="main" role="main" tabIndex="-1">
        <div id="main-inner">
            <div class="region region-content">
    
<div class="panel-display geary clearfix radix-geary" id="page-page">

  <div class="container-fluid">
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-sm-12 radix-layouts-header panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-node-content"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <article class="node node-openberkeley-content-page clearfix">

  
      
  
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>International &amp; Area Studies 158AC - Social Movements, Urban Histories, and the Politics of Memory<br>Instructor: Sean Burns<br>Semester: Spring 2015 - Fall 2016</p>
<p>Dr. Sean Burns, winner of the Chancellor's Public Service Public Service-Learning Leadership Award, developed the ACES course International &amp; Area Studies 158AC, "Social Movements, Urban Histories, and the Politics of Memory." This course surveys the history of progressive social movements in the San Francisco Bay Area.  In addition, by c<span>ombining history, sociology, urban geography, and ethnic studies, the course addresses the following questions:</span></p>
<ul><li>Why and how these movements emerged?</li>
<li>What cultural, racial, ethnic and political identities were drawn from, reconfigured, and created in these movements?</li>
<li>What kinds of knowledge and institutions were created by these movements? How have these legacies shaped the culture and politics of the area?</li>
</ul><p>As part of the ACES Program, this course engages students in creating social movement documentation in collaboration with Bay Area activists and community organizers. Please click on the images below for sample of the students' work.</p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
</article>
  </div>

  
  </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-sm-4 radix-layouts-column1 panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vuuid-aff75f37-2a98-498f-8411-f40ea6ab7458 pane-bundle-text clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-basic-text-text field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p style="text-align:center"><strong> <a href="http://foundsf.org/index.php?title=IPOC%E2%80%99s_Shellmound_Peace_Walks" rel="noreferrer">IPOC’s Shellmound Peace Walks</a>   </strong></p></div></div></div></div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
<div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vuuid-236db3a5-c7cc-4a1a-adf1-a689a24d30a2 pane-bundle-text clearfix"  >

              <h1 class="title">Labor Center</h1>

        <div id="main-inner">
            <div class="region region-content">
    
<div class="panel-display sutro clearfix radix-sutro" id="page-page">

  <div class="container-fluid">
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-sm-12 radix-layouts-header panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vid-2425 pane-bundle-text pane-fpid-700 clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-basic-text-text field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>In 2016, the UC Berkeley Labor Center partnered with the ACES Program to offer an expanded version of the highly successful <a href="http://laborcenter.berkeley.edu/labor-summer-internship-program/" rel="noreferrer">Labor Summer Internship Program</a> which integrated summer internships with Fall independent research courses. During the Summer, students interned at unions and community groups to address issues such as low wage jobs and other economic justice issues.  During the Fall, students developed this work into research projects by continuing the relationship with their community hosts. Students also integrated their internship experience into their academic work, while learning about pedagogies of community engaged scholarship. The students gave presentations at the end of the Fall semester to discuss their research and summer internships.</p></div></div></div></div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
<div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vuuid-08400a43-0fb5-48ca-aaf1-64162570f888 pane-bundle-video clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-video-file field-type-file field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><div id="file-950" class="file file-video file-video-youtube">

        <h2 class="element-hidden"><a href="/file/950">Community Organizing Field Studies 2016 -  Student Presentations</a></h2>
    
  
  <div class="content">
    <div class="media-youtube-video media-youtube-1">
  <iframe class="media-youtube-player" id="media-youtube-qzcyvimai-c" width="640" height="390" title="Community Organizing Field Studies 2016 -  Student Presentations" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/qZcyvimaI_c?wmode=opaque&enablejsapi=1&modestbranding=1&playerapiid=media-youtube-qzcyvimai-c&rel=0" allowfullscreen>Video of Community Organizing Field Studies 2016 -  Student Presentations</iframe>
</div>
  </div>

  
</div>
</div></div></div></div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-sm-6 radix-layouts-column1 panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
                  </div>
      </div>
      <div class="col-sm-6 radix-layouts-column2 panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
                  </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-sm-12 radix-layouts-footer panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-node-content"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <article class="node node-openberkeley-content-page clearfix">

  
      
  
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p dir="ltr"><strong>Tony Morales <br></strong>2nd year, Social Welfare<br>Site: East Bay Alliance for a Sustainable Economy</p>
<p dir="ltr">Was part of the Voter Outreach Team in the Fruitvale part of Oakland—did outreach and proposition education to community members in Oakland. Teamed up with Oakland Rising to present propositions around the community, and focused on presenting the information in Spanish.</p>
<p dir="ltr"><strong>John Penilla</strong></p>
<p dir="ltr">4th year, History<br>Site: UAW Local 2865</p>
<p dir="ltr">Helped do outreach and create material for political education on California propositions during election season. Had one-on-on conversations with their membership which includes GSIs, readers, tutors</p>
<p dir="ltr"><strong>Diana Kingsbury</strong></p>
<p dir="ltr">4th year, Social Welfare with minor in public policy<br>Site: UAW Local 2865</p>
<p dir="ltr">Focused on outreach and having one-on-one, in-depth, organizing conversations to discover issues that mattered to each member. Also gathered recommendations for best methods of contacting department members.</p>
<p dir="ltr"><strong>Claudia Ruby Van Natta</strong></p>
<p dir="ltr">4th year, Urban Studies<br>Site: UNITE HERE Local 2850</p>
<p dir="ltr">Worked on a casino worker organizing campaign. Made worksite visits to several casinos, hotels, and restaurants and helped with on-site trainings related to immigration. Helped plan and do turnout for various actions related to the campaign.</p>
<p dir="ltr"><strong>Monet Levelly-Garcia </strong></p>
<p dir="ltr">4th year, Sociology<br>Site: Service Employees International Union Local 1021</p>
<p dir="ltr"><span>Focused on outreach and education of affordable housing propositions to childcare workers through worksite visits, door knocking and phone banking. Supported events, survey distribution and campaigning.</span></p>
<p dir="ltr"><span></span><strong>Esme' Freeman</strong></p>
<p dir="ltr">5th year, Social Welfare<br>Site: Bay Area Black Worker Center</p>
<p dir="ltr"><span>Focused primarily on the #Jobs4Freedom campaign that assured affirmative hiring for 1,400 formerly incarcerated residents in Alameda County.  </span></p>
<p><span><span> </span></span></p>
<p dir="ltr"><span> </span></p>
<p><span><span> </span></span></p>
<p dir="ltr"></p>
<p dir="ltr"></p>
<p><span> </span></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
</article>
  </div>

  
  </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>
 
</div><!-- /.sutro -->
  </div>
        </div>

    </div> <!-- /#content -->

    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-md-12">
                  <div id="breadcrumb" class="visible-desktop">
            <h2 class="element-invisible">You are here</h2><div class="item-list"><ul class="breadcrumb"><li class="first"><a href="/home">Home</a></li>

<li class="last">Music</li>

                          <div class="page-title">
            <div class="container">
              <h1 class="title">Music</h1>
            </div>
          </div>
                <div id="page-header">
                                      </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div> <!-- /#pre-content -->
    <div id="main-content" class="container">
        <div id="content" class="col-md-9 col-md-push-3">
      <div id="main" class="main" role="main" tabIndex="-1">
        <div id="main-inner">
            <div class="region region-content">
    
<div class="panel-display sutro-double clearfix radix-sutro-double" id="page-page">

  <div class="container-fluid">
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-sm-12 radix-layouts-header panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-node-content"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <article class="node node-openberkeley-content-page clearfix">

  
      
  
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Music 74AC/139AC - Hip Hop in Urban America <br>Instructor: Sara Lappas<br>Semester: Summer 2015</p>
<p>Rapping in Mandarin, Berkeley undergrad Vanessa Guo shared the stage with her teenage collaborator, Miyosha, and volunteer Juanita Greene at a lively, outdoor talent showcase last weekend in Richmond. The trio co-wrote the music and lyrics for “Dance with Me,” a hip-hop track about confidence and empowerment, through a partnership between the Richmond youth organization RYSE and a summer music course at Berkeley on the history of hip-hop in urban America.</p>
<p>This collaborative partnership was presented in a colloquium on March 11 utilizing four audio vignettes that incorporate interviews with RYSE youth participants, and feature the music made together with Berkeley students as part of the Summer ACES Course Music 74/139AC .</p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
</article>
  </div>

  
  </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>

    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-sm-6 radix-layouts-column1 panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vuuid-374fea12-60e2-4138-8953-d7d025df4d87 pane-bundle-video clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-video-file field-type-file field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><div id="file-372" class="file file-video file-video-youtube">

        <h2 class="element-hidden"><a href="/file/372">Part 1 of 4, In and Out the Rich, UC Berkeley</a></h2>
    
  
  <div class="content">
    <div class="media-youtube-video media-youtube-1">

    <div id="pre-content" class="container">
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-md-12">
                  <div id="breadcrumb" class="visible-desktop">
            <h2 class="element-invisible">You are here</h2><div class="item-list"><ul class="breadcrumb"><li class="first"><a href="/home">Home</a></li>

<li class="last">Public Health</li>

                          <div class="page-title">
            <div class="container">
              <h1 class="title">Public Health </h1>
            </div>
          </div>
                <div id="page-header">
                                      </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div> <!-- /#pre-content -->
    <div id="main-content" class="container">
        <div id="content" class="col-md-9 col-md-push-3">
      <div id="main" class="main" role="main" tabIndex="-1">
        <div id="main-inner">
            <div class="region region-content">
    
<div class="panel-display boxton clearfix radix-boxton" id="page-page">

  <div class="container-fluid">
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-md-12 radix-layouts-content panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-node-content"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <article class="node node-openberkeley-content-page clearfix">

  
      
  
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p style="text-align:left"><span style="text-align:left">Public Health 150E - Introduction to Community Health and Human Development<br></span><span style="text-align:left">Instructor: Bill Satariano <br></span><span style="text-align:left">Semester: Spring 2014- Spring 2016</span></p>
<p style="text-align:left"><span style="text-align:left"><img style="float:right" alt="" title="" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/width_300/public/system-map.gif?itok=KvU4wbaL&amp;timestamp=1482186666"></span></p>
<p style="text-align:left"></p>
<p style="text-align:left"><span style="text-align:left">Using the </span><a href="http://www.frbsf.org/community-development/blog/health-wealth-inequality-bay-area-bart/" rel="noreferrer">Federal Reserve Bank’s Health and Wealth Inequities Across Bay Area Rapid Transit Stations</a> <span style="text-align:left">as a starting </span>point, journalism graduate student <span>Jake</span> <span>Nicol</span> worked with students from Public Health 150E (Introduction to Community Health and Human Development) and Professor Bill Satariano to produce an interactive documentary. <span>The team built a </span><a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/bart.gov">Bay Area Rapid </a><a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/bart.gov">Transit</a><span> (BART) map website with embedded video stories from individual community members and organizations. </span><span>To highlight the wide range of health inequities, these stories focused on individuals representative of some of the most dispa</span><span>rate Bay Area communities in terms of both wealth and health outcomes. Through partnerships with community </span><span>organizations and in collaboration with the Journalism School, the group gathered data, testimonies, and video components for the project.</span></p>
<p style="text-align:left"><span>To learn more, please visit <a href="http://media.journalism.berkeley.edu/projects/2014/20140320_bart/" rel="noreferrer">Station to Station: Health Inequities in the Bay Area</a></span></p>
<p style="text-align:left"></p>
<p style="text-align:left"><br><br></p>
<div><a href="http://media.journalism.berkeley.edu/projects/2014/20140320_bart/" rel="noreferrer"><img alt="station to station" title="" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/panopoly_image_original/public/screen_shot_2016-12-08_at_3.44.31_pm_0.png?itok=fGzFKaUs&amp;timestamp=1481241298"></a></div></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
</article>
  </div>

  
  </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>

</div><!-- /.boxton -->
  </div>
        </div>
      </div> <!-- /#main -->
    </div> <!-- /#content -->
        <div id="sidebar-first" class="col-md-3 col-md-pull-9">
      <div class="region region-sidebar-first">
    <nav class="block block-menu-block block--">

    <div id="pre-content" class="container">
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-md-12">
                  <div id="breadcrumb" class="visible-desktop">
            <h2 class="element-invisible">You are here</h2><div class="item-list"><ul class="breadcrumb"><li class="first"><a href="/home">Home</a></li>

<li class="last">Sociology</li>

                          <div class="page-title">
            <div class="container">
              <h1 class="title">Sociology</h1>
            </div>
          </div>
                <div id="page-header">
                                      </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div> <!-- /#pre-content -->
    <div id="main-content" class="container">
        <div id="content" class="col-md-9 col-md-push-3">
      <div id="main" class="main" role="main" tabIndex="-1">
        <div id="main-inner">
            <div class="region region-content">
    
<div class="panel-display sutro-double clearfix radix-sutro-double" id="page-page">

  <div class="container-fluid">
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-sm-12 radix-layouts-header panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-node-content"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <article class="node node-openberkeley-content-page clearfix">

  
      
  
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><span>Sociology 3AC - Principles of Sociology <br></span><span>Instructor: Tiffany Linton<br></span><span>Semester: Spring 2016 - Spring 2017</span></p>
<p></p>
<p><span>In ​​Dr. Tiffany Linton Page​'s Sociology 3AC​ ACES course, 'Principles of Sociology​,' students explore ​different patterns of ​racial ​inequalit​ies and ​their origins. ​By pairing classroom learning with field work with community partner experts such as the East Oakland Boxing Association (EOBA) and Restorative Justice for Oakland Youth​ (RJOY), students recognize​ ​how institutions have continually created and reproduced the same patterns of inequality, how ​such institutions have changed, and the affect​s​ social movements and circumstances have played in social change.​ </span></p>
<p><span>As a part of th​e engaged scholarship component of this course, five students developed a​n online resource guide for girls ​to discover employment​,​ ​health and education resources​ as well ​as women​-​specific resources (including shelters for homeless ​​women and sexual health clinics)​. ​​Please click ​on the categories below for examples of resources developed in Dr. Page's AC course or <a href="http://resourceguideforgirls.weebly.com/" rel="noreferrer">visit</a> ​the website. </span></p>
<p></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
</article>
  </div>

  
  </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>

    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-sm-6 radix-layouts-column1 panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vid-158 pane-bundle-openberkeley-widgets-promo pane-fpid-75 clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="openberkeley-widgets-promo fieldable-panels-pane openberkeley-widgets-color-scheme-web-medalist">
      <a href="http://resourceguideforgirls.weebly.com/education-resources.html" class="openberkeley-widgets-image-link">
    <div class="openberkeley-widgets-label">
    <div class="openberkeley-widgets-label-inner">
      <h3>Education Resources</h3>
          </div>
  </div>
    </a>
  </div>
  </div>

  
  </div>

</ul></div>              </div>
                      </div>
          <div class="col-md-5">
            <div id="footer-main-first" class="clearfix">
                <div class="region region-footer">
    <div class="block block-menu block--">

    <div class="entity entity-menu-fields menu-fields-main-menu openberkeley-megamenu clearfix">
      <div class="container-fluid">
        <div class="row">
          <div class="col-md-7 hidden-xs hidden-sm openberkeley-megamenu-content-column">
            <div class="field field-name-field-featured-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img class="openberkeley-megamenu" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/openberkeley_megamenu/public/lsadvising2_finkle_nancy.jpg?itok=IrLURM54&amp;timestamp=1471552543" width="308" height="205" alt="College advisor counseling student " /></div></div></div>            <div class="field field-name-field-openberkeley-megamenu-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Our staff recognizes the critical role you play in advising students for exciting opportunities in this unique curriculum.  On this section, you will find information to advise students on the AC Requirement.  </p></div></div></div>          </div>

</ul></li>
<li class="expanded menu-fields-menu-link dropdown menu-link-faculty-"><a href="/faculty" title="" class="dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown" data-target="#">Faculty <span class="fa fa-caret-down"></span></a><ul class="dropdown-menu">  <li class="openberkeley-megamenu-wrapper">
    <div class="entity entity-menu-fields menu-fields-main-menu openberkeley-megamenu clearfix">
      <div class="container-fluid">
        <div class="row">
          <div class="col-md-7 hidden-xs hidden-sm openberkeley-megamenu-content-column">
            <div class="field field-name-field-featured-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img class="openberkeley-megamenu" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/openberkeley_megamenu/public/shiftcourse_hero_836px_c.jpg?itok=A1pRkJrF&amp;timestamp=1469833877" width="308" height="205" alt="" /></div></div></div>            <div class="field field-name-field-openberkeley-megamenu-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>The American Cultures Center is proud to offer faculty exciting opportunities such as the possibility to receive a grant to continue, or create an American Cultures course, be awarded for excellence in teaching, and even become a Chancellor's Public Scholar! </p></div></div></div>          </div>
          <div class="col-md-5 openberkeley-megamenu-links-column">
            <ul class="menu nav"><li class="expanded menu-link-overview"><a href="/faculty" title="" aria-label="Overview of Faculty">Overview</a></li>
<li class="first collapsed menu-link-course-development-"><a href="/faculty/overview-faculty" title="">Course Development </a></li>

</ul>          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </li>
</ul></li>
<li class="expanded menu-fields-menu-link dropdown menu-link-collaborate-"><a href="/collaborate" class="dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown" data-target="#">Collaborate <span class="fa fa-caret-down"></span></a><ul class="dropdown-menu">  <li class="openberkeley-megamenu-wrapper">
    <div class="entity entity-menu-fields menu-fields-main-menu openberkeley-megamenu clearfix">
      <div class="container-fluid">
        <div class="row">
          <div class="col-md-7 hidden-xs hidden-sm openberkeley-megamenu-content-column">
            <div class="field field-name-field-featured-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img class="openberkeley-megamenu" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/openberkeley_megamenu/public/aces-loop-12-ol_v3_0.png?itok=9QecHK71&amp;timestamp=1470417270" width="308" height="205" alt="ACES logo" /></div></div></div>            <div class="field field-name-field-openberkeley-megamenu-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>We provide opportunities for students, faculty and community organizations to collaborate on research-based social justice projects through courses in our American Cultures Engaged Scholarship (ACES) Program.</p></div></div></div>          </div>
          <div class="col-md-5 openberkeley-megamenu-links-column">
            <ul class="menu nav"><li class="expanded menu-link-overview"><a href="/collaborate" aria-label="Overview of Collaborate">Overview</a></li>

<div id="main-wrapper" class="main-wrapper">
    <div id="pre-content" class="container">
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-md-12">
                  <div id="breadcrumb" class="visible-desktop">
            <h2 class="element-invisible">You are here</h2><div class="item-list"><ul class="breadcrumb"><li class="first"><a href="/home">Home</a></li>
<li><a href="/collaborate">Collaborate</a></li>

<li class="last">Theater, Dance & Performance Studies</li>
</ul></div>          </div>
                          <div class="page-title">
            <div class="container">
              <h1 class="title">Theater, Dance &amp; Performance Studies</h1>
            </div>
          </div>
                <div id="page-header">
                                      </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div> <!-- /#pre-content -->
    <div id="main-content" class="container">
        <div id="content" class="col-md-9 col-md-push-3">
      <div id="main" class="main" role="main" tabIndex="-1">
        <div id="main-inner">
            <div class="region region-content">
    
<div class="panel-display pond clearfix radix-pond" id="page-page">

  <div class="container-fluid">
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-sm-12 radix-layouts-header panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-node-content"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <article class="node node-openberkeley-content-page clearfix">

  
      
  
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Theater Dance and Performance Studies 52AC - Reflections of Gender, Culture, and Ethnicity in American Dance<br>Instructor: Krista DeNio<br>Semester: Summer 2015</p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p>In Summer 2015, AC Faculty, Choreographer/ Director and Community Engaged Artist, Krista DeNio partnered with ACES and Theater Dance and Performance Studies (TDPS), and <span>several programs on campus, including </span><span>Cal's Re-entry Student and Veteran Services program, Urban Scholars Initiative, and Underground Scholars Initiative,</span><span> to create t</span><span>he ACES course, TDPS 52AC, 'Reflections of Gender, Culture, and Ethnicity in American Dance.' </span><span>I</span><span>n this course, students</span><span> learn how lineages of white privilege create dominant frameworks through which the performing arts are legitimized, viewed, written about, and documented. </span>Viewpoints and strategies are offered to address critical multicultural concerns, along with multiple ways to understand how dance reflects, shapes, contends with and negotiates issues of racial, cultural, gender and ethnic identity in the United States.</p>
<p>Students were able to meet with guest speakers who shared their experiences as U.S. military veterans and formerly incarcerated individuals.  Students then developed their own creative responses which they presented as performances in class to community members which expressed and shared factual and experiential information about different campus community organizations. Their performances explored ideas about how community engagement can both demystify difference and systemic oppression, and drive education for members of served and underserved communities. Below are videos of the students' final presentations and course community partners.</p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
</article>
  </div>

  
  </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>

    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-sm-4 radix-layouts-column1 panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vuuid-b20d6d6b-6622-4c2b-b622-34ec395975d6 pane-bundle-video clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-video-file field-type-file field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><div id="file-379" class="file file-video file-video-youtube">

        <h2 class="element-hidden"><a href="/file/379">TDPS 52AC Final Presentations , Summer 2015</a></h2>
    
  
  <div class="content">
    <div class="media-youtube-video media-youtube-1">

</div>
  </div>

  
</div>
</div></div></div></div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
        </div>
      </div>
      <div class="col-sm-4 radix-layouts-column2 panel-panel">

          <div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vuuid-6d0b66a7-5c74-4d16-8c2c-c0911432f70e pane-bundle-video clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">

<li class="expanded menu-fields-menu-link dropdown menu-link-archives-"><a href="/events" title="" class="dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown" data-target="#">Archives <span class="fa fa-caret-down"></span></a><ul class="dropdown-menu">  <li class="openberkeley-megamenu-wrapper">
    <div class="entity entity-menu-fields menu-fields-main-menu openberkeley-megamenu clearfix">
      <div class="container-fluid">
        <div class="row">
          <div class="col-md-7 hidden-xs hidden-sm openberkeley-megamenu-content-column">
            <div class="field field-name-field-featured-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img class="openberkeley-megamenu" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/openberkeley_megamenu/public/explore_0.png?itok=FkO49Eti&amp;timestamp=1469764514" width="308" height="205" alt="" /></div></div></div>            <div class="field field-name-field-openberkeley-megamenu-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>On our Archives page you will discover a repository of historical information for our center including reports, publications, past events, press releases, videos and AC milestones. </p></div></div></div>          </div>
          <div class="col-md-5 openberkeley-megamenu-links-column">
            <ul class="menu nav"><li class="expanded menu-link-overview"><a href="/events" title="" aria-label="Overview of Archives">Overview</a></li>
<li class="first leaf menu-link-history-of-ac"><a href="/archives/history-american-cultures">History of AC</a></li>
<li class="leaf menu-link-newsletters"><a href="/archives/newsletters">Newsletters</a></li>

</ul>          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </li>
</ul></li>
<li class="last leaf menu-link-contact-us"><a href="/contact">Contact Us</a></li>
            </ul>
                  </div>

<div id="main-wrapper" class="main-wrapper">
    <div id="pre-content" class="container">
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-md-12">
                  <div id="breadcrumb" class="visible-desktop">
            <h2 class="element-invisible">You are here</h2><div class="item-list"><ul class="breadcrumb"><li class="first"><a href="/home">Home</a></li>
<li><a href="/collaborate">Collaborate</a></li>

<li class="last">International & Area Studies</li>
</ul></div>          </div>
                          <div class="page-title">
            <div class="container">
              <h1 class="title">International &amp; Area Studies</h1>
            </div>
          </div>
                <div id="page-header">
                                      </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div> <!-- /#pre-content -->
    <div id="main-content" class="container">
        <div id="content" class="col-md-9 col-md-push-3">
      <div id="main" class="main" role="main" tabIndex="-1">
        <div id="main-inner">
            <div class="region region-content">
    
<div class="panel-display geary clearfix radix-geary" id="page-page">

  <div class="container-fluid">
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-sm-12 radix-layouts-header panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-node-content"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <article class="node node-openberkeley-content-page clearfix">

  
      
  
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>International &amp; Area Studies 158AC - Social Movements, Urban Histories, and the Politics of Memory<br>Instructor: Sean Burns<br>Semester: Spring 2015 - Fall 2016</p>
<p>Dr. Sean Burns, winner of the Chancellor's Public Service Public Service-Learning Leadership Award, developed the ACES course International &amp; Area Studies 158AC, "Social Movements, Urban Histories, and the Politics of Memory." This course surveys the history of progressive social movements in the San Francisco Bay Area.  In addition, by c<span>ombining history, sociology, urban geography, and ethnic studies, the course addresses the following questions:</span></p>
<ul><li>Why and how these movements emerged?</li>
<li>What cultural, racial, ethnic and political identities were drawn from, reconfigured, and created in these movements?</li>
<li>What kinds of knowledge and institutions were created by these movements? How have these legacies shaped the culture and politics of the area?</li>
</ul><p>As part of the ACES Program, this course engages students in creating social movement documentation in collaboration with Bay Area activists and community organizers. Please click on the images below for sample of the students' work.</p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
</article>
  </div>

  
  </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-sm-4 radix-layouts-column1 panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vuuid-aff75f37-2a98-498f-8411-f40ea6ab7458 pane-bundle-text clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-basic-text-text field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p style="text-align:center"><strong> <a href="http://foundsf.org/index.php?title=IPOC%E2%80%99s_Shellmound_Peace_Walks" rel="noreferrer">IPOC’s Shellmound Peace Walks</a>   </strong></p></div></div></div></div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
<div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vuuid-236db3a5-c7cc-4a1a-adf1-a689a24d30a2 pane-bundle-text clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-basic-text-text field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><img alt="" title="" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/width_400/public/jacob_sheynin_myohojiemeryville.jpg?itok=8V7hT6GX&amp;timestamp=1469057718"></p></div></div></div></div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
        </div>
      </div>
      <div class="col-sm-4 radix-layouts-column2 panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vuuid-b3762400-1e56-494b-9b2f-328e51009e48 pane-bundle-text clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-basic-text-text field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p style="text-align:center"><strong><a href="http://foundsf.org/index.php?title=Black_Nationalism_in_Oakland:_Imagining_Nationhood_and_Self-Determination" rel="noreferrer">Black Nationalism in Oakland</a></strong></p></div></div></div></div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
<div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vid-865 pane-bundle-text pane-fpid-294 clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-basic-text-text field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><img alt="" title="" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/width_400/public/apsp_pol-reaganqueen83003x.jpg?itok=6ZAtxGZL&amp;timestamp=1469057885"></p></div></div></div></div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
        </div>
      </div>
      <div class="col-sm-4 radix-layouts-column3 panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vuuid-9854197f-c44f-4301-9fb9-5104a91e7d0a pane-bundle-text clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-basic-text-text field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p style="text-align:center"><strong><a href="http://foundsf.org/index.php?title=%C2%A1Junta_No!_Chilean_Solidarity_in_the_Bay" rel="noreferrer">Chilean Solidarity in the Bay</a></strong></p></div></div></div></div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
<div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vuuid-3067dfe5-23ae-4d8f-81ff-2fa526c75339 pane-bundle-text clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-basic-text-text field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><img alt="" title="" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/width_400/public/meaghan-kachadoorian_image-3-stop-the-esmeralda.jpg?itok=kItRQRWk&amp;timestamp=1469057850"></p></div></div></div></div>

          <div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vuuid-40b0d41e-f5f4-411a-9ac0-5dfc63d53d0a pane-bundle-openberkeley-widgets-promo clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="openberkeley-widgets-promo fieldable-panels-pane openberkeley-widgets-color-scheme-wellman-tile">
      <div class="openberkeley-widgets-label">
    <div class="openberkeley-widgets-label-inner">
      <h3>&quot;ACES has made me realize the possibility and pedagogical benefit of off-campus experiences for students.  I realize I can do this without sacrificing the rigorous academic and theoretical elements of my course&quot;</h3>
          </div>
  </div>
  </div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
<div class="panel-pane pane-node-content"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <article class="node node-openberkeley-content-page clearfix">

  
      
  
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p style="text-align:left"><span>ACES courses represent corners of campus that highlight the intent of the AC requirement, while also deepening the meaning of that intent through a combination of multi-disciplinary research and praxis, the development of students and community partners as co-educators, mentoring opportunties, and an increased and sustained accesibility of information.</span></p>
<p><span>Please refer to our <a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/aces_courses_udpatedmay2016.pdf">ACES course list</a> for past and current courses.</span> To learn about projects have developed with <a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/collaborate/aces-community-partners">ACES community partners</a>, please visit the <a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/aces/berkeleyaces-0" rel="noreferrer">ACES Student Community Projects</a>. </p>
<p>The ACES Program provides support for faculty to incorporate community-based learning into new or revised AC courses. If you are a faculty member interested in developing or continuing an ACES course, please visit our G<a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/become-involved/grants" rel="noreferrer">rants page</a>.</p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
</article>
  </div>

  
  </div>
<div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vuuid-6abf4919-b73d-46a3-9b49-fbf718c0f448 pane-bundle-text clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-basic-text-text field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/students/courses/spotlight-ac-courses"><img alt="Three Faculty Members promoting Explore AC Page (AC Faculty Interviews) Sean Burns, Derek Van Rheenen and Khalid Kadir" class="openberkeley-theme-brand-image-focused" title="" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/panopoly_image_original/public/exploreac_bottomrow.png?itok=1TEC51Y-&amp;timestamp=1469570162"></a><a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/students/courses/spotlight-ac-courses" title=""><br></a></p></div></div></div></div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-sm-4 radix-layouts-column1 panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
                  </div>
      </div>
      <div class="col-sm-4 radix-layouts-column2 panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
                  </div>
      </div>
      <div class="col-sm-4 radix-layouts-column3 panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
                  </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>
  
</div><!-- /.geary -->
  </div>
        </div>
      </div> <!-- /#main -->
    </div> <!-- /#content -->

<div id="main-wrapper" class="main-wrapper">
    <div id="pre-content" class="container">
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-md-12">
                  <div id="breadcrumb" class="visible-desktop">
            <h2 class="element-invisible">You are here</h2><div class="item-list"><ul class="breadcrumb"><li class="first"><a href="/home">Home</a></li>
