                          <div class="page-title">
            <div class="container">
              <h1 class="title">AC Faculty Grants</h1>
            </div>
          </div>
                <div id="page-header">
                                      </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div> <!-- /#pre-content -->
    <div id="main-content" class="container">
        <div id="content" class="col-md-9 col-md-push-3">
      <div id="main" class="main" role="main" tabIndex="-1">
        <div id="main-inner">
            <div class="region region-content">
    
<div class="panel-display boxton clearfix radix-boxton" id="page-page">

  <div class="container-fluid">
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-md-12 radix-layouts-content panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-node-content"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <article class="node node-openberkeley-content-page clearfix">

  
      
  
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><h2>AC Course Development Grant</h2>
<p>We are pleased to announce that it is now offering course development grants of up to $1,500 to assist in the design of an AC course. Such course development might build on an existing course offering, but which is currently non-AC in status, or alternatively assist with the development of a new course which has yet to be offered.  Funding support may be requested in three categories:</p>
<p>(i) materials, which might include photocopying and printing, books and supplies</p>
<p>(ii) student hourly help, to assist with for example, digitizing materials (e.g., slides, maps, manuscripts, photographs), bibliographical and syllabi searches, or assignment-related research</p>
<p>(iii) general course enhancement, for example, assessment tool creation, social media assignment development, guest speaker honorarium, field site visits and transportation costs, student project support.</p>
<p>Apply via email: download the below file in Word format and send back the completed application (in the body of an email or as an attachment) to <a href="mailto:americancultures@berkeley.edu" rel="noreferrer">americancultures@berkeley.edu</a>.</p>
<p><a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/ac_course_development_grant.doc">Download application</a>.</p>
<h2>Multimedia Teaching and Learning Initiative Grant</h2>
<div>
<p>The MRC and The AC Center are pleased to announce the ‘Multimedia Teaching and Learning’ Initiative and its ‘Fellows’ program. The fellowship will allow faculty and graduate students to enrich course instruction by working with media based resources from the MRC. And before the use of DVD’s is history, participants will learn how to create ‘clips’ from some of their favorite and yet to be found favorite DVD’s in the MRC. Members will participate in a one-semester fellowship and receive a onetime grant of $500 at the end of the term and an honorary certificate from the AC Center. Below are the expectations and responsibilities for the fellows:</p>
<ul><li>
<p>Work to identify relevant clips from feature films, educational documentaries and/or audio based media from the MRC and Berkeley Language Center</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Develop a familiarity with the LFLFC (Library of Foreign Language Film Clips) interface, including searching, clipping, metadata and annotation features</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Learn how to embed video in bCourses</p>
</li>
<li>Provide quality feedback to the MRC on the training program as well as any “lessons learned” to help improve instructor experience</li>
</ul><p>If you are interested in learning more about the fellowship, please feel free to contact Gisele Tanasse (<a href="mailto:nerdpower@berkeley.edu" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer">nerdpower@berkeley.edu<span><span class="element-invisible">(link sends e-mail)</span></span></a>) and/or drop in during office hours: Academic Innovation Studio, 117 Dwinelle, this Wednesday (and every other 1st Wednesday of the month) from 10am-12pm.   </p>
<p>For a list of of the materials provided in this workshop, please visit the <span><a href="http://guides.lib.berkeley.edu/c.php?g=422448&amp;p=2906120" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer">guide for tools and links<span><span class="element-invisible">(link is external)</span></span></a></span> page, which includes links to the LFLFC, our clip prep worksheet and our terms list.</p>
</div></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
</article>
  </div>

  
  </div>
<div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vuuid-fa2c0a71-89cf-489f-853b-84829002e680 pane-bundle-text clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-basic-text-text field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><h2>ACES Course Grant</h2>
<p>ACES provides support for faculty to incorporate community-based learning into new or revised AC courses.  Faculty selected as Chancellor’s Public Scholars receive a faculty research grant of $3000, up to $1500 in additional funds for community project costs, logistical support for the implementation of the course from one or more undergraduate or graduate students serving as Chancellor’s Public Fellows<a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/2014-chancellors-award-advancing-institutional-excellence"></a> and staff consulting services.  </p>
<p>Faculty and students are offered broad based campus support including an intensive 2-day Summer Institute, 2-3 brown-bag meetings per semester, an annual symposium and workshops and meetings throughout the year (past workshops topics have included: tenure and promotion; technology and community based-projects; syllabus development and community based research projects.  There are a number of substantial course development and partnership project support documents available through the UC Berkeley Public Service Center, including:</p>
<ul><li>
<p><a href="http://publicservice.berkeley.edu/faculty" rel="noreferrer">Faculty Resources</a></p>
</li>
<li>
<p><a href="http://publicservice.berkeley.edu/faculty/handbook" rel="noreferrer">The Handbook for Designing Community Based Courses</a></p>
</li>
<li>
<p><a href="http://publicservice.berkeley.edu/experiential-learning" rel="noreferrer">The Experiential Learning Guideline</a></p>
</li>
</ul><p>Take a look at our <a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/current-aces-courses" rel="noreferrer">past and current ACES courses</a>.</p>
<p>The AC Center is now welcoming proposals for 2015-16 year.  Although we welcome all proposal, and especially encourage proposals that address K-12 education, environmental justice, the arts, public health, and/or suggest collaborations with partners in Richmond or with previous ACES community organizations.  If you are interested in discussing these options, please contact Victoria Robinson.</p>
<p>Expectations for 2015-2016 Chancellor's Public Scholars:</p>
<ul><li>
<p>UC Berkeley faculty selected to serve as 2015 Chancellor’s Public Scholars are expected to develop new or revised American Cultures courses to be taught in Fall 2015 or Spring 2016.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Proposed courses must clearly meet the curricular expectations of the American Cultures program and funds will not be released until the course is approved by the American Cultures faculty sub-committee.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Attend an intensive all day ACES Institute 9:00-3:00 on either Friday, February 27th or Saturday February 28th (to be confirmed based on teaching schedules). The ACES Institute is designed to provide faculty with the opportunity to develop, broaden, or deepen their research and teaching of community-engaged scholarship.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Attend 1-2 cohort meetings in both Spring 2015 and Fall 2015 semesters for faculty and students to address developing needs and ideas</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Conduct ACES pre- and post- assessment in courses</p>
</li>
</ul><h2>ACES Continuity Grant</h2>
<div>Faculty who have offered courses supported by the American Cultures Engaged Scholarship (ACES) program are eligible to apply for ACES Course Continuation Funds. These course continuation funds are an essential element in sustaining the work already achieved within the initial ACES course offering and provide opportunities to further develop the community-based partnership. For conceptual clarity, we recognize that “sustainability” is a mighty term, and best guided by four levels of interpretation which includes sustainability of: </div>
<ol><li>The course offering</li>
<li>The community-partnership project</li>
<li>The dissemination of the community-partnership projects</li>
<li>The faculty research derived from the community-based partnership. </li>
</ol><div>These course continuation funds are attached directly to the continued offering of the course and the related community- partnership project. Faculty can apply for up to $3,000. These grants can only be awarded twice.</div>
<div> </div>
<div>With this expectation in mind, please explain how sustainability funds will support the continued offering of the course and the community-partnership project and submit the following form.</div>
<div> </div>
<div>The application cycle for 2015-16 is currently closed.  Please check back in Fall 2016 for the next application period.</div></div></div></div></div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>

</div><!-- /.boxton -->
  </div>
        </div>
      </div> <!-- /#main -->
    </div> <!-- /#content -->

</ul></div>              </div>
                      </div>
          <div class="col-md-5">
            <div id="footer-main-first" class="clearfix">
                <div class="region region-footer">
    <div class="block block-menu block--">

      
  <div class="block__content">

  <div class="block__content">

    <div class="entity entity-menu-fields menu-fields-main-menu openberkeley-megamenu clearfix">
      <div class="container-fluid">
        <div class="row">
          <div class="col-md-7 hidden-xs hidden-sm openberkeley-megamenu-content-column">
            <div class="field field-name-field-featured-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img class="openberkeley-megamenu" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/openberkeley_megamenu/public/dsc_0009_.jpg?itok=89jjT_SB&amp;timestamp=1470417155" width="308" height="205" alt="" /></div></div></div>            <div class="field field-name-field-openberkeley-megamenu-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Students may take advantage of our programming by taking courses offered across campus, being a member of our Student Advisory Board or applying for the Student Prize for projects they develop in their AC courses. </p></div></div></div>          </div>
          <div class="col-md-5 openberkeley-megamenu-links-column">
            <ul class="menu nav"><li class="expanded menu-link-overview"><a href="/students" title="" aria-label="Overview of Students">Overview</a></li>

<li class="expanded menu-fields-menu-link dropdown menu-link-advisors-"><a href="/info-advisors" title="" class="dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown" data-target="#">Advisors <span class="fa fa-caret-down"></span></a><ul class="dropdown-menu">  <li class="openberkeley-megamenu-wrapper">
    <div class="entity entity-menu-fields menu-fields-main-menu openberkeley-megamenu clearfix">
      <div class="container-fluid">
        <div class="row">
          <div class="col-md-7 hidden-xs hidden-sm openberkeley-megamenu-content-column">
            <div class="field field-name-field-featured-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img class="openberkeley-megamenu" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/openberkeley_megamenu/public/lsadvising2_finkle_nancy.jpg?itok=IrLURM54&amp;timestamp=1471552543" width="308" height="205" alt="College advisor counseling student " /></div></div></div>            <div class="field field-name-field-openberkeley-megamenu-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Our staff recognizes the critical role you play in advising students for exciting opportunities in this unique curriculum.  On this section, you will find information to advise students on the AC Requirement.  </p></div></div></div>          </div>
          <div class="col-md-5 openberkeley-megamenu-links-column">
            <ul class="menu nav"><li class="expanded menu-link-overview"><a href="/info-advisors" title="" aria-label="Overview of Advisors">Overview</a></li>

<li class="expanded menu-fields-menu-link dropdown menu-link-faculty-"><a href="/faculty" title="" class="dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown" data-target="#">Faculty <span class="fa fa-caret-down"></span></a><ul class="dropdown-menu">  <li class="openberkeley-megamenu-wrapper">
    <div class="entity entity-menu-fields menu-fields-main-menu openberkeley-megamenu clearfix">
      <div class="container-fluid">
        <div class="row">
          <div class="col-md-7 hidden-xs hidden-sm openberkeley-megamenu-content-column">
            <div class="field field-name-field-featured-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img class="openberkeley-megamenu" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/openberkeley_megamenu/public/shiftcourse_hero_836px_c.jpg?itok=A1pRkJrF&amp;timestamp=1469833877" width="308" height="205" alt="" /></div></div></div>            <div class="field field-name-field-openberkeley-megamenu-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>The American Cultures Center is proud to offer faculty exciting opportunities such as the possibility to receive a grant to continue, or create an American Cultures course, be awarded for excellence in teaching, and even become a Chancellor's Public Scholar! </p></div></div></div>          </div>
          <div class="col-md-5 openberkeley-megamenu-links-column">
            <ul class="menu nav"><li class="expanded menu-link-overview"><a href="/faculty" title="" aria-label="Overview of Faculty">Overview</a></li>
<li class="first collapsed menu-link-course-development-"><a href="/faculty/overview-faculty" title="">Course Development </a></li>
<li class="collapsed menu-link-faculty-grants"><a href="/faculty/faculty-grants">Faculty Grants</a></li>
<li class="collapsed menu-link-teaching-resources"><a href="/faculty/teaching-resources">Teaching Resources</a></li>
<li class="collapsed menu-link-innovation-in-teaching-award"><a href="/faculty/innovation-teaching-award">Innovation in Teaching Award</a></li>
<li class="last leaf menu-link-post-election-teaching-resources"><a href="/faculty/post-election-teaching-resources">Post-Election Teaching Resources</a></li>
</ul>          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </li>
</ul></li>
<li class="expanded menu-fields-menu-link dropdown menu-link-collaborate-"><a href="/collaborate" class="dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown" data-target="#">Collaborate <span class="fa fa-caret-down"></span></a><ul class="dropdown-menu">  <li class="openberkeley-megamenu-wrapper">
    <div class="entity entity-menu-fields menu-fields-main-menu openberkeley-megamenu clearfix">
      <div class="container-fluid">
        <div class="row">
          <div class="col-md-7 hidden-xs hidden-sm openberkeley-megamenu-content-column">
            <div class="field field-name-field-featured-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img class="openberkeley-megamenu" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/openberkeley_megamenu/public/aces-loop-12-ol_v3_0.png?itok=9QecHK71&amp;timestamp=1470417270" width="308" height="205" alt="ACES logo" /></div></div></div>            <div class="field field-name-field-openberkeley-megamenu-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>We provide opportunities for students, faculty and community organizations to collaborate on research-based social justice projects through courses in our American Cultures Engaged Scholarship (ACES) Program.</p></div></div></div>          </div>
          <div class="col-md-5 openberkeley-megamenu-links-column">
            <ul class="menu nav"><li class="expanded menu-link-overview"><a href="/collaborate" aria-label="Overview of Collaborate">Overview</a></li>
<li class="first leaf menu-link-faculty-grants"><a href="/faculty/course-development/ac-faculty-grants" title="">Faculty Grants</a></li>
<li class="collapsed menu-link-student-projects"><a href="/collaborate/aces-student-projects" title="">Student Projects</a></li>
<li class="collapsed menu-link-community-partners"><a href="/collaborate/aces-community-partners">Community Partners</a></li>
<li class="collapsed menu-link-american-cultures-engaged-scholarship"><a href="/collaborate/american-cultures-engaged-scholarship">American Cultures Engaged Scholarship</a></li>
<li class="last collapsed menu-link-events"><a href="http://events.berkeley.edu/index.php/calendar/sn/ac.html" title="" rel="noreferrer">Events</a></li>
</ul>          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </li>
</ul></li>
<li class="expanded menu-fields-menu-link dropdown menu-link-archives-"><a href="/events" title="" class="dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown" data-target="#">Archives <span class="fa fa-caret-down"></span></a><ul class="dropdown-menu">  <li class="openberkeley-megamenu-wrapper">
    <div class="entity entity-menu-fields menu-fields-main-menu openberkeley-megamenu clearfix">
      <div class="container-fluid">
        <div class="row">
          <div class="col-md-7 hidden-xs hidden-sm openberkeley-megamenu-content-column">
            <div class="field field-name-field-featured-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img class="openberkeley-megamenu" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/openberkeley_megamenu/public/explore_0.png?itok=FkO49Eti&amp;timestamp=1469764514" width="308" height="205" alt="" /></div></div></div>            <div class="field field-name-field-openberkeley-megamenu-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>On our Archives page you will discover a repository of historical information for our center including reports, publications, past events, press releases, videos and AC milestones. </p></div></div></div>          </div>
          <div class="col-md-5 openberkeley-megamenu-links-column">
            <ul class="menu nav"><li class="expanded menu-link-overview"><a href="/events" title="" aria-label="Overview of Archives">Overview</a></li>

<div id="main-wrapper" class="main-wrapper">
    <div id="pre-content" class="container">
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-md-12">
                        <div id="page-header">
                                      </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div> <!-- /#pre-content -->
    <div id="main-content" class="clearfix">
        <div id="content" class="">
      <div id="main" class="main" role="main" tabIndex="-1">
        <div id="main-inner">
            <div class="region region-content">
    
<div class="panel-display boxton clearfix radix-boxton-hero mvpcreator-theme-full-width" >

    <div class="mvpcreator-theme-container-full-width">
      <div class="row">
      <div class="col-sm-12 radix-layouts-hero panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vuuid-d2b7397e-8a31-401f-ac58-523b4fb8882a pane-bundle-openberkeley-widgets-band clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="openberkeley-widgets-band fieldable-panels-pane openberkeley-widgets-color-scheme-founders-rock">
    <div class="openberkeley-widgets-label">
    <div class="openberkeley-widgets-label-inner container">
      <h2>Basic Course Development Guidelines</h2>
    </div>
  </div>
</div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-sm-12 radix-layouts-content panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="container"><div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vuuid-d4c884f0-e724-47ac-aff5-c74076727504 pane-bundle-text clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-basic-text-text field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><strong><span>AC course syllabus </span>preparation &amp; <span>submission guidelines:</span></strong></p>
<p><span>There is no "template" for an American Cultures Course.  </span><span>A 'completely developed syllabus' necessarily includes a complete list of assignments, details regarding weekly lecture/discussion topics, and a reading list.  T</span><span>he Subcommittee’s expectations may be summed up by the three "questions" posted within the AC Course Approval Guidelines:</span></p>
<ol><li>
<p><span>"Does the course address theoretical and analytical issues relevant to understanding race, culture, and ethnicity?" How?</span></p>
</li>
<li>
<p><span>"Is the course integrative and comparative within the larger context of American society, history, culture, economy, or environment?" How?</span></p>
</li>
<li>
<p><span>"Does the course take substantial account of groups drawn from at least three of the following: African Americans, indigenous peoples of the United States, Asian Americans, Chicanos/Latinos, and European Americans?" How is each group incorporated into the course?</span> </p>
</li>
</ol><p><span><a href="https://academic-senate.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/ac_guidelines_apr2006_fin_1_0.pdf" rel="noreferrer">Please visit the extended AC Subcommittee Senate guidelines</a> for the approval of courses meeting the American Cultures requirement.</span></p></div></div></div></div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
<div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vid-2346 pane-bundle-text pane-fpid-196 clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-basic-text-text field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><strong><span>Submitting materials to the Senate:</span></strong></p>
<p><span>In order to make a decision, the Subcommittee needs instructors to submit the following:</span></p>
<ul><li>
<p><span>A cover letter answering, in detail, the three questions from the guidelines. Cover letters should also offer details regarding the actual materials used in the classroom. </span></p>
</li>
<li>
<p><span>A completely developed syllabus.</span></p>
</li>
</ul><p></p>
<p>The Subcommittee strongly suggests that instructors consult with Dr. Robinson prior to submitting their final materials.   Once your materials are ready for submission, you <span style="color:#003262">should send them directly to the Academic Senate in 320 Stephens Hall #5842. </span></p></div></div></div></div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
<div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vid-2347 pane-bundle-text pane-fpid-197 clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-basic-text-text field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><span>Historical list of approved AC courses: </span><span>At <a href="http://academic-senate.berkeley.edu/committees/amcult/approved-ac-courses-berkeley" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer">Berkeley</a> </span><span>| </span><span>At </span><a href="http://academic-senate.berkeley.edu/committees/amcult/approved-ac-courses-other-colleges" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer">other colleges</a></p></div></div></div></div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
<div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vuuid-f480841e-29e0-4beb-b3ad-9052a73a4cec pane-bundle-text clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-basic-text-text field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><strong>Senate Committee Meeting Dates</strong></p>
<p><strong></strong>Meeting dates for the American Cultures Subcommittee Review Sessions can be found on the Academic Senate's <a href="http://academic-senate.berkeley.edu/committees/amcult" rel="noreferrer">Meeting Dates</a> page. </p></div></div></div></div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
<div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vuuid-0464e0d1-ea93-45c9-9191-607dbe4f9ecc pane-bundle-text clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-basic-text-text field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>For additional Information on how to create or submit a new AC course, please visit the Academic Senate's <a href="http://academic-senate.berkeley.edu/committees/amcult/creating" rel="noreferrer">Creating &amp; Submitting a New AC Course page</a>.</p></div></div></div></div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
</div>        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>

</div><!-- /.boxton -->
  </div>

          <div class="panel-pane pane-node-content"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <article class="node node-openberkeley-content-page clearfix">

  
      
  
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>We are <span style="color:#333333"><span style="color:#333333">pleased to announce that it is now offering course development grants of up to $1,500 to assist in the design of an AC course. Such course development might build on an existing course offering, but which is currently non-AC in status, or alternatively assist with the development of a new course which has yet to be offered.  Funding support may be requested in three categories:</span></span></p>
<p>(i) materials, which might include photocopying and printing, books and supplies</p>
<p>(ii) student hourly help, to assist with, for example, digitizing materials (e.g., slides, maps, manuscripts, photographs), bibliographical and syllabi searches, or assignment-related research</p>
<p>(iii) general course enhancement, for example, assessment tool creation, social media assignment development, guest speaker honorarium, field site visits and transportation costs, student project support.</p>
<p>Apply via email: download the below file in Word format and send back the completed application (in the body of an email or as an attachment) to <a href="mailto:americancultures@berkeley.edu" rel="noreferrer">americancultures@berkeley.edu</a>.</p>
<p><a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/ac_course_development_grant.doc">Download application</a>.</p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
</article>
  </div>

  
  </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>

</div><!-- /.boxton -->
  </div>
        </div>
      </div> <!-- /#main -->
    </div> <!-- /#content -->

    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-md-12">
                  <div id="breadcrumb" class="visible-desktop">
            <h2 class="element-invisible">You are here</h2><div class="item-list"><ul class="breadcrumb"><li class="first"><a href="/home">Home</a></li>
<li><a href="/faculty" title="">Faculty</a></li>
<li><a href="/faculty/faculty-grants">Faculty Grants</a></li>
<li class="last">2017-18 American Cultures Engaged Scholarship Program Course Grant</li>
</ul></div>          </div>
                          <div class="page-title">
            <div class="container">
              <h1 class="title">American Cultures Engaged Scholarship Program Course Grant</h1>
            </div>
          </div>
                <div id="page-header">
                                      </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div> <!-- /#pre-content -->
    <div id="main-content" class="container">
        <div id="content" class="col-md-9 col-md-push-3">
      <div id="main" class="main" role="main" tabIndex="-1">
        <div id="main-inner">
            <div class="region region-content">
    
<div class="panel-display boxton clearfix radix-boxton" id="page-page">

  <div class="container-fluid">
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-md-12 radix-layouts-content panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-node-content"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <article class="node node-openberkeley-content-page clearfix">

  
      
  
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><h2>ACES Course Grants</h2>
<p dir="ltr">The American Cultures Engaged Scholarship Program supports the development of courses and initiatives that emphasize public scholarship and engage students in community-based projects.</p>
<p>The American Cultures Engaged Scholarship (ACES) Program:</p>
<p dir="ltr">Launched in January 2010, the ACES program is a partnership between the American Cultures Center <a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/americancultures.berkeley.edu">(http://americancultures.berkeley.edu)</a> and the Public Service Center <a href="http://publicservice.berkeley.edu/" rel="noreferrer">(http://publicservice.berkeley.edu<span><span class="element-invisible"></span></span>)</a> This program aims to transform how faculty’s community-engaged scholarship is valued, to enhance learning for students through a combination of teaching and practice, and to create new knowledge that has an impact both in the community and the academy.</p>
<p dir="ltr">The American Cultures (AC) requirement—the only campus-wide breadth requirement on the UC Berkeley campus—was passed by the Academic Senate in 1989 and instituted as a campus requirement in 1991 to help students gain a deeper understanding of the diverse cultures of the United States through an integrative and comparative framework. These goals are extended through community-focused and collaborative research and teaching.</p>
<p dir="ltr">In the 2017 proposal cycle, several priorities have been emphasized to support community-engaged scholarship directly benefiting undergraduate education. Including the ongoing support for AC courses which engage students directly in community-based projects, the ACES program expands its consideration of community-based teaching and research. Proposals are therefore welcomed in ONE of the following five categories.</p>
<p dir="ltr">Application Categories for 2017-2018 ACES Program:</p>
<ul><li>
<p dir="ltr">The development of a new or revised American Cultures Engaged Scholarship (ACES) course to be taught in Fall 2017, Spring 2018, or Fall 2018 (Funding: $3000 grant to faculty, $1500 for student fellow, $1500 to support community project implementation)</p>
</li>
<li>
<p dir="ltr">Continuation of existing ACES courses and projects where learning goals are met using community-engaged scholarship and are integrated in a significant manner within the course curriculum. (Funding: up to $3000)</p>
</li>
<li>
<p dir="ltr">A departmental initiative, e.g. brown bag or workshop series, to consider the role of existing and development of future community-engaged programs.  (Funding: up to $3000)</p>
</li>
<li>
<p dir="ltr">The appointment of a graduate student to support community-based outreach, teaching, and course partnership development. (Funding: up to $15,000)</p>
</li>
<li>
<p dir="ltr">Multi-disciplinary efforts engaging the same community-based partnerships. (Funding: up to $15,000)</p>
</li>
</ul><p>Benefits of Participation:</p>
<p dir="ltr">The ACES program is designed to provide faculty with the opportunity to develop, broaden, or deepen their research and teaching of community-engaged scholarship.</p>
<p dir="ltr">Participants receive and gain:</p>
<ul><li>
<p dir="ltr">intensive training and consulting from and with the ACES and Public Service Center staff</p>
</li>
<li>
<p dir="ltr">funds of up to $15,000 for costs related to course community projects, graduate student hire, and community-based project development (as detailed per application category above)</p>
</li>
<li>
<p dir="ltr">opportunities to present research and best practices at an on-campus ACES seminar</p>
</li>
<li>
<p dir="ltr">new relationships with an interdisciplinary cohort of faculty</p>
</li>
<li>
<p dir="ltr">enhanced capacity to build and sustain long-term relationships with community partners</p>
</li>
<li>
<p dir="ltr">the opportunity to mentor undergraduate and graduate students in the development of community-based partnership</p>
</li>
</ul><h1>Application Process and Selection Criteria</h1>
<p>Please refer to the <a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/aces_201718_application.docx" rel="noreferrer">ACES 2017-18 Application</a> and submit by June 26th at 5 pm, to <a href="mailto:americancultures@berkeley.edu" rel="noreferrer">americancultures@berkeley.edu<span><span class="element-invisible">(link sends e-mail)</span></span></a>.</p>
<p>Any questions can also be directed to ACES Program Director, Victoria Robinson at <a href="mailto:americancultures@berkeley.edu" rel="noreferrer">americancultures@berkeley.edu<span><span class="element-invisible">(link sends e-mail)</span></span></a></p>
<h1>Additional Resources:</h1>
<p>There are a number of substantial course development and partnership project support documents available through the UC Berkeley Public Service Center, including:</p>
<ul><li>
<p>Faculty Resources.<a href="http://publicservice.berkeley.edu/resources" rel="noreferrer"><span class="element-invisible"><br></span></a></p>
</li>
<li>
<p><a href="http://publicservice.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/pdf/Faculty_Toolkit_brief_update_Nov_2015.pdf" rel="noreferrer">The Handbook for Designing Community Based Courses.</a><a href="http://publicservice.berkeley.edu/faculty/handbook" rel="noreferrer"><span class="element-invisible"><br></span></a></p>
</li>
<li>
<p>The Experiential Learning Guideline.<a href="http://publicservice.berkeley.edu/resources" rel="noreferrer"><span class="element-invisible"><br></span></a></p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Take a look at our past and current ACES courses.</p>
</li>
</ul></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
</article>
  </div>

  
  </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>

</div><!-- /.boxton -->

          <div class="col-md-5 openberkeley-megamenu-links-column">
            <ul class="menu nav"><li class="expanded menu-link-overview"><a href="/collaborate" aria-label="Overview of Collaborate">Overview</a></li>
<li class="first leaf menu-link-faculty-grants"><a href="/faculty/course-development/ac-faculty-grants" title="">Faculty Grants</a></li>
<li class="collapsed menu-link-student-projects"><a href="/collaborate/aces-student-projects" title="">Student Projects</a></li>
<li class="collapsed menu-link-community-partners"><a href="/collaborate/aces-community-partners">Community Partners</a></li>
<li class="collapsed menu-link-american-cultures-engaged-scholarship"><a href="/collaborate/american-cultures-engaged-scholarship">American Cultures Engaged Scholarship</a></li>
<li class="last collapsed menu-link-events"><a href="http://events.berkeley.edu/index.php/calendar/sn/ac.html" title="" rel="noreferrer">Events</a></li>
</ul>          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </li>
</ul></li>
<li class="expanded menu-fields-menu-link dropdown menu-link-archives-"><a href="/events" title="" class="dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown" data-target="#">Archives <span class="fa fa-caret-down"></span></a><ul class="dropdown-menu">  <li class="openberkeley-megamenu-wrapper">
    <div class="entity entity-menu-fields menu-fields-main-menu openberkeley-megamenu clearfix">
      <div class="container-fluid">
        <div class="row">
          <div class="col-md-7 hidden-xs hidden-sm openberkeley-megamenu-content-column">
            <div class="field field-name-field-featured-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img class="openberkeley-megamenu" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/openberkeley_megamenu/public/explore_0.png?itok=FkO49Eti&amp;timestamp=1469764514" width="308" height="205" alt="" /></div></div></div>            <div class="field field-name-field-openberkeley-megamenu-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>On our Archives page you will discover a repository of historical information for our center including reports, publications, past events, press releases, videos and AC milestones. </p></div></div></div>          </div>
          <div class="col-md-5 openberkeley-megamenu-links-column">
            <ul class="menu nav"><li class="expanded menu-link-overview"><a href="/events" title="" aria-label="Overview of Archives">Overview</a></li>
<li class="first leaf menu-link-history-of-ac"><a href="/archives/history-american-cultures">History of AC</a></li>
<li class="leaf menu-link-newsletters"><a href="/archives/newsletters">Newsletters</a></li>
<li class="collapsed menu-link-events"><a href="/archives/events">Events</a></li>
<li class="leaf menu-link-press-releases"><a href="/archives/press-releases">Press Releases</a></li>
<li class="leaf menu-link-publications"><a href="/archives/publications">Publications</a></li>
<li class="last leaf menu-link-reports"><a href="/archives/reports">Reports</a></li>
</ul>          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </li>
</ul></li>
<li class="last leaf menu-link-contact-us"><a href="/contact">Contact Us</a></li>
            </ul>
                  </div>
        <div id="secondary-nav">
          <div class="container">
                          <h2 class="visible-xs visible-sm">Secondary navigation</h2>
              <ul id="secondary-menu" class="menu nav navbar-nav navbar-right">

<div id="main-wrapper" class="main-wrapper">
    <div id="pre-content" class="container">
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-md-12">
                  <div id="breadcrumb" class="visible-desktop">
            <h2 class="element-invisible">You are here</h2><div class="item-list"><ul class="breadcrumb"><li class="first"><a href="/home">Home</a></li>
<li class="last">How to find a list of American Cultures courses </li>
</ul></div>          </div>
                          <div class="page-title">
            <div class="container">
              <h1 class="title">How to find a list of American Cultures courses </h1>
            </div>
          </div>
                <div id="page-header">
                                      </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div> <!-- /#pre-content -->
    <div id="main-content" class="container">
        <div id="content" class="col-md-12">
      <div id="main" class="main" role="main" tabIndex="-1">
        <div id="main-inner">
            <div class="region region-content">
    
<div class="panel-display boxton clearfix radix-boxton" id="page-page">

  <div class="container-fluid">
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-md-12 radix-layouts-content panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-node-content"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <article class="node node-openberkeley-content-page clearfix">

  
      
  
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<h4></h4>
<p style="text-align:left">1.) Visit the <a href="http://classes.berkeley.edu/" rel="noreferrer">Berkeley Academic Guide</a>. </p>
<p style="text-align:left"><img alt="" title="" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/width_400/public/screen_shot_2016-12-22_at_1.47.11_pm_0.png?itok=DbQGxlKO&amp;timestamp=1482443988"></p>
<p style="text-align:left">2.) Select <strong>American Cultures</strong> under the <strong>General Requirements</strong> tab from the Menu on the left. </p>
<p style="text-align:left"><img alt="" title="" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/width_400/public/screen_shot_2016-12-22_at_1.49.28_pm.png?itok=1JoU0SC7&amp;timestamp=1482443485"></p>
<p style="text-align:left">3.) Select any relevant options from the Menu, such as <strong>Spring 2017</strong> under the <strong>Term</strong> tab.  </p>
<p style="text-align:left"><img alt="" title="" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/width_400/public/screen_shot_2016-12-22_at_1.51.52_pm.png?itok=Vu0BsA28&amp;timestamp=1482443880"></p>
<p style="text-align:left"></p>
<p style="text-align:left">For a list of historically approved AC courses at UC Berkeley, please visit <a href="http://academic-senate.berkeley.edu/committees/amcult/approved-ac-courses-berkeley" rel="noreferrer">List of Historically Approved Courses</a>.</p>
<p style="text-align:left">If you are still having trouble finding a list of courses, please <a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/contact" rel="noreferrer">contact us</a>.</p>
<p style="text-align:left"></p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
</article>
  </div>

  
  </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>

</div><!-- /.boxton -->
  </div>
        </div>
      </div> <!-- /#main -->
    </div> <!-- /#content -->
          </div> <!-- /#main-content -->
</div> <!-- /#main-wrapper -->

    <div id="pre-content" class="container">
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-md-12">
                  <div id="breadcrumb" class="visible-desktop">
            <h2 class="element-invisible">You are here</h2><div class="item-list"><ul class="breadcrumb"><li class="first"><a href="/home">Home</a></li>

<li class="last">Student Prize</li>

                          <div class="page-title">
            <div class="container">
              <h1 class="title">Student Prize</h1>
            </div>
          </div>
                <div id="page-header">
                                      </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div> <!-- /#pre-content -->
    <div id="main-content" class="container">
        <div id="content" class="col-md-9 col-md-push-3">
      <div id="main" class="main" role="main" tabIndex="-1">
        <div id="main-inner">
            <div class="region region-content">
    
<div class="panel-display pond clearfix radix-pond" id="page-page">

  <div class="container-fluid">
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-sm-12 radix-layouts-header panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vuuid-a153490a-0a9e-4107-8d8c-da9f8ca28400 pane-bundle-image clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-basic-image-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img class="openberkeley-image-full" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/openberkeley_image_full/public/student_prize_v3.png?itok=1D8dlIoA&amp;timestamp=1470940325" alt="Student Prize recipients" /></div></div></div></div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
<div class="panel-pane pane-node-content"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <article class="node node-openberkeley-content-page clearfix">

  
      
  
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Awarded since 2008, <em>the American Cultures Student Prize </em>provides students with the opportunity to highlight work taken in an American Cultures course which promotes understanding of race, ethnicity, and culture. The prize also recognizes student’s work as a standard of excellence in scholarship</p>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<h2><span>The Award</span></h2>
<ul><li>Recipient will receive a $1,000 award</li>
<li>Recipients will be honored at a public award ceremony</li>
<li>Receive electronic publication on the American Cultures <a href="http://escholarship.org/uc/search?entity=ac_prizes" rel="noreferrer">Escholarship site<span><span class="element-invisible">(link is external)</span></span></a> and permanently indicated as a recipient on the American Cultures website</li>
</ul><p>To learn more about our previous recipients, please click on the images on the right.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<h3>Eligibility/What to Submit:</h3>
<ul><li>Current UC Berkeley students can submit work from any AC course taken</li>
<li>Students can submit research papers, essays, poetry, short story, digital projects or other written works from all courses at all levels. Please note a 1-2 page interpretive essay must accompany the following types of submissions: poetry, short story, and digital projects</li>
</ul></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<h3>How to Apply:</h3>
<ul><li>Provide a statement of 750-1000 words describing your project/paper and how it supports the goal of the American Cultures curriculum to strengthen understanding of race, culture, ethnicity, and the diversity of the American experience. </li>
<li>Provide a draft or final version of the paper/project</li>
<li>Provide a letter of support from course instructor (letters from graduate students instructors are acceptable).  There is no page or word limit for the letter.  In the letter of support, the instructor should discuss your project and how and why the instructors feel the student's project supports the goal of the American Cultures curriculum--to strengthen understanding of race, culture, ethnicity, and the diversity of the American experience.  Instructors should mail or email the letter to support directly to the AC Center (see addresses below). </li>
</ul></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<h3>Submit all application materials to:</h3>
<div>The American Cultures Center</div>
<div>360 Stephens Hall #1050</div>
<div>Berkeley, CA 94720-1050</div>
<div>-OR-</div>
<div>Email materials to <a href="mailto:americancultures@berkeley.edu" rel="noreferrer">americancultures@berkeley.edu<span class="element-invisible">(link sends e-mail)</span><span><span class="element-invisible">(link sends e-mail)</span></span></a> (pdf and word formats are acceptable).</div>
<p></p>
<p>Deadline: April 14th, 2017</p>
<div></div>
<div>For questions, please contact us at <a href="mailto:americancultures@berkeley.edu" rel="noreferrer">americancultures@berkeley.edu<span class="element-invisible">(link sends e-mail)</span><span><span class="element-invisible">(link sends e-mail)</span></span></a> or call 510-664-7065. </div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
</article>
  </div>

  
  </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>

    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-basic-text-text field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><img alt="Banner for Students and Advisors page featuring students walking through Sather Gate" style="display:block; margin-left:auto; margin-right:auto" title="" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/panopoly_image_original/public/students4_1.png?itok=LdEMtmug&amp;timestamp=1471551450"></p></div></div></div></div>

  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-basic-text-text field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p style="text-align:center"><strong><em>"American Cultures is more than just a requirement, it's an opportunity to <span><em>make deep connections within our lives, communities and the U.S by </em></span>critically engaging in topics such as racial and social equity."</em></strong></p></div></div></div></div>

  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-basic-text-text field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><h2><a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/students/courses"><span style="color:#003262"><img style="float:left" alt="" title="" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/width_200/public/2014_04_15_15_29_54_2.jpg?itok=4zL0pbVt&amp;timestamp=1470953921">American Cultures (AC) Courses</span></a></h2>
<p>In the late 1980s, UC Berkeley students <a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/archives/history-american-cultures">fought for the AC Requirement</a> as a way to create a more inclusive undergraduate curriculum that reflected the diverse campus community. Today, the AC Requirement critically engages and exposes students to important issues of inequality throughout the United States by helping them develop a deeper understanding of race, culture, and ethnicity in the context of American society.</p>
<p><span>Students may satisfy the requirement by taking an approved course at UC Berkeley </span><span>or at Community College. Additionally, students can submit a petition to the Academic Senate to have a non-AC course approved for credit. </span><span>For more information about satisfying the AC requirement, please visit our</span> <a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/students/courses">Courses</a><span> page. </span></p></div></div></div></div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
<div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vid-1811 pane-bundle-text pane-fpid-548 clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-basic-text-text field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><h2><span><a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/students/courses/aces-courses"><img alt="American Cultures Engaged Scholarship Logo and Slogan &quot;Take a course, change yOUR future'" style="float:left" title="" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/width_200/public/aces_8.png?itok=3UptkE4c&amp;timestamp=1470954452">American Cultures Engaged Scholarship </a></span><a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/students/courses/aces-courses"><span>(ACES) c</span></a><span><a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/students/courses/aces-courses">ourses</a> </span></h2>
<p><span>Some American Cultures courses, known as 'ACES' courses, allow students to use concepts learned in class to address societal issues through partnerships with community organizations such as Urban Tilth, Sierra Club, the East Oakland Boxing Association, East Bay Sanctuary Covenant, Restorative Justice for Oakland Youth and many more.</span></p>
<p><span>To learn more about these courses, please visit our </span><a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/students/courses/aces-courses">ACES</a><span> page.</span></p></div></div></div></div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
<div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vid-1984 pane-bundle-text pane-fpid-554 clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-basic-text-text field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><h2><a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/students/faqs">Frequently Asked Questions</a></h2>
<p><a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/students/faqs">Please visit our FAQ Page</a> to read responses to our most frequently asked questions.</p></div></div></div></div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>
 
</div><!-- /.moscone -->
  </div>
        </div>
      </div> <!-- /#main -->
    </div> <!-- /#content -->
          </div> <!-- /#main-content -->

          <div class="col-md-7 hidden-xs hidden-sm openberkeley-megamenu-content-column">
            <div class="field field-name-field-featured-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img class="openberkeley-megamenu" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/openberkeley_megamenu/public/dsc_0009_.jpg?itok=89jjT_SB&amp;timestamp=1470417155" width="308" height="205" alt="" /></div></div></div>            <div class="field field-name-field-openberkeley-megamenu-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Students may take advantage of our programming by taking courses offered across campus, being a member of our Student Advisory Board or applying for the Student Prize for projects they develop in their AC courses. </p></div></div></div>          </div>
          <div class="col-md-5 openberkeley-megamenu-links-column">

          <div class="col-md-5 openberkeley-megamenu-links-column">

                  <div id="breadcrumb" class="visible-desktop">

                          <div class="page-title">
            <div class="container">
              <h1 class="title">Courses</h1>
            </div>
          </div>
                <div id="page-header">
                                      </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div> <!-- /#pre-content -->
    <div id="main-content" class="container">
        <div id="content" class="col-md-9 col-md-push-3">
      <div id="main" class="main" role="main" tabIndex="-1">
        <div id="main-inner">
            <div class="region region-content">
    
<div class="panel-display boxton clearfix radix-boxton" id="page-page">

  <div class="container-fluid">
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-md-12 radix-layouts-content panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vuuid-c8c2dd9e-4cb8-45a7-b278-48337877389e pane-bundle-text clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-basic-text-text field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><img style="display:block; margin-left:auto; margin-right:auto" alt="" title="" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/panopoly_image_original/public/courses_2.png?itok=-al19eEd&amp;timestamp=1471551020"></p></div></div></div></div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
<div class="panel-pane pane-node-content"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <article class="node node-openberkeley-content-page clearfix">

  
      
  
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><h2><span style="color:#003262">What is an American Cultures (AC) course?</span></h2>
<p>American Cultures courses are uniquely designed to critically engage in important issues within the United States by helping students develop a deeper understanding of race, culture, and ethnicity in the context of American society. If you would like to learn more about the history of American Cultures courses, please visit our <a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/archives/history-american-cultures">History of AC</a> page. </p>
<p>Our courses are offered in more than 40 departments and programs across UC Berkeley, and can additionally be used to satisfy University requirements such as the Humanities and Social Science Breadth requirements. To learn more, visit our <a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/students/how-satisfy-ac-requirement">How to Satisfy the AC Requirement page.<br></a></p>
<p></p>
<h2><span style="color:#003262">American Cultures Engaged Scholarship (ACES) courses </span></h2>
<p><span>Some American Cultures courses provide opportunities for students to participate in collaborative social justice projects alongside community organizations. These courses are called American Cultures Engaged Scholarship courses (ACES). Examples of ACES projects include developing apps and wiki pages that promote social justice, mentoring K-12 at-risk youth, among others to create community impact. If you would like to learn more about ACES student projects, please visit our </span><a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/collaborate/aces-student-projects">Student Projects</a><span> page. </span></p>
<p></p>
<h2>Finding an AC Course</h2>
<p>To find a current list of courses that satisfy the AC requirement at UC Berkeley, please visit <a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/how-find-list-american-cultures-courses">Finding AC Courses</a>.</p>
<p>For a list of historically approved AC courses at UC Berkeley, please visit <a href="http://academic-senate.berkeley.edu/committees/amcult/approved-ac-courses-berkeley" rel="noreferrer">List of Historically Approved Courses at UC Berkeley</a></p>
<p>For a list of historically approved AC courses at other colleges or programs, please visit <a href="http://academic-senate.berkeley.edu/committees/amcult/approved-ac-courses-other-colleges" rel="noreferrer">List of Historically Approved Courses at Other Colleges</a></p>
<p></p>
<h2>Support for your AC Course</h2>
<p>Are you looking for help with your research for an AC course project?  Our AC Librarian, Corliss Lee, is happy to help you discover and explore library resources for your project.  To set up an appointment, please email her at <a href="mailto:clee@library.berkeley.edu" rel="noreferrer">clee@library.berkeley.edu</a>.</p>
<p>We also encourage you to explore other projects students have developed in past AC courses, in our <a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/collaborate/aces-student-projects">ACES Student Projects page</a>, or our <a href="http://escholarship.org/uc/search?entity=ac_prizes" rel="noreferrer">EScholarship site</a> to read about other students' award winning research projects. </p>
<hr><p></p>
<p><span>For further information, please visit our </span><a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/students/faqs">Frequently Asked Questions</a><span> page.  </span></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
</article>
  </div>

  
  </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>

    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-md-12">
                  <div id="breadcrumb" class="visible-desktop">
            <h2 class="element-invisible">You are here</h2><div class="item-list"><ul class="breadcrumb"><li class="first"><a href="/home">Home</a></li>

                          <div class="page-title">
            <div class="container">
              <h1 class="title">How to Satisfy the AC Requirement </h1>
            </div>
          </div>
                <div id="page-header">
                                      </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div> <!-- /#pre-content -->
    <div id="main-content" class="container">
        <div id="content" class="col-md-9 col-md-push-3">
      <div id="main" class="main" role="main" tabIndex="-1">
        <div id="main-inner">
            <div class="region region-content">
    
<div class="panel-display boxton clearfix radix-boxton" id="page-page">

  <div class="container-fluid">
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-md-12 radix-layouts-content panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-node-content"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <article class="node node-openberkeley-content-page clearfix">

  
      
  
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><h2><span>Satisfying the AC Requirement at UC Berkeley</span></h2>
<p>American Cultures courses can be taken at any time during a student's undergraduate career at Berkeley, but we strongly urge students to meet the requirement as early as possible.  Students must receive a grade no lower than C- or P to satisfy the requirement. </p>
<p>For a list of courses that satisfy the AC requirement at UC Berkeley, please visit the <a href="http://classes.berkeley.edu/search/class/?f%5B0%5D=im_field_term_name%3A566&amp;f%5B1%5D=sm_general_requirement%3AAmerican%20Cultures" rel="noreferrer">UC Berkeley Classes website<span><span class="element-invisible">(link is external)</span></span></a>.</p>
<p>If you are looking for a list of approved American Cultures courses offered at UC Berkeley since 1991, please visit the <a href="http://academic-senate.berkeley.edu/committees/amcult/approved-ac-courses-berkeley" rel="noreferrer">Academic Senate's list</a>.</p>
<h2>Satisfying the AC Requirement at<span> Other Colleges</span></h2>
<p>AC courses may also be taken "off-campus" at a community college or a partner institution. For a list of approved courses, please visit the <a href="http://academic-senate.berkeley.edu/committees/amcult/approved-ac-courses-other-colleges" rel="noreferrer">Academic Senate's list</a>, or refer to assist.org. </p>
<h2>Petitioning a Course for AC Credit</h2>
<p>Students also may submit a petition form to the Academic Senate if they believe a specific course satisfies the American Cultures Requirement. </p>
<p>The AC curriculum has been specially developed to enrich the student experience at UC Berkeley, and as such, is a unique reflection of UC Berkeley faculty's expertise in fields related to issues of critical diversity studies. However, there are instances in which courses offered at other educational institutions also formulate experiences which meet the expectations of the AC requirement at UC Berkeley. In this case, students have the option of submitting a petition to the Academic Senate, to have a non-AC course they have taken and successfully passed, if they believe that course satisfies the AC requirement.</p>
<p>It is important to keep in mind, that just because a non-AC course "looks" or "feels” like an AC course this does not mean that a petition will be approved by the Academic Senate.  AC courses are governed by a very specific regulation that is interpreted and applied by the Academic Senate’s Subcommittee on the Breadth Requirement in American Cultures.</p>
<p>Please note, a separate campus entity, the Academic Senate Subcommittee, reviews all student petitions, not the AC Center.  Student petitions are rigorously reviewed, and the Subcommittee applies the highest standards of college-level course material, course readings, and analytical skills required for course assignments. Therefore, serious consideration should be given to the strength of a substitution request before an individual submits a petition.</p>
<p><strong>Basic Information</strong>: The AC Subcommittee meets once a month on Fridays during the fall and spring semesters. Student petitions must be received by 4 p.m. on the Friday before the scheduled meeting.</p>
<p>For a list of meetings, please visit <a href="http://academic-senate.berkeley.edu/committees/amcult/info" rel="noreferrer">http://academic-senate.berkeley.edu/committees/amcult</a>.</p>
<p>To download a petition form, please visit <a href="http://academic-senate.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/committees/amcult/amcult_studentpetition_10.2016_0.pdf" rel="noreferrer">http://academic-senate.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/committees/amcult/amcult_studentpetition_10.2016_0.pdf</a>.</p>
<p>All materials should be submitted directly to the Academic Senate in 320 Stephens Hall #5842. </p>
<p>Students will receive a written response from the Academic Senate within two weeks of the meeting when the petition was reviewed.</p>
<p></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
</article>
  </div>

  
  </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>

    <div id="pre-content" class="container">
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-md-12">
                  <div id="breadcrumb" class="visible-desktop">
            <h2 class="element-invisible">You are here</h2><div class="item-list"><ul class="breadcrumb"><li class="first"><a href="/home">Home</a></li>

<li class="last">Student Prize</li>

                          <div class="page-title">
            <div class="container">
              <h1 class="title">Student Prize</h1>
            </div>
          </div>
                <div id="page-header">
                                      </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div> <!-- /#pre-content -->
    <div id="main-content" class="container">
        <div id="content" class="col-md-9 col-md-push-3">
      <div id="main" class="main" role="main" tabIndex="-1">
        <div id="main-inner">
            <div class="region region-content">
    
<div class="panel-display pond clearfix radix-pond" id="page-page">

  <div class="container-fluid">
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-sm-12 radix-layouts-header panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vuuid-a153490a-0a9e-4107-8d8c-da9f8ca28400 pane-bundle-image clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-basic-image-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img class="openberkeley-image-full" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/openberkeley_image_full/public/student_prize_v3.png?itok=1D8dlIoA&amp;timestamp=1470940325" alt="Student Prize recipients" /></div></div></div></div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
<div class="panel-pane pane-node-content"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <article class="node node-openberkeley-content-page clearfix">

  
      
  
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Awarded since 2008, <em>the American Cultures Student Prize </em>provides students with the opportunity to highlight work taken in an American Cultures course which promotes understanding of race, ethnicity, and culture. The prize also recognizes student’s work as a standard of excellence in scholarship</p>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<h2><span>The Award</span></h2>
<ul><li>Recipient will receive a $1,000 award</li>
<li>Recipients will be honored at a public award ceremony</li>
<li>Receive electronic publication on the American Cultures <a href="http://escholarship.org/uc/search?entity=ac_prizes" rel="noreferrer">Escholarship site<span><span class="element-invisible">(link is external)</span></span></a> and permanently indicated as a recipient on the American Cultures website</li>
</ul><p>To learn more about our previous recipients, please click on the images on the right.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<h3>Eligibility/What to Submit:</h3>
<ul><li>Current UC Berkeley students can submit work from any AC course taken</li>
<li>Students can submit research papers, essays, poetry, short story, digital projects or other written works from all courses at all levels. Please note a 1-2 page interpretive essay must accompany the following types of submissions: poetry, short story, and digital projects</li>
</ul></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<h3>How to Apply:</h3>
<ul><li>Provide a statement of 750-1000 words describing your project/paper and how it supports the goal of the American Cultures curriculum to strengthen understanding of race, culture, ethnicity, and the diversity of the American experience. </li>
<li>Provide a draft or final version of the paper/project</li>
<li>Provide a letter of support from course instructor (letters from graduate students instructors are acceptable).  There is no page or word limit for the letter.  In the letter of support, the instructor should discuss your project and how and why the instructors feel the student's project supports the goal of the American Cultures curriculum--to strengthen understanding of race, culture, ethnicity, and the diversity of the American experience.  Instructors should mail or email the letter to support directly to the AC Center (see addresses below). </li>
</ul></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<h3>Submit all application materials to:</h3>
<div>The American Cultures Center</div>
<div>360 Stephens Hall #1050</div>
<div>Berkeley, CA 94720-1050</div>
<div>-OR-</div>
<div>Email materials to <a href="mailto:americancultures@berkeley.edu" rel="noreferrer">americancultures@berkeley.edu<span class="element-invisible">(link sends e-mail)</span><span><span class="element-invisible">(link sends e-mail)</span></span></a> (pdf and word formats are acceptable).</div>
<p></p>
<p>Deadline: April 14th, 2017</p>
<div></div>
<div>For questions, please contact us at <a href="mailto:americancultures@berkeley.edu" rel="noreferrer">americancultures@berkeley.edu<span class="element-invisible">(link sends e-mail)</span><span><span class="element-invisible">(link sends e-mail)</span></span></a> or call 510-664-7065. </div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
</article>
  </div>

  
  </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>

                          <div class="page-title">
            <div class="container">
              <h1 class="title">Courses</h1>
            </div>
          </div>
                <div id="page-header">
                                      </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div> <!-- /#pre-content -->
    <div id="main-content" class="container">
        <div id="content" class="col-md-9 col-md-push-3">
      <div id="main" class="main" role="main" tabIndex="-1">
        <div id="main-inner">
            <div class="region region-content">
    
<div class="panel-display boxton clearfix radix-boxton" id="page-page">

  <div class="container-fluid">
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-md-12 radix-layouts-content panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vuuid-c8c2dd9e-4cb8-45a7-b278-48337877389e pane-bundle-text clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-basic-text-text field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><img style="display:block; margin-left:auto; margin-right:auto" alt="" title="" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/panopoly_image_original/public/courses_2.png?itok=-al19eEd&amp;timestamp=1471551020"></p></div></div></div></div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
<div class="panel-pane pane-node-content"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <article class="node node-openberkeley-content-page clearfix">

  
      
  
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><h2><span style="color:#003262">What is an American Cultures (AC) course?</span></h2>
<p>American Cultures courses are uniquely designed to critically engage in important issues within the United States by helping students develop a deeper understanding of race, culture, and ethnicity in the context of American society. If you would like to learn more about the history of American Cultures courses, please visit our <a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/archives/history-american-cultures">History of AC</a> page. </p>
<p>Our courses are offered in more than 40 departments and programs across UC Berkeley, and can additionally be used to satisfy University requirements such as the Humanities and Social Science Breadth requirements. To learn more, visit our <a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/students/how-satisfy-ac-requirement">How to Satisfy the AC Requirement page.<br></a></p>
<p></p>
<h2><span style="color:#003262">American Cultures Engaged Scholarship (ACES) courses </span></h2>
<p><span>Some American Cultures courses provide opportunities for students to participate in collaborative social justice projects alongside community organizations. These courses are called American Cultures Engaged Scholarship courses (ACES). Examples of ACES projects include developing apps and wiki pages that promote social justice, mentoring K-12 at-risk youth, among others to create community impact. If you would like to learn more about ACES student projects, please visit our </span><a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/collaborate/aces-student-projects">Student Projects</a><span> page. </span></p>
<p></p>
<h2>Finding an AC Course</h2>
<p>To find a current list of courses that satisfy the AC requirement at UC Berkeley, please visit <a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/how-find-list-american-cultures-courses">Finding AC Courses</a>.</p>
<p>For a list of historically approved AC courses at UC Berkeley, please visit <a href="http://academic-senate.berkeley.edu/committees/amcult/approved-ac-courses-berkeley" rel="noreferrer">List of Historically Approved Courses at UC Berkeley</a></p>
<p>For a list of historically approved AC courses at other colleges or programs, please visit <a href="http://academic-senate.berkeley.edu/committees/amcult/approved-ac-courses-other-colleges" rel="noreferrer">List of Historically Approved Courses at Other Colleges</a></p>
<p></p>
<h2>Support for your AC Course</h2>
<p>Are you looking for help with your research for an AC course project?  Our AC Librarian, Corliss Lee, is happy to help you discover and explore library resources for your project.  To set up an appointment, please email her at <a href="mailto:clee@library.berkeley.edu" rel="noreferrer">clee@library.berkeley.edu</a>.</p>
<p>We also encourage you to explore other projects students have developed in past AC courses, in our <a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/collaborate/aces-student-projects">ACES Student Projects page</a>, or our <a href="http://escholarship.org/uc/search?entity=ac_prizes" rel="noreferrer">EScholarship site</a> to read about other students' award winning research projects. </p>
<hr><p></p>
<p><span>For further information, please visit our </span><a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/students/faqs">Frequently Asked Questions</a><span> page.  </span></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
</article>
  </div>

  
  </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>

</div><!-- /.boxton -->
  </div>
        </div>
      </div> <!-- /#main -->
    </div> <!-- /#content -->

    <div class="entity entity-menu-fields menu-fields-main-menu openberkeley-megamenu clearfix">
      <div class="container-fluid">
        <div class="row">
          <div class="col-md-7 hidden-xs hidden-sm openberkeley-megamenu-content-column">
            <div class="field field-name-field-featured-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img class="openberkeley-megamenu" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/openberkeley_megamenu/public/dsc_0009_.jpg?itok=89jjT_SB&amp;timestamp=1470417155" width="308" height="205" alt="" /></div></div></div>            <div class="field field-name-field-openberkeley-megamenu-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Students may take advantage of our programming by taking courses offered across campus, being a member of our Student Advisory Board or applying for the Student Prize for projects they develop in their AC courses. </p></div></div></div>          </div>
          <div class="col-md-5 openberkeley-megamenu-links-column">
            <ul class="menu nav"><li class="expanded menu-link-overview"><a href="/students" title="" aria-label="Overview of Students">Overview</a></li>

          <div class="col-md-7 hidden-xs hidden-sm openberkeley-megamenu-content-column">
            <div class="field field-name-field-featured-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img class="openberkeley-megamenu" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/openberkeley_megamenu/public/lsadvising2_finkle_nancy.jpg?itok=IrLURM54&amp;timestamp=1471552543" width="308" height="205" alt="College advisor counseling student " /></div></div></div>            <div class="field field-name-field-openberkeley-megamenu-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Our staff recognizes the critical role you play in advising students for exciting opportunities in this unique curriculum.  On this section, you will find information to advise students on the AC Requirement.  </p></div></div></div>          </div>
          <div class="col-md-5 openberkeley-megamenu-links-column">
