    <div class="entity entity-menu-fields menu-fields-main-menu openberkeley-megamenu clearfix">
      <div class="container-fluid">
        <div class="row">
          <div class="col-md-7 hidden-xs hidden-sm openberkeley-megamenu-content-column">
            <div class="field field-name-field-featured-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img class="openberkeley-megamenu" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/openberkeley_megamenu/public/shiftcourse_hero_836px_c.jpg?itok=A1pRkJrF&amp;timestamp=1469833877" width="308" height="205" alt="" /></div></div></div>            <div class="field field-name-field-openberkeley-megamenu-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>The American Cultures Center is proud to offer faculty exciting opportunities such as the possibility to receive a grant to continue, or create an American Cultures course, be awarded for excellence in teaching, and even become a Chancellor's Public Scholar! </p></div></div></div>          </div>
          <div class="col-md-5 openberkeley-megamenu-links-column">
            <ul class="menu nav"><li class="expanded menu-link-overview"><a href="/faculty" title="" aria-label="Overview of Faculty">Overview</a></li>

<li class="expanded menu-fields-menu-link dropdown menu-link-collaborate-"><a href="/collaborate" class="dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown" data-target="#">Collaborate <span class="fa fa-caret-down"></span></a><ul class="dropdown-menu">  <li class="openberkeley-megamenu-wrapper">
    <div class="entity entity-menu-fields menu-fields-main-menu openberkeley-megamenu clearfix">
      <div class="container-fluid">
        <div class="row">
          <div class="col-md-7 hidden-xs hidden-sm openberkeley-megamenu-content-column">
            <div class="field field-name-field-featured-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img class="openberkeley-megamenu" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/openberkeley_megamenu/public/aces-loop-12-ol_v3_0.png?itok=9QecHK71&amp;timestamp=1470417270" width="308" height="205" alt="ACES logo" /></div></div></div>            <div class="field field-name-field-openberkeley-megamenu-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>We provide opportunities for students, faculty and community organizations to collaborate on research-based social justice projects through courses in our American Cultures Engaged Scholarship (ACES) Program.</p></div></div></div>          </div>
          <div class="col-md-5 openberkeley-megamenu-links-column">
            <ul class="menu nav"><li class="expanded menu-link-overview"><a href="/collaborate" aria-label="Overview of Collaborate">Overview</a></li>

    <div id="pre-content" class="container">
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-md-12">
                  <div id="breadcrumb" class="visible-desktop">
            <h2 class="element-invisible">You are here</h2><div class="item-list"><ul class="breadcrumb"><li class="first"><a href="/home">Home</a></li>
<li><a href="/students" title="">Students</a></li>

<li class="last">Engaged Scholarship Courses</li>
</ul></div>          </div>
                          <div class="page-title">
            <div class="container">
              <h1 class="title">ACES Courses</h1>
            </div>
          </div>
                <div id="page-header">
                                      </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div> <!-- /#pre-content -->
    <div id="main-content" class="container">
        <div id="content" class="col-md-9 col-md-push-3">
      <div id="main" class="main" role="main" tabIndex="-1">
        <div id="main-inner">
            <div class="region region-content">
    
<div class="panel-display geary clearfix radix-geary" id="page-page">

  <div class="container-fluid">
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-sm-12 radix-layouts-header panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vuuid-40b0d41e-f5f4-411a-9ac0-5dfc63d53d0a pane-bundle-openberkeley-widgets-promo clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="openberkeley-widgets-promo fieldable-panels-pane openberkeley-widgets-color-scheme-wellman-tile">
      <div class="openberkeley-widgets-label">
    <div class="openberkeley-widgets-label-inner">
      <h3>&quot;ACES has made me realize the possibility and pedagogical benefit of off-campus experiences for students.  I realize I can do this without sacrificing the rigorous academic and theoretical elements of my course&quot;</h3>
          </div>
  </div>
  </div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
<div class="panel-pane pane-node-content"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <article class="node node-openberkeley-content-page clearfix">

  
      
  
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p style="text-align:left"><span>ACES courses represent corners of campus that highlight the intent of the AC requirement, while also deepening the meaning of that intent through a combination of multi-disciplinary research and praxis, the development of students and community partners as co-educators, mentoring opportunties, and an increased and sustained accesibility of information.</span></p>
<p><span>Please refer to our <a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/aces_courses_udpatedmay2016.pdf">ACES course list</a> for past and current courses.</span> To learn about projects have developed with <a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/collaborate/aces-community-partners">ACES community partners</a>, please visit the <a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/aces/berkeleyaces-0" rel="noreferrer">ACES Student Community Projects</a>. </p>
<p>The ACES Program provides support for faculty to incorporate community-based learning into new or revised AC courses. If you are a faculty member interested in developing or continuing an ACES course, please visit our G<a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/become-involved/grants" rel="noreferrer">rants page</a>.</p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
</article>
  </div>

  
  </div>
<div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vuuid-6abf4919-b73d-46a3-9b49-fbf718c0f448 pane-bundle-text clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-basic-text-text field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/students/courses/spotlight-ac-courses"><img alt="Three Faculty Members promoting Explore AC Page (AC Faculty Interviews) Sean Burns, Derek Van Rheenen and Khalid Kadir" class="openberkeley-theme-brand-image-focused" title="" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/panopoly_image_original/public/exploreac_bottomrow.png?itok=1TEC51Y-&amp;timestamp=1469570162"></a><a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/students/courses/spotlight-ac-courses" title=""><br></a></p></div></div></div></div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-sm-4 radix-layouts-column1 panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
                  </div>
      </div>
      <div class="col-sm-4 radix-layouts-column2 panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
                  </div>
      </div>
      <div class="col-sm-4 radix-layouts-column3 panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
                  </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>
  
</div><!-- /.geary -->
  </div>
        </div>

        <div class="row">
          <div class="col-md-7 hidden-xs hidden-sm openberkeley-megamenu-content-column">
            <div class="field field-name-field-featured-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img class="openberkeley-megamenu" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/openberkeley_megamenu/public/explore_0.png?itok=FkO49Eti&amp;timestamp=1469764514" width="308" height="205" alt="" /></div></div></div>            <div class="field field-name-field-openberkeley-megamenu-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>On our Archives page you will discover a repository of historical information for our center including reports, publications, past events, press releases, videos and AC milestones. </p></div></div></div>          </div>
          <div class="col-md-5 openberkeley-megamenu-links-column">
            <ul class="menu nav"><li class="expanded menu-link-overview"><a href="/events" title="" aria-label="Overview of Archives">Overview</a></li>

</ul>          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </li>
</ul></li>

<div id="main-wrapper" class="main-wrapper">
    <div id="pre-content" class="container">
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-md-12">
                  <div id="breadcrumb" class="visible-desktop">
            <h2 class="element-invisible">You are here</h2><div class="item-list"><ul class="breadcrumb"><li class="first"><a href="/home">Home</a></li>
<li><a href="/students" title="">Students</a></li>
<li><a href="/students/courses">Courses</a></li>
<li class="last">Spotlight on AC Courses</li>
</ul></div>          </div>
                          <div class="page-title">
            <div class="container">
              <h1 class="title">Spotlight on AC Courses </h1>
            </div>
          </div>
                <div id="page-header">
                                      </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div> <!-- /#pre-content -->
    <div id="main-content" class="container">
        <div id="content" class="col-md-9 col-md-push-3">
      <div id="main" class="main" role="main" tabIndex="-1">
        <div id="main-inner">
            <div class="region region-content">
    
<div class="panel-display sutro clearfix radix-sutro" id="page-page">

  <div class="container-fluid">
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-sm-12 radix-layouts-header panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-node-content"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <article class="node node-openberkeley-content-page clearfix">

  
      
  
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><strong>      The following are courses that feature interviews with faculty members discussing how their classes bring their research interests with community partners together to teach undergraduates. Please visit each page to learn more about the course.</strong></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
</article>
  </div>

  
  </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-sm-6 radix-layouts-column1 panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vid-2128 pane-bundle-image pane-fpid-629 clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-basic-image-caption field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/students/courses/spotlight-ac-courses/course-spotlight-engineering-environment-and-society"><img alt="khalid kadir" style="display:block; margin-left:auto; margin-right:auto" title="" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/width_400/public/khalidexplore.png?itok=PVxsyRZR&amp;timestamp=1471993419"></a></p></div></div></div></div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
<div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vid-2203 pane-bundle-text pane-fpid-622 clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-basic-text-text field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Engineering 157AC / International and Area Studies 157AC: Engineering, The Environment, and Society at UC Berkeley will challenge students to look beyond the technical elements of their work and recognize the deeply social and political nature of engineering questions. For more information visit our <a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/students/courses/spotlight-ac-courses/aces-course-engineering-157-acias-157ac" rel="noreferrer">Engineering 157AC Spotlight Page</a></p></div></div></div></div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
<div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vuuid-3e8048be-1164-47a7-8470-77a5e8cb5c1e pane-bundle-text clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-basic-text-text field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p style="text-align:center"><a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/node/49/"><img alt="greg" title="" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/width_400/public/gregexplore.png?itok=Q7Q0KPcV&amp;timestamp=1471993512"></a></p></div></div></div></div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
<div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vid-2204 pane-bundle-text pane-fpid-624 clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-basic-text-text field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><span>Practice of Art W23AC American Cybercultures: Principles of Internet Citizenship </span>examines how the growth of online participation influences the development of and intersects online and residential communities. Students participate in online discussions surrounding internet culture or cyberculture within a modern context as well as categories of personhood that make up the UC Berkeley American Cultures rubric (race and ethnicity), as well as to gender, nation, and disability. For more information pleas visit our <a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/node/49/">Practice of Art W23AC Spotlight Page</a></p></div></div></div></div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
<div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vid-2120 pane-bundle-text pane-fpid-631 clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-basic-text-text field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/students/courses/spotlight-ac-courses/course-spotlight-social-movements-urban-histories-and-politics"><img alt="sean burns" style="display:block; margin-left:auto; margin-right:auto" title="" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/width_400/public/seanexplore.jpg?itok=hCg-y4Wv&amp;timestamp=1471993550"></a></p></div></div></div></div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
<div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vid-2119 pane-bundle-text pane-fpid-636 clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-basic-text-text field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>In this course, Dr. Burns examines the history of progressive social movements in the San Francisco Bay Area while including topics of history, sociology, urban geography, and ethnic studies. To learn more, visit our <a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/students/courses/spotlight-ac-courses/course-spotlight-social-movements-urban-histories-and-politics">IAS 158AC / PACS 148AC Spotlight Page</a></p></div></div></div></div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
        </div>
      </div>
      <div class="col-sm-6 radix-layouts-column2 panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vid-2127 pane-bundle-image pane-fpid-634 clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-basic-image-caption field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p style="text-align:center"><a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/students/courses/spotlight-ac-courses/course-spotlight-american-sport-culture-and-education"><img alt="derek " title="" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/width_400/public/derekexplore.png?itok=M_KlEG_-&amp;timestamp=1471994462"></a></p></div></div></div></div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
<div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vid-2126 pane-bundle-text pane-fpid-623 clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-basic-text-text field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Education 75AC focuses on sports culture in the U.S. through an intersectional lens. This course highlights the ways in which sports have contributed to our society as well as how they marginalize certain communities through the bases of race, class, gender, sexuality, and ability. To learn more, please visit our <a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/students/courses/spotlight-ac-courses/course-spotlight-american-sport-culture-and-education">Education 75AC Spotlight Page</a></p></div></div></div></div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
<div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vuuid-af8a87e5-bd0d-43de-86c5-1da87e51298a pane-bundle-text clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-basic-text-text field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p style="text-align:center"><a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/students/courses/spotlight-ac-courses/course-spotlight-human-biological-variation"><img alt="chris schmidt" title="" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/width_400/public/chrisexplore_0.png?itok=yJxvkdeI&amp;timestamp=1471994079"></a></p></div></div></div></div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
<div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vid-2121 pane-bundle-text pane-fpid-633 clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-basic-text-text field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><span><span>Integrative Biology 35AC </span></span><span>exposes the cultural and historical relevance of biology to both students who may never take another biology class in their lives and scientists that have intimate knowledge of their subject but do not discover its connection within larger contexts. The course is innovative in the way it teaches students how biological variation plays a role in day-to-day life-from interactions on the street, to governmental policies on healthcare and food stamps, to how a doctor interacts with their patients. Visit our <a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/students/courses/spotlight-ac-courses/course-spotlight-human-biological-variation">Integrative Biology 35AC Spotlight Page</a> to learn more. </span></p></div></div></div></div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-sm-12 radix-layouts-footer panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
                  </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>
 
</div><!-- /.sutro -->

<li class="leaf menu-mlid-2816 menu-link-course-spotlight-american-cybercultures-principles-of-internet-citizenship"><a href="/students/courses/spotlight-ac-courses/course-spotlight-american-cybercultures-principles-internet">Course Spotlight: American Cybercultures: Principles of Internet Citizenship</a></li>

      </nav><!-- /.navbar-collapse -->
    </div><!-- /.navbar -->
  </div> <!-- /.container -->
</header>


<div id="main-wrapper" class="main-wrapper">
    <div id="pre-content" class="container">
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-md-12">
                  <div id="breadcrumb" class="visible-desktop">
            <h2 class="element-invisible">You are here</h2><div class="item-list"><ul class="breadcrumb"><li class="first"><a href="/home">Home</a></li>
<li><a href="/students" title="">Students</a></li>
<li><a href="/students/courses">Courses</a></li>
<li><a href="/students/courses/spotlight-ac-courses">Spotlight on AC Courses</a></li>
<li class="last">Course Spotlight: Engineering, The Environment, and Society</li>
</ul></div>          </div>
                          <div class="page-title">
            <div class="container">
              <h1 class="title">Course Spotlight: Engineering, The Environment, and Society</h1>
            </div>
          </div>
                <div id="page-header">
                                      </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div> <!-- /#pre-content -->
    <div id="main-content" class="container">
        <div id="content" class="col-md-9 col-md-push-3">
      <div id="main" class="main" role="main" tabIndex="-1">
        <div id="main-inner">
            <div class="region region-content">
    
<div class="panel-display boxton clearfix radix-boxton" id="page-page">

  <div class="container-fluid">
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-md-12 radix-layouts-content panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-node-content"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <article class="node node-openberkeley-content-page clearfix">

  
      
  
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><span>This Spring, Dr. Khalid Kadir, </span><span>will be teaching a new ACES course, Engineering 157AC / International and Area Studies 157AC: Engineering, The Environment, and Society at UC Berkeley. The course will challenge students to look beyond the technical elements of their work and recognize the deeply social and political nature of engineering questions. With help from Berkeley Ph.D. student and Chancellor's Public Fellow Lara Cushing, Dr. Kadir has established partnerships with local and regional African-American, Asian-American, and Latino community groups, through which students will have the opportunity to engage in multiple real-world projects affecting these diverse communities. Projects address a variety of environmental and social justice issues including contaminated drinking water, industrial pollution, and air pollution.</span></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
</article>
  </div>

  
  </div>
<div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vuuid-d0ab0e01-995a-40d4-8345-871c44c6d1c2 pane-bundle-video clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-video-file field-type-file field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><div id="file-149" class="file file-video file-video-youtube">

        <h2 class="element-hidden"><a href="/file/149">ACES Faculty Spotlight: Khalid Kadir</a></h2>
    
  
  <div class="content">
    <div class="media-youtube-video media-youtube-1">
  <iframe class="media-youtube-player" id="media-youtube-frsd-kvkg0g" width="640" height="390" title="ACES Faculty Spotlight: Khalid Kadir" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/FrsD-kvKg0g?wmode=opaque&enablejsapi=1&modestbranding=1&playerapiid=media-youtube-frsd-kvkg0g&rel=0" allowfullscreen>Video of ACES Faculty Spotlight: Khalid Kadir</iframe>
</div>
  </div>

  
</div>
</div></div></div></div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
<div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vuuid-90f3cf37-69cd-460f-8331-cfef3c531686 pane-bundle-text clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-basic-text-text field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>While both meeting the American Cultures requirement and as part of the ACES program, Engineering 157AC is set to become a signature course within the College of Engineering.  As stated by Associate Dean for Equity and Inclusion, College of Engineering Oscar Dubon, "The College of Engineering is delighted to offer E157AC.  With this course the College has taken an important step forward in affirming that social justice should play a central role in the preparation of our engineering students.  The course also signals the College's commitment to engage a diverse engineering student body that produces technology leaders and innovators who will tackle challenges faced by all communities in our society.  Dr. Kadir is an outstanding instructor, and we are very fortunate to have him on board."</p>
<div>
<p>This course is part of the American Cultures Engaged Scholarship (ACES) Program bringing the research interests of faculty and community partners together in the teaching of undergraduate courses. Further information and a listing of other ACES courses can be found on our <a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/students/courses/aces-courses">ACES Courses</a> page.</p>
</div></div></div></div></div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>

</div><!-- /.boxton -->
  </div>
        </div>
      </div> <!-- /#main -->
    </div> <!-- /#content -->
        <div id="sidebar-first" class="col-md-3 col-md-pull-9">
      <div class="region region-sidebar-first">

<div id="main-wrapper" class="main-wrapper">
    <div id="pre-content" class="container">
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-md-12">
                  <div id="breadcrumb" class="visible-desktop">
            <h2 class="element-invisible">You are here</h2><div class="item-list"><ul class="breadcrumb"><li class="first"><a href="/home">Home</a></li>
<li><a href="/students" title="">Students</a></li>
<li><a href="/students/courses">Courses</a></li>
<li><a href="/students/courses/spotlight-ac-courses">Spotlight on AC Courses</a></li>
<li class="last">Course Spotlight: American Cybercultures: Principles of Internet Citizenship</li>
</ul></div>          </div>
                          <div class="page-title">
            <div class="container">
              <h1 class="title">Course Spotlight: American Cybercultures: Principles of Internet Citizenship</h1>
            </div>
          </div>
                <div id="page-header">
                                      </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div> <!-- /#pre-content -->
    <div id="main-content" class="container">
        <div id="content" class="col-md-9 col-md-push-3">
      <div id="main" class="main" role="main" tabIndex="-1">
        <div id="main-inner">
            <div class="region region-content">
    
<div class="panel-display boxton clearfix radix-boxton" id="page-page">

  <div class="container-fluid">
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-md-12 radix-layouts-content panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-node-content"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <article class="node node-openberkeley-content-page clearfix">

  
      
  
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><span>Professor Greg Niemeyer is currently teaching the first AC online course: </span><span><strong>Practice of Art W23AC American Cybercultures: Principles of Internet Citizenship</strong>.  </span><span>Although Professor Niemeyer has taught this course for over ten years both in an in-person and hybrid format, this Spring marks the first time it is offered completely online. Fittingly enough, the course examines how the growth of online participation influences the development of and intersects online and residential communities. Students participate in online discussions surrounding internet culture or cyberculture within a modern context as well as categories of personhood that make up the UC Berkeley American Cultures rubric (race and ethnicity), as well as to gender, nation, and disability.</span><span> In addition, </span><span>students will work in small groups with about five members and complete learning missions through research and creative assignments using technology such as social apps to benefit their communities</span><span> (<a href="http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001qGFjnl0YY4me8LDquzPW2MCdISZM5_HMcOa3v3mvV7cz5GZW47SUY4iCLoW63LsyPHqjkY3AnixCeO_OP-_GrXfrXavY6pLCuQw50wc4pFXQz4xrWSnss2I1YBGMQ3G4MrmJGnGbkOHnN4qJSRiCoafTSoXiWsXuE8RjLOSyFU27tageU0O72go44raey5dyZam4ZxW-rVufefeHCnIqCjwhrkOEAD-LX_po7UON5h4RnI1JfzzeNbmE0rKIG--3z1V9uqBE8Sc7Un7x-eTTcRXLGiP3YQIg8spnTu8Ncuw=&amp;c=xIv_GZE_UC09ZGnZ-Y5AbmG56RsCKCqy7gFt_Vk7uFHFkxQ7uQCc0w==&amp;ch=G4xDfiBMBljIAmsQwaarMrd4Y6M26Xg9kXhSvC7D6b1rsJgV_nSEOg==" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer">visit the social apps lab page</a> for </span><span>examples of Citrus community development based apps). The course itself intends to establish a community of learners, innovators, and explorers who engage with 23 principles of internet culture through missions. The missions include topics aggregation, networking, identity, amplification, and subversion.</span></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
</article>
  </div>

  
  </div>
<div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vuuid-a288328e-e8b7-48f4-9591-e3a783ede338 pane-bundle-video clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-video-file field-type-file field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><div id="file-391" class="file file-video file-video-youtube">

                  <div id="breadcrumb" class="visible-desktop">
            <h2 class="element-invisible">You are here</h2><div class="item-list"><ul class="breadcrumb"><li class="first"><a href="/home">Home</a></li>

<li class="last">Course Spotlight: American Sport Culture and Education</li>
</ul></div>          </div>
                          <div class="page-title">
            <div class="container">
              <h1 class="title">Course Spotlight: American Sport Culture and Education</h1>
            </div>
          </div>
                <div id="page-header">
                                      </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div> <!-- /#pre-content -->
    <div id="main-content" class="container">
        <div id="content" class="col-md-9 col-md-push-3">
      <div id="main" class="main" role="main" tabIndex="-1">
        <div id="main-inner">
            <div class="region region-content">
    
<div class="panel-display boxton clearfix radix-boxton" id="page-page">

  <div class="container-fluid">
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-md-12 radix-layouts-content panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-node-content"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <article class="node node-openberkeley-content-page clearfix">

  
      
  
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><h2><span>Professor Derek Van Rheenen - School of Education</span></h2>
<p>Education 75AC: American Sport Culture and Education</p>
<p><span>Education 75AC focuses on sports culture in the U.S. through an intersectional lens. This course highlights the ways in which sports have contributed to our society as well as how they marginalize certain communities through the bases of race, class, gender, sexuality, and ability.</span></p>
<p><span>As part of ACES (American Cultures Engaged Scholarship), the course also works with campus and community partners such as DSP (Disabled Students Program), the Disability Studies minor, Rec Sports, and BORP (Bay Area Outreach and Recreational Program). </span></p>
<p><span>Find out more about Education 75AC in the video below!</span></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
</article>
  </div>

  
  </div>
<div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vuuid-21a1edc0-b25c-421c-a487-05065a44fac4 pane-bundle-video clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-video-file field-type-file field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><div id="file-385" class="file file-video file-video-youtube">

        <h2 class="element-hidden"><a href="/file/385">#ExploreAC - Education 75AC</a></h2>
    
  
  <div class="content">
    <div class="media-youtube-video media-youtube-1">
  <iframe class="media-youtube-player" id="media-youtube-nkj04as4bnq" width="640" height="390" title="#ExploreAC - Education 75AC" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/nkj04AS4bNQ?wmode=opaque&enablejsapi=1&modestbranding=1&playerapiid=media-youtube-nkj04as4bnq&rel=0" allowfullscreen>Video of #ExploreAC - Education 75AC</iframe>
</div>
  </div>

  
</div>
</div></div></div></div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>

  <div class="block__content">
    <p><span>The American Cultures Center</span><br><span>360 Stephens Hall, MC# 1050 </span><br><span>Berkeley, CA 94720-1050</span></p>

<li class="last leaf menu-link-post-election-teaching-resources"><a href="/faculty/post-election-teaching-resources">Post-Election Teaching Resources</a></li>
</ul>          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </li>
</ul></li>
<li class="expanded menu-fields-menu-link dropdown menu-link-collaborate-"><a href="/collaborate" class="dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown" data-target="#">Collaborate <span class="fa fa-caret-down"></span></a><ul class="dropdown-menu">  <li class="openberkeley-megamenu-wrapper">
    <div class="entity entity-menu-fields menu-fields-main-menu openberkeley-megamenu clearfix">
      <div class="container-fluid">
        <div class="row">
          <div class="col-md-7 hidden-xs hidden-sm openberkeley-megamenu-content-column">
            <div class="field field-name-field-featured-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img class="openberkeley-megamenu" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/openberkeley_megamenu/public/aces-loop-12-ol_v3_0.png?itok=9QecHK71&amp;timestamp=1470417270" width="308" height="205" alt="ACES logo" /></div></div></div>            <div class="field field-name-field-openberkeley-megamenu-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>We provide opportunities for students, faculty and community organizations to collaborate on research-based social justice projects through courses in our American Cultures Engaged Scholarship (ACES) Program.</p></div></div></div>          </div>
          <div class="col-md-5 openberkeley-megamenu-links-column">
            <ul class="menu nav"><li class="expanded menu-link-overview"><a href="/collaborate" aria-label="Overview of Collaborate">Overview</a></li>
<li class="first leaf menu-link-faculty-grants"><a href="/faculty/course-development/ac-faculty-grants" title="">Faculty Grants</a></li>

<li class="last collapsed menu-link-events"><a href="http://events.berkeley.edu/index.php/calendar/sn/ac.html" title="" rel="noreferrer">Events</a></li>

  </li>
</ul></li>
<li class="expanded menu-fields-menu-link dropdown menu-link-archives-"><a href="/events" title="" class="dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown" data-target="#">Archives <span class="fa fa-caret-down"></span></a><ul class="dropdown-menu">  <li class="openberkeley-megamenu-wrapper">
    <div class="entity entity-menu-fields menu-fields-main-menu openberkeley-megamenu clearfix">

<div id="main-wrapper" class="main-wrapper">
    <div id="pre-content" class="container">
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-md-12">
                  <div id="breadcrumb" class="visible-desktop">
            <h2 class="element-invisible">You are here</h2><div class="item-list"><ul class="breadcrumb"><li class="first"><a href="/home">Home</a></li>
<li><a href="/students" title="">Students</a></li>
<li><a href="/students/courses">Courses</a></li>
<li><a href="/students/courses/spotlight-ac-courses">Spotlight on AC Courses</a></li>
<li class="last">Course Spotlight: Engineering, The Environment, and Society</li>
</ul></div>          </div>
                          <div class="page-title">
            <div class="container">
              <h1 class="title">Course Spotlight: Engineering, The Environment, and Society</h1>
            </div>
          </div>
                <div id="page-header">
                                      </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div> <!-- /#pre-content -->
    <div id="main-content" class="container">
        <div id="content" class="col-md-9 col-md-push-3">
      <div id="main" class="main" role="main" tabIndex="-1">
        <div id="main-inner">
            <div class="region region-content">
    
<div class="panel-display boxton clearfix radix-boxton" id="page-page">

  <div class="container-fluid">
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-md-12 radix-layouts-content panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-node-content"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <article class="node node-openberkeley-content-page clearfix">

  
      
  
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><span>This Spring, Dr. Khalid Kadir, </span><span>will be teaching a new ACES course, Engineering 157AC / International and Area Studies 157AC: Engineering, The Environment, and Society at UC Berkeley. The course will challenge students to look beyond the technical elements of their work and recognize the deeply social and political nature of engineering questions. With help from Berkeley Ph.D. student and Chancellor's Public Fellow Lara Cushing, Dr. Kadir has established partnerships with local and regional African-American, Asian-American, and Latino community groups, through which students will have the opportunity to engage in multiple real-world projects affecting these diverse communities. Projects address a variety of environmental and social justice issues including contaminated drinking water, industrial pollution, and air pollution.</span></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
</article>
  </div>

  
  </div>
<div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vuuid-d0ab0e01-995a-40d4-8345-871c44c6d1c2 pane-bundle-video clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-video-file field-type-file field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><div id="file-149" class="file file-video file-video-youtube">

        <h2 class="element-hidden"><a href="/file/149">ACES Faculty Spotlight: Khalid Kadir</a></h2>
    
  
  <div class="content">
    <div class="media-youtube-video media-youtube-1">
  <iframe class="media-youtube-player" id="media-youtube-frsd-kvkg0g" width="640" height="390" title="ACES Faculty Spotlight: Khalid Kadir" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/FrsD-kvKg0g?wmode=opaque&enablejsapi=1&modestbranding=1&playerapiid=media-youtube-frsd-kvkg0g&rel=0" allowfullscreen>Video of ACES Faculty Spotlight: Khalid Kadir</iframe>
</div>
  </div>

  
</div>
</div></div></div></div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
<div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vuuid-90f3cf37-69cd-460f-8331-cfef3c531686 pane-bundle-text clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-basic-text-text field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>While both meeting the American Cultures requirement and as part of the ACES program, Engineering 157AC is set to become a signature course within the College of Engineering.  As stated by Associate Dean for Equity and Inclusion, College of Engineering Oscar Dubon, "The College of Engineering is delighted to offer E157AC.  With this course the College has taken an important step forward in affirming that social justice should play a central role in the preparation of our engineering students.  The course also signals the College's commitment to engage a diverse engineering student body that produces technology leaders and innovators who will tackle challenges faced by all communities in our society.  Dr. Kadir is an outstanding instructor, and we are very fortunate to have him on board."</p>
<div>
<p>This course is part of the American Cultures Engaged Scholarship (ACES) Program bringing the research interests of faculty and community partners together in the teaching of undergraduate courses. Further information and a listing of other ACES courses can be found on our <a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/students/courses/aces-courses">ACES Courses</a> page.</p>
</div></div></div></div></div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>

</div><!-- /.boxton -->
  </div>
        </div>
      </div> <!-- /#main -->
    </div> <!-- /#content -->
        <div id="sidebar-first" class="col-md-3 col-md-pull-9">

  <div class="pane-content">
    <article class="node node-openberkeley-content-page clearfix">

  
      
  
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><h3>Dr. Christopher Schmitt, Lecturer, Integrative Biology<br>Integrative Biology, "Human Biological Variation"</h3>
<p>This AC Faculty Spotlight features, Dr. Christopher Schmitt, Lecturer in Integrative Biology and Postdoctoral Research in the <span>Human Evolution Research Center.  Dr. Schmitt is currently teaching Integrative Biology 35AC, Human Biological Variation.  </span><span> T</span>his course in order to expose the cultural and historical relevance of biology to both students who may never take another biology class in their lives and scientists that have intimate knowledge of their subject but do not discover its connection within larger contexts. The course is innovative in the way it teaches students how biological variation plays a role in day-to-day life-from interactions on the street, to governmental policies on healthcare and food stamps, to how a doctor interacts with her patients.  Please see the video below for an interview with Dr. Schmitt.</p>
<p></p>
<p></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
</article>
  </div>

  
  </div>
<div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vuuid-fa45f552-645f-4712-baa6-6629aabce449 pane-bundle-video clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-video-file field-type-file field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><div id="file-496" class="file file-video file-video-youtube">

<div id="main-wrapper" class="main-wrapper">
    <div id="pre-content" class="container">
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-md-12">
                  <div id="breadcrumb" class="visible-desktop">
            <h2 class="element-invisible">You are here</h2><div class="item-list"><ul class="breadcrumb"><li class="first"><a href="/home">Home</a></li>
<li><a href="/students" title="">Students</a></li>
<li><a href="/students/courses">Courses</a></li>
<li><a href="/students/courses/spotlight-ac-courses">Spotlight on AC Courses</a></li>
<li class="last">Course Spotlight: Social Movements, Urban Histories, and the Politics of Memory</li>
</ul></div>          </div>
                          <div class="page-title">
            <div class="container">
              <h1 class="title">Course Spotlight: Social Movements, Urban Histories, and the Politics of Memory</h1>
            </div>
          </div>
                <div id="page-header">
                                      </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div> <!-- /#pre-content -->
    <div id="main-content" class="container">
        <div id="content" class="col-md-9 col-md-push-3">
      <div id="main" class="main" role="main" tabIndex="-1">
        <div id="main-inner">
            <div class="region region-content">
    
<div class="panel-display boxton clearfix radix-boxton" id="page-page">

  <div class="container-fluid">
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-md-12 radix-layouts-content panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-node-content"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <article class="node node-openberkeley-content-page clearfix">

  
      
  
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p style="text-align:left">This spotlight feature includes American Cultures Engaged Scholarship faculty member Dr. Sean Burns's course "Social Movements, Urban History, and the Politics of Memory" (IAS 158AC / PACS 148 AC).  This course examines the extensive multi-racial social movement history of the San Francisco Bay Area. The primary assignment of the course is a student-defined research project where students, in collaboration with local activists and community partner <a href="http://www.shapingsf.org/" rel="noreferrer">Shaping San Francisco</a>, carry out original research and writing to contribute to the dynamic Bay Area social history website <a href="http://www.shapingsf.org/found-sf.html" rel="noreferrer">FoundSF</a>.</p>
<p style="text-align:left">For this course, Burns has won the Chancellor's Faculty Civic Engagement Award (2014) and the American Cultures Teaching Innovation Award (2015). Combining history, sociology, urban geography, and ethnic studies, the course asks questions such as:</p>
<p style="text-align:left"><img style="float:right" alt="" title="" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/width_400/public/ias1582016.png?itok=2EEE-zhj&amp;timestamp=1473204223"></p>
<ul><li>Why and how these movements emerged?</li>
<li>What cultural, racial, ethnic and political identities were drawn from, reconfigured, and created in these movements?</li>
<li>What kinds of knowledge and institutions were created by these movements? How have these legacies shaped the culture and politics of the area?</li>
</ul><p>For their research projects, students have collaborated with dozens of progressive organizations and activists around the Bay including but not limited to:</p>
<ul><li><a href="http://ipocshellmoundwalk.homestead.com/" rel="noreferrer"><span>Indian People Organizing for Change</span></a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.google.com/url?sa=t&amp;rct=j&amp;q=&amp;esrc=s&amp;source=web&amp;cd=1&amp;cad=rja&amp;uact=8&amp;ved=0ahUKEwihtoiB-f3OAhVQ7GMKHdPkD8MQFggfMAA&amp;url=http%3A%2F%2Fcjjc.org%2F&amp;usg=AFQjCNFB4yWC3D0W1zabok3X7q0UrYMK4A&amp;sig2=D1H5iJ2HhQQo1dWQ1B2Oig" rel="noreferrer"><span>Causa Justa</span></a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.google.com/url?sa=t&amp;rct=j&amp;q=&amp;esrc=s&amp;source=web&amp;cd=1&amp;cad=rja&amp;uact=8&amp;ved=0ahUKEwjU-MaP-f3OAhUG0GMKHRYABQQQFggfMAA&amp;url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.cilberkeley.org%2F&amp;usg=AFQjCNFFq-lBb3cMfI_CCBrSTQt98gLPmQ&amp;sig2=LgQb2KM0p0IHGmP1fgO4Tg" rel="noreferrer"><span>Center for Independent Living</span></a></li>
<li><a href="http://cuido.org/" rel="noreferrer"><span>CUIDO (<span>Communities United in Defense of Olmstead)</span></span></a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.google.com/url?sa=t&amp;rct=j&amp;q=&amp;esrc=s&amp;source=web&amp;cd=1&amp;cad=rja&amp;uact=8&amp;ved=0ahUKEwjqpoui-f3OAhVOzGMKHbjEDa4QFggfMAA&amp;url=http%3A%2F%2Flapena.org%2F&amp;usg=AFQjCNFJq3TCqULOgXfKUZkFPL3cdZZE2Q&amp;sig2=UwawYU7dPA-QoJcecPRDUA" rel="noreferrer"><span>La Peña Cultural Center</span></a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.google.com/url?sa=t&amp;rct=j&amp;q=&amp;esrc=s&amp;source=web&amp;cd=1&amp;cad=rja&amp;uact=8&amp;ved=0ahUKEwiyht_G-f3OAhUM22MKHWIUA7sQFggfMAA&amp;url=http%3A%2F%2Fworkingeastbay.org%2F&amp;usg=AFQjCNE4MxRkUUsmvO0QvcwEYO8-p4dPpA&amp;sig2=JFaZWm_xSeTFSh_uvU3l3g" rel="noreferrer"><span>EBASE (East Bay Alliance for a Sustainable Economy)</span></a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.google.com/url?sa=t&amp;rct=j&amp;q=&amp;esrc=s&amp;source=web&amp;cd=1&amp;cad=rja&amp;uact=8&amp;ved=0ahUKEwiWgMro-f3OAhVK8GMKHXC6DiUQFggfMAA&amp;url=http%3A%2F%2Fcentrolegal.org%2F&amp;usg=AFQjCNF3mqylkhvN8_-kloYQKQUDjo5B7A&amp;sig2=aan3JZlD1bXjnF-koZtauA" rel="noreferrer"><span>Centro Legal De La Raza</span></a><span><br></span></li>
</ul><p><span>Multiple libraries and archives around the Bay– including their brilliant and generous staff – have vitally supported the student research; for example <a href="https://www.google.com/url?sa=t&amp;rct=j&amp;q=&amp;esrc=s&amp;source=web&amp;cd=1&amp;cad=rja&amp;uact=8&amp;ved=0ahUKEwjz3_DD-P3OAhVY7GMKHbN8DiEQFggeMAA&amp;url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.lib.berkeley.edu%2Flibraries%2Fbancroft-library&amp;usg=AFQjCNEAGKqY8LbyaZt3kLkRxBE0nhaLtw&amp;sig2=3GVfqCR3obqT_6ukhSQ-Ag" rel="noreferrer">the Bancroft Library</a>, <a href="https://www.google.com/url?sa=t&amp;rct=j&amp;q=&amp;esrc=s&amp;source=web&amp;cd=1&amp;cad=rja&amp;uact=8&amp;ved=0ahUKEwjh47nL-P3OAhVY62MKHfPrAK8QFggiMAA&amp;url=http%3A%2F%2Feslibrary.berkeley.edu%2F&amp;usg=AFQjCNF2wQLGlkE0k7I9jqsZC9g_57s1_w&amp;sig2=hCkqH5JKT8srriIhDIvReA" rel="noreferrer">UC Berkeley’s Ethnic Studies Library</a>, <a href="https://www.google.com/url?sa=t&amp;rct=j&amp;q=&amp;esrc=s&amp;source=web&amp;cd=1&amp;cad=rja&amp;uact=8&amp;ved=0ahUKEwiptufT9v3OAhVC62MKHV1JAlUQFggeMAA&amp;url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.glbthistory.org%2F&amp;usg=AFQjCNFIyxihbrq73Ex-lVtEVaMcorakQg&amp;sig2=52lZP3OD8SkTb3-VgFVaKQ" rel="noreferrer">the GLBT Historical Society</a>, <a href="https://www.google.com/url?sa=t&amp;rct=j&amp;q=&amp;esrc=s&amp;source=web&amp;cd=1&amp;cad=rja&amp;uact=8&amp;ved=0ahUKEwjp2rrT-P3OAhVN1WMKHXueB-UQFggeMAA&amp;url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.freedomarchives.org%2F&amp;usg=AFQjCNGoPRAgxwKV7ZxjPe6hK3K047i9hw&amp;sig2=lfMwJ9VYt5jsviLnBjxwYA" rel="noreferrer">the Freedom Archives</a>, <a href="https://www.google.com/url?sa=t&amp;rct=j&amp;q=&amp;esrc=s&amp;source=web&amp;cd=1&amp;cad=rja&amp;uact=8&amp;ved=0ahUKEwi_8LLZ-P3OAhUB4WMKHXdzDXwQFggeMAA&amp;url=https%3A%2F%2Fkpfa.org%2F&amp;usg=AFQjCNHh_MivcsRjXqYunK9qk2wwh0Yt7A&amp;sig2=hk-z6dfLlr-4x-L4ETG6sA" rel="noreferrer">KPFA</a>, <a href="https://www.google.com/url?sa=t&amp;rct=j&amp;q=&amp;esrc=s&amp;source=web&amp;cd=1&amp;cad=rja&amp;uact=8&amp;ved=0ahUKEwiCyLff-P3OAhXJKGMKHZ6NC-kQFggeMAA&amp;url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.docspopuli.org%2F&amp;usg=AFQjCNFO0D5E5ed7zAxPO89HR2deMzfp6g&amp;sig2=5WUkySWoCOn_k_RP5HqSKQ" rel="noreferrer">Docs Populi</a>, and <a href="https://www.google.com/url?sa=t&amp;rct=j&amp;q=&amp;esrc=s&amp;source=web&amp;cd=1&amp;cad=rja&amp;uact=8&amp;ved=0ahUKEwivhYnm-P3OAhVU2WMKHc8MAXwQFggfMAA&amp;url=http%3A%2F%2Flibrary.sfsu.edu%2Flarc&amp;usg=AFQjCNG-EfTt-Jo3_Km4WectJXkgrPh6sg&amp;sig2=B8PKKn3omrUSBTRuRniPzw" rel="noreferrer">SF State’s Labor Archives and Research Center</a>. For read examples of student projects, please visit the </span><a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/community-engagement/student-projects/international-area-studies" rel="noreferrer">IAS Student Projects</a><span> page or FoundSF’s archive on </span><a href="http://www.foundsf.org/index.php?title=Category:Bay_Area_Social_Movements" rel="noreferrer">Bay Area Social Movements</a><span>.</span></p>
<hr><p>The East Bay Express has written two stories highlighting Burns’ course:</p>
<p>April 2015: "<a href="http://www.eastbayexpress.com/oakland/making-history/Content?oid=4260987" rel="noreferrer">Making History</a>” </p>
<p>April 2015: "<a href="http://www.eastbayexpress.com/oakland/making-history/Content?oid=4260987" rel="noreferrer">Tumbling the Ivory Tower</a>”</p>
<p><a href="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/general/2016_aces_syllabus_burns.pdf" rel="noreferrer">Download a copy</a> of the most recent syllabus for “Social Movements, Urban History, and the Politics of Memory.”</p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
</article>
  </div>

  
  </div>
<div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vuuid-93946f56-308e-42f3-b4bc-7238ec6ef79a pane-bundle-video clearfix"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="fieldable-panels-pane">
    <div class="field field-name-field-video-file field-type-file field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><div id="file-389" class="file file-video file-video-youtube">

          <div class="col-md-5 openberkeley-megamenu-links-column">
            <ul class="menu nav"><li class="expanded menu-link-overview"><a href="/students" title="" aria-label="Overview of Students">Overview</a></li>

          <div class="col-md-5 openberkeley-megamenu-links-column">

<li class="expanded menu-fields-menu-link dropdown menu-link-faculty-"><a href="/faculty" title="" class="dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown" data-target="#">Faculty <span class="fa fa-caret-down"></span></a><ul class="dropdown-menu">  <li class="openberkeley-megamenu-wrapper">
    <div class="entity entity-menu-fields menu-fields-main-menu openberkeley-megamenu clearfix">
      <div class="container-fluid">
        <div class="row">
          <div class="col-md-7 hidden-xs hidden-sm openberkeley-megamenu-content-column">
            <div class="field field-name-field-featured-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img class="openberkeley-megamenu" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/openberkeley_megamenu/public/shiftcourse_hero_836px_c.jpg?itok=A1pRkJrF&amp;timestamp=1469833877" width="308" height="205" alt="" /></div></div></div>            <div class="field field-name-field-openberkeley-megamenu-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>The American Cultures Center is proud to offer faculty exciting opportunities such as the possibility to receive a grant to continue, or create an American Cultures course, be awarded for excellence in teaching, and even become a Chancellor's Public Scholar! </p></div></div></div>          </div>
          <div class="col-md-5 openberkeley-megamenu-links-column">
            <ul class="menu nav"><li class="expanded menu-link-overview"><a href="/faculty" title="" aria-label="Overview of Faculty">Overview</a></li>

  </li>

<li class="expanded menu-fields-menu-link dropdown menu-link-collaborate-"><a href="/collaborate" class="dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown" data-target="#">Collaborate <span class="fa fa-caret-down"></span></a><ul class="dropdown-menu">  <li class="openberkeley-megamenu-wrapper">
    <div class="entity entity-menu-fields menu-fields-main-menu openberkeley-megamenu clearfix">
      <div class="container-fluid">
        <div class="row">
          <div class="col-md-7 hidden-xs hidden-sm openberkeley-megamenu-content-column">
            <div class="field field-name-field-featured-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img class="openberkeley-megamenu" src="https://americancultures.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/openberkeley_megamenu/public/aces-loop-12-ol_v3_0.png?itok=9QecHK71&amp;timestamp=1470417270" width="308" height="205" alt="ACES logo" /></div></div></div>            <div class="field field-name-field-openberkeley-megamenu-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>We provide opportunities for students, faculty and community organizations to collaborate on research-based social justice projects through courses in our American Cultures Engaged Scholarship (ACES) Program.</p></div></div></div>          </div>
          <div class="col-md-5 openberkeley-megamenu-links-column">

        <div id="content" class="">
      <div id="main" class="main" role="main" tabIndex="-1">
        <div id="main-inner">
            <div class="region region-content">
    
<div class="panel-display boxton clearfix radix-boxton-hero mvpcreator-theme-full-width" >

    <div class="mvpcreator-theme-container-full-width">
      <div class="row">
      <div class="col-sm-12 radix-layouts-hero panel-panel">
        <div class="panel-panel-inner">
          <div class="panel-pane pane-fieldable-panels-pane pane-vuuid-f45c3660-d0d2-49b2-80cf-9a525a473deb pane-bundle-openberkeley-widgets-band clearfix"  >

    <div class="openberkeley-widgets-label-inner container">
      <h2>Frequently Asked Questions</h2>
